jobDescription: | Welcome to EA's Experience Organization (XO)! We define and deliver experiences in and around our games that connect, grow and enrich how fans engage with EA. The XO represents our Marketing and Positive Play teams, as well as Customer Experience and EAX, coming together to create consistently awesome experiences for our fans. Our Marketing team focuses on making every touchpoint with our brands consistently awesome, everywhere - in the game, outside the game and on any screen. Our Positive Play Group focuses on expanding the positive power of play, helping players feel welcome, safe and rewarded every time they play. Together, these teams develop the strategic vision of our products, run world class multi-channel campaigns, execute on global engagement across all touch points, develop global insights, and drive sales and global publishing. We understand the dynamic global landscape so we can deliver relevant content, promotions, and help to players anywhere. We foster an environment where our teams can deliver the most amazing work of their career while inspiring the world to play. We've created this application form to connect with YOU , attendees of the ADCOLOR 2022 Conference, who are interested in learning more about our roles, across all our locations. Your profile may be linked to a specific job upon further review. You can view all our open roles at https://www.ea.com/careers . We look forward to connecting with you!

We are looking for an Advanced Data Analyst to join our Apex Mobile team. You will focus on modelling user data and delivering business insights to influence strategic decisions for the title. You will report to the Senior Manager, Analytics Responsibilities Provide recommendations on solutions to analytics needs using player data from multiple sources Navigate ambiguous problems, determine causes and constraints, translate qualitative/quantitative data into applicable insight, and create recommendations / outcomes Improve the studio's data maturity through creation of powerful self-serve tools and training non-data-professionals in their use Design, implement and validate modern algorithms to analyze diverse sources of data to achieve targeted outcomes Requirements 5-8 years experience in an analytical role performing quantitative analysis with big data 3+ years experience managing your own deliverables and producing high quality results, building analytics plans with clear deliverables, ownership, and communication plans A Masters degree or Ph.D. in a quantitative discipline (Statistics, mathematics, engineering, economics), or equivalent experience Proficient in SQL and ability to extract data from large data sources with differing structures Proficiency with a statistical analysis tool (such as R or Python) to perform analysis Experience defining goals, their associated reporting, and communicating their interpretation to the business Experience leading and coaching presentations to wide audience of diverse skillsets, including senior management Considered a Plus Experience defining telemetry schemas for Mobile or HD games Experience developing dashboards and data models within Looker Passion for playing and thinking about games

We are EA And we make games – how cool is that? In fact, we entertain millions of people across the globe with the most amazing and immersive interactive software in the industry. Making games is challenging. That's why we employ the most creative, passionate people in the industry. The Challenge Ahead The EA Digital Platform Data & AI Group provides unified Artificial Intelligence (AI) resources across all franchises within Electronic Arts. Our group develops state-of-the-art machine learning, AI, and data-driven solutions to game team problems, and common AI infrastructure for use in every facet of the company. From data modeling to agent building, we use a modern, cloud-based tech stack with excellent tools to provide solutions and platforms empowering the future of game development and player experience. We're looking for an AI Scientist to join our team! What An AI Scientist Intern Does At EA Develop state-of-the-art algorithms and extract essential insights from EA's rich store of data to empower intelligent agents within the EA ecosystem Create scalable solutions for problems in the gaming domain Develop and evaluate new AI applications for content creation, NPC behavior, game balance evaluation, and recommendations Work with the core development teams to deploy AI applications as part of production systems Establish scalable, efficient, automated processes for enterprise-level management of AI applications Research and implement novel AI approaches for new problems. The next great EA AI Scientist has Be in pursuit of a PhD or MS with experience in Computer Science, or related fields (focus in AI or ML) Experience having developed novel AI algorithms, and major journal and conference publications Strong programming skills (object-oriented and functional paradigms) Experience with large-scale data and distributed systems – Experience with Apache Hadoop, Spark, and Tensorflow Experience with SQL and MPP databases Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Electronic Arts Inc. is a leading global interactive entertainment software company. EA delivers games, content and online services for Internet-connected consoles, personal computers, mobile phones and tablets. Create Animation is one of EA's central teams, responsible for bringing characters and performances to life across all of EA's franchises. Led by veterans from film and game industries, we work on award-winning franchises in partnership with teams like Maxis (The Sims), BioWare (Mass Effect, Dragon Age), Respawn (Jedi: Fallen Order, Apex Legends), EA Sports (FIFA, Madden) and other high profile game teams! We work on a diverse catalog of games across many different animation styles, from realistic to stylized, from humans to creatures. You Will Create and implement character animation using mocap, keyframe and in engine tools Animate winged creatures Iterate and refine animation based on both aesthetics and feel Collaborate with Designers, Technical Animators, Programmers, VFX Artists, Audio Designers, and Production Partners to fully realize a character in game Work with our Outsource Animation Director to provide feedback to external partners Qualifications 2+ years of related industry experience. A diploma or degree in Fine Arts, Animation, Graphic Design, or equivalent experience Strong traditional animation skills and the ability apply them to gameplay systems Proficiency in Maya or similar software Proficiency in runtime engine animation workflows A degree in Fine Arts, Animation, Graphic Design, or related diploma Demo Reel All submissions must include a demo reel showing personal or professional artwork. Demo reel must be submitted as a link on resume.

Electronic Arts is looking for high performing students to join our world-class internship experience. Summer 2023 will be better than ever as we bring all interns together on-site for orientation week and prep students for the future ways of work by offering remote and hybrid opportunities depending on your location. For more information about our Next-Gen Program, visit https://www.ea.com/careers/interns-and-university-graduates Our Marketing Team exists to tell the story of Electronic Arts and expand the positive power of play. This encompasses all our amazing games and experiences, including The Sims, Madden NFL, FIFA, Apex Legends, Battlefield 2042, and It Takes Two (Game of the Year, 2021). At the forefront of building meaningful relationships with our players around the world, we’re a multi-functional group driven by social purpose and inclusive values. We develop the strategic vision of our products, run world class multi-channel campaigns, execute on innovative global engagement across all touch points, and make sure our brand is consistently awesome everywhere we show up. The Design Intern will be responsible for creating logos, illustrated graphics, moodboards, sketches, key art, campaigns and other elements for visual identities that reach a global audience. They will also shadow various franchise creative leads, learning things like craft, design process and presentation skills. The role will contribute to a major EA franchise such as Apex Legends, Battlefield, the Sims, or Star Wars. We are only considering students who will be enrolled in a Bachelor's or Master's program in the summer of 2023 and are slated to graduate in Fall of 2023 or Spring of 2024. About The Role Primary Responsibilities You will create visual design solutions (Color, Logo, Graphic Elements, Typography) for a major EA franchise. Create a range of exploration based on a provided brief and strategy. Collaborate with other departments (Production, Campaign, Adaptation) to ensure work is on brand and delivered in a timely manner. Learning a variety of approaches when designing brand identities. Work closely with the design team to improve real-world experience and skillset. Required Qualifications Currently enrolled in a college, university degree program Available to work full-time hours for 10-12 weeks during summer 2023 Authorized to work in the U.S. Experience creating brand identities and style guides Baseline understanding of Adobe creative suite Experience with presentation design (Keynote, Google slides), animation, Illustration or 3D Modeling software is a plus. Passion for graphic design and games! Application Requirements 01 — Please answer the following questions: Why do you want to be a designer? What does good design mean to you? Why are you passionate to learn about gaming? How would you like to impact the world through design? 02 — Design portfolio with any examples of the below to showcase capabilities. Provide a link to an online presentation, or attach pdf/jpeg documents to your resume to showcase your work. Logo brand identities Style guides Marketing or advertising campaigns Web design Social media content Illustration or 3d work is a plus

Brand Marketing Associate (12 Months Contract) We’re Electronic Arts’ Marketing, Commercial, and Positive Play Organization (MCP). Our teams build meaningful relationships with hundreds of millions of players around the world who love our games. We aim to be the best at meeting players where they are and supporting them throughout their EA journey. Our teams develop the strategic vision of our games; execute multi-channel campaigns; build global engagement; develop global insights; and we accelerate sales and publishing efforts worldwide. Most importantly, we do all of this by understanding – and celebrating – the diversity of our players, so we can deliver the content they want when and where they want it. The Strategic Growth Brand team sits at the corner of disruption and innovation, helping fuel Electronic Arts’ long term strategic bets and growth. We set the course for EA’s investment in gaming subscriptions, our PC storefront and platform, competitive gaming (including FIFA, Apex Legends, and Madden NFL), as well as new business opportunities including fantasy sports, blockchain and NFTs, and more. As a Brand Marketing Associate, you will work closely with the Sr. Marketing Manager on all marketing activations and partner with individual franchise and channel teams to integrate relevant beats into their franchise campaigns and marketing. You will report to Sr Marketing Manager, Strategic Brand Growth. Responsibilities Participate in holistic planning, coordination and project management of marketing activations for our subscriptions, PC products and services. Support commercial and studio teams with subscriber benefits activations. Partner with internal and external stakeholders to run channel marketing campaigns. Act as POC for EA Play Social channels across all EA Play and franchise beats including maintaining a social calendar, writing social media copy, posting across channels and coordinating with franchise social teams Help strategize service-level beats and partner with franchise marketing to support execution of franchise-specific beats. Participate in weekly meetings and follow-up to track beat readiness, evaluating risk and opportunity. Track progress on channel activations, creative ideation, and content plans to ensure projects stay on point, have proper approvals and execute on time. Provide campaign tracking and performance data. Qualifications 5+ years of brand marketing, activation, and campaign execution experience. You have experience with subscriptions services and/or member retention programs. You love to manage projects, take direction well and offer solutions. You have a solid understanding of integrated omni-channel consumer facing campaigns.

EA - ENTERTAINING IS OUR PASSION You're probably familiar with many of our titles - Madden, FIFA, The Sims, Need for Speed, Dead Space, Battlefield and Star Wars, to name a few. But maybe you don't know how we're committed to creating games for every platform - from social to mobile to console - to give our consumers that anytime, anywhere access they demand. What does that mean for you? It means more opportunities to unleash your creative genius, be inspired by those around you and ignite your path in any direction you choose. COMMERCIAL ORGANIZATION Our teams build meaningful relationships with hundreds of millions of players around the world who love our games. We aim to be the best at meeting players where they are and supporting them throughout their EA journey. Our teams develop the strategic vision of our games; build multi-channel campaigns to drive global engagement; develop global insights; and we accelerate sales and publishing efforts worldwide. Most importantly, we do all of this by understanding – and celebrating – the diversity of our players, so we can provide the content they want as they want it. The Global Commercial Organization guides the global commercial success of EA around the world through: Responsible for revenue: We develop and execute plans to deliver revenue targets across the business and ensure they adapt to market changes. Commercial operators: We're operationally responsible for delivering our games and millions of assets to many partners throughout the world. Industry/competitive insights: We are responsible for bringing commercial insights to the strategic, long range and operational planning process across EA Commercial Partnerships: We are the global commercial organization that manages all of our commercial partnerships, including physical, digital, platform and brand. Commercial focus on our markets: We're accountable for ensuring we understand our markets, including local player understanding, competitive activities, as well as business model and distribution dynamics Job Description Main Purpose of the Role Reporting to the Commercial Intelligence Director, the Commercial Intelligence Manager will work on EA Games Franchises to create recommendations and support decision making surrounding development and execution of key titles in all lifecycle stages. In addition, the Commercial Intelligence Manager with lead and support industry analysis and reporting for various purposes, and will vet and maintain data to support the analysis Key Duties And Responsibilities Develop and support commercial recommendations for games all stages of product lifecycle Execute industry analysis to support strategic planning at the corporate and studio level, planning for commercial and finance, and inform executives and key teams on various topics Lead/execute topic/title deep dives Data vetting/maintenance, upgrades Attitude/Knowledge Required Solution oriented, creative problem solver A team player able to work collaboratively within the group and across business units/functions High Intellectual curiosity Eager to dig into data and willing to do the work required to compile and test the data Flexible and adaptable while maintaining positive attitude Self-starter with passion, energy, enthusiasm to drive results and changes Skills Required Bachelor's degree required; MBA /MS Strong communication skills - Ability to communicate complex subjects to a broad audience Strong analytical skills Experience in gathering insights from disparate sources and combining them into compelling business cases and strategic goals Willing to learn and master additional coding languages (SQL, Python or R)

In addition, the Commercial Intelligence Manager with lead and support industry analysis and reporting for various purposes, and will vet and maintain data to support the analysis Key Duties And Responsibilities Develop and support commercial recommendations for games all stages of product lifecycle Execute industry analysis to support strategic planning at the corporate and studio level, planning for commercial and finance, and inform executives and key teams on various topics Lead/execute topic/title deep dives Data vetting/maintenance, upgrades Attitude/Knowledge Required Solution oriented, creative problem solver A team player able to work collaboratively within the group and across business units/functions High Intellectual curiosity Eager to dig into data and willing to do the work required to compile and test the data Flexible and adaptable while maintaining positive attitude Self-starter with passion, energy, enthusiasm to drive results and changes Skills Required Bachelor's degree required; MBA /MS Strong communication skills - Ability to communicate complex subjects to a broad audience Strong analytical skills Experience in gathering insights from disparate sources and combining them into compelling business cases and strategic goals Willing to learn and master additional coding languages (SQL, Python or R)

Compensation And Benefits Attorney Electronic Arts Inc. is a global leader in interactive entertainment. We develop and deliver games, content and online services across platforms. We have a broad portfolio of brands that span the most popular genres. We exist to Inspire the World to Play. We create extraordinary new game experiences for our millions of players everywhere by bringing together talented people that combine creativity, innovation, and passion. We immerse our employees into an inclusive culture and provide opportunities for learning and leading that allow our employees to do the most impactful and rewarding work of their careers. We are looking for a Compensation and Benefits Attorney to provide primary support on a wide range of compensation and employee benefits matters. You will report to EA's Vice President, Legal Affairs. We are flexible as to which EA office you work from on a hybrid basis and we will consider fully remote for the right candidate. Join us in driving the next revolution in games. Responsibilities You will advise on executive and broad-based compensation plans and programs and assist with the preparation of Compensation Committee materials and related corporate governance matters. You will partner closely with internal stakeholders on short- and long-term incentive plans, periodic SEC executive compensation disclosures, annual Compensation Discussion & Analysis, Say-on-Pay, stockholder proposals, and other proxy disclosures. You will provide legal support for equity compensation plans and programs and the stock administration team, including oversight of international stock plan compliance matters. You will partner with the People Experience team on the legal requirements for employee benefit plans and programs (including 401(k), health and welfare, deferred compensation, leave of absence, severance, and other benefits). You will provide legal support for the global benefits team, including review of plan documents, summary plan descriptions, and employee communications, and assist with routine and ad hoc reporting. You will advise on compensation and benefits matters for M&A transactions. Qualifications Practicing attorney with 5+ years' experience in Compensation and Benefits law in a law firm and/or in-house legal department. Knowledge of and experience with ERISA, HIPAA, federal tax and securities laws, including IRC, '33 and '34 Acts, Sarbanes-Oxley and Dodd-Frank is required, and general familiarity with applicable foreign laws related to employee stock plans is preferable. Flexibility and willingness to work on a broad variety of legal matters. Excellent interpersonal, oral/written communication and presentation skills. Team player with the ability to collaborate with internal legal colleagues, outside legal advisors, and business partners. Hard working, high integrity, excellent judgment, well organized and able to manage numerous projects simultaneously under deadline pressure; flexible and willing to work extended hours when needed. J.D. and State Bar membership required. We love to celebrate our great perks like comprehensive health and benefit packages, tuition reimbursement, 401k with company match, of course, free video games and more!

jobDescription: What The Senior Data Analyst Will Do At EA The Data Analyst will focus on improving data capabilities and business intelligence for our Quality verification teams, astute at spotting patterns, identifying risk and opportunity and convey complex concepts, using game data to improve our Development and Quality Verification strategies. You will report to the Development Manager of Analytics. You will prepare detailed reports and presentations that help your team identify essential areas of opportunity and insight to guide future design. You will evaluate and interpret data to find risks and opportunities, relaying them to the team and management. You will connect with multiple data providers and customers in the organization, specifically in the development of data requests, checking of data received and following up on data issues. You will conduct analysis using SQL and other database tools. You will guide best practices in tools and visual technologies to help evolve the project dashboards to provide essential data for project monitoring. You will develop scripts and queries to import and manipulate clean data from multiple sources. You will help us promote a data-driven culture and lead data governance practices to support us in our Organization's data transformation. You will be a champion for data quality by creating data quality policies and monitoring tools. You will mentor Data Analysts from a technical perspective. The Next Great Data Analyst Needs 5+ years of professional analytical experience, using data to improve processes. Programming and Database experienced with advanced SQL experience and efficient in Python. Knowledge of different data software analytics and visualization tools such as New Relic, Tableau and PowerBI. Build data modeling and understand data warehousing. An enthusiasm for creating solutions involving all team members. Excited to manage processes to increase efficiency on behalf of the team. Develop relationships with development partners, customers, support teams and management.

Are you a self-starter? Always want to build a solution from 0 to 1 and are interested in solving a challenging but meaningful problem to make an impact with your work? Then, this highly visible role is a great opportunity! What the Data Scientist, Infrastructure Optimization will do at EA: In the Infrastructure Optimization team, we are building a cross-functional team to tackle some of the most complex and exciting infrastructure capacity and cost management challenges to support player availability across our EA universe, drive infrastructure efficiency, and help support our sustainability goal. As a Data Scientist, you will be involved in the product development life cycle from brainstorming ideas to designing quality interactive data visualizations that deal with data complexity with elegance. If you are someone who is passionate about transforming raw data into elegant data driven visualizations and has a vision for what an excellent data culture should be then you are in the right place. This role is located in North America. Responsibilities Your work will generate tools and insights across the Infrastructure Cost management lifecycle to scale data sight creation, provide actionable cost optimization insights, and help automate our Infra Cost Management workflow by leveraging and integrating data analytics and DS tools. You will be integral to the Infra Optimization practices transformation - from ideation and research to launch and iteration. Design and develop data products around Infra Cost Management to improve forecast accuracy, reduce ad-hoc processes, and increase data-driven insights. Promote automation of repetitive tasks and the creation of tools over ad hoc analyses, making your insights available to anyone that can benefit from them. Provide Cost Optimization Automation & Analytics solutions by quickly gaining a deep understanding of the business and how data flows throughout the organization. Build close relationships with business stakeholders and act as a liaison between business users and data engineers to understand business issues and deliver scalable end-to-end solutions that ensure accurate business insights. Work with big data solutions, data modeling, understand the ETL pipelines and business intelligence solutions Maintain airflow pipelines, and backfill/fix data issues when needed Interface with other technology teams and business subject matter experts to extract, transform, and load data from a wide variety of data sources. Requirements Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience in Computer Science, Statistics, Information Science, Engineering, Economics, or in other related fields Good judgment balancing art and science when visually communicating information (Tableau, Superset, ggplot, D3) Advanced Proficiency in writing SQL queries and knowledge of cloud-based databases like Snowflake, Redshift, BigQuery or other big data solutions Proficiency with analytics programming languages (Python, R, etc.) Experience in data modeling, ETL processes, and data warehousing, preferably had setup/maintain Airflow jobs before A firm foundation in data analysis basics, including regression and classification models, experiment design, time series modeling, and hypothesis testing Experience developing and leading presentations to wide audience of diverse skill sets, including senior management

Electronic Arts Inc. is a global leader in interactive entertainment. We exist to Inspire the World to Play. We create extraordinary new game experiences for our millions of players everywhere by bringing together people that combine creativity, innovation, and passion. We immerse our employees into an inclusive culture and provide opportunities for learning and leading that allow our employees to do the most impactful and rewarding work of their careers. Design Analysts' role on the EA Baton Rouge team. This job includes translating test plan information into functional test cases for the team, creating testing templates for recurring features, importing and exporting test case information in task databases, clarifying testing requirements for the test team, communicating with partner studies to align testing requirements, tracking and reporting test case creation status in Jira, maintaining high knowledge of the historic feature testing on the project, and investigating more efficient testing methods. You will report to one of our ADMs (Associate Development Managers). As a Design Analyst, Your Primary Responsibilities Would Be You will use our Jira dashboards to track information provided by the development partners. Interpret the general test plans that we are given by our development team and create test cases based on them. You will keep track of changes to the features that they are assigned, updating the appropriate test cases, and communicating to our partners that the updates have been addressed. You will communicate with their ADM about which features they are creating test cases for and what is in progress. You will provide clarity and update test case information when the test team is unable to complete a test case with the information that was originally provided. The Design Analyst team communicates between our development partners, ADMs, and QA testers for anything related to test case creation and clarity. Potential candidates for this position will need the following experience and skillsets: High school diploma or equivalent Excellent time and task management Excel (can maintain complex spreadsheets with specific formatting) Great reading comprehension skills Skill in tracking information across multiple sources

Development Director II - Ridgeline Games Ridgeline Games is focused on building rich narrative campaigns with memorable characters and powerful experiences all in the Battlefield universe. We are building a new studio in the Seattle area composed of leaders and talent with a vast array of AAA game dev experience. As we assemble our diverse team, all who have a voice in making great games together, we're looking for a healthy mixture of tempered veterans and young passionate individuals eager to make a difference. Role Overview: Reporting to the Sr. Development Director we are looking for a Development Director II to manage one of our most exciting games - Battlefield! You are right for this role if you are passionate about solving difficult and fast-moving problems. You can collaborate, often across departments and with peers or partners in other parts of the business. Your greatest strengths are building relationships, strategic thinking, and execution. You like to be challenged and thinking about the future excites you. Responsibilities Work with the project leadership team to establish the strategy to meet milestones and important deliverables. Work with creative, development, and operations partners to ensure that quality, budgets and timelines are met. Help develop an inclusive and diverse team culture based on openness, trust and collaboration. Develop project indicators that track project quality, delivery, and predictability. Inspire fresh thinking and new ideas to ensure the team has the best organizational structure and processes that allow them to produce high-quality work on time and on budget. Promote knowledge sharing, learning, reconciling conflicting goals, sharing resources amongst your team. Identification, assessment, and prioritization of risks followed by a coordinated application of resources to minimize and manage risks. Qualifications 5+ years of professional experience as a project manager, with experience in shipping AAA games. Skilled leader who can challenge and influence a variety of partners across all levels of organization. Self-starter who builds trusted relationships, influences decisions and urgency on important priorities. Passionate, you care about the creative process, your teams, and delivering the highest quality software to our fans. Excellent change management skills, i.e., comfortable with ambiguity and constant change, yet able to set priorities and work commitments. Have passion, energy, enthusiasm to achieve results. Self-reflective; acknowledge own experience and experiences of others. Strategic thinker, you can think big picture and lead accordingly. Benefits We are proud of the great perks we offer like comprehensive health and benefit packages, tuition reimbursement, 401k with company match, and of course, free video games. And since we realize it takes world-class people to make world-class games, we offer competitive compensation packages and a culture that values creativity and individuality.

Join Us! Pogo has been the leader in online casual games since 1998. Featuring a growing library of 60+ titles spanning popular genres like Solitaire, Mahjong, Match 3, and more, Pogo exists to be the best destination for online casual games. We strive to produce high-quality HTML5-powered games with sophisticated metagames and social mechanics, all while working seamlessly across desktop, tablet and mobile. Our fans and subscribers come to Pogo for fresh content, daily challenges, great events, new games, and a live service that delivers! About This Position As a Development Director (DD), reporting to the Operations Director, you'll drive planning and execution on a cross-functional development team to build and ship software in a live service environment. This is a leadership role that involves a high level of interaction with team members, peers, and product leadership. DD's focus on solving problems, and making things work (or work better). You will maintain the project release schedule and support the games and live service teams for Pogo. Responsibilities Create project schedules that maximize feature quality and scope within resource, financial, and licensor constraints Validate task length, discipline, and dependencies Manage risk Build a capable team that looks for opportunities to operate at their potential and take pride in their accomplishments Keep the team informed of the schedule and changes Train the team on best practices, processes, and standards Meet commitments, hold team accountable Monitor level of effort and provide feedback to individuals Evaluate individual performance and potential of team members, provide appropriate recognition or constructive feedback Form close working relationships with discipline leads, provide regular coaching Resolve issues, balance priorities, and find creative solutions that achieve results Identify, assign, and track development and organizational issues to completion Report status at regular intervals, escalate urgent issues Participate in discussions with directors and studio leadership Requirements 6+ years in a project management role within the software development industry Solid foundation in project management (including Agile methodologies) Understanding of the software development life cycle Experience working with JIRA, Hansoft, or similar tool 4+ years in a team leadership role, with exceptional management skills Interest in learning and applying new concepts High degree of initiative, looks for opportunities to make improvements Comfortable presenting and working with groups Excellent documentation and writing ability Bachelor's degree in a related field Assets Game development experience (especially full cycle experience on shipped titles) PMI, CSM, or LSS certifications

Electronic Arts is looking for high performing students to join our world-class internship experience. Summer 2023 will be better than ever as we bring all interns together on-site for orientation week and prep students for the future ways of work by offering remote and hybrid opportunities depending on your location. For more information about our Next-Gen Program, visit https://www.ea.com/careers/interns-and-university-graduates We’re hiring an Digital Media Intern for our online channels within the Digital Service Delivery team. This role is responsible for coordinating and centrally tracking project and change management deliverables as we execute improvement and innovation driven through our service and product design initiatives as well as other continuous improvement projects. This role guides prioritization and spots opportunities for enhancements across digital channels, as well as identifies roadblocks and challenges to executional excellence. This role is part of EA’s Customer Experience organization. The Customer Experience organization strives to make EA known for taking care of its players. We’re players taking care of players and people talking to people – whenever, wherever, and however they need us. The Digital Media Intern has a proven track record of successfully guiding complex programs from conception to completion. You will be a part of the Digital Channel Service Delivery team that encompasses EA community forums, social support, and the Publishing & Optimization team responsible for the EA Help website. You’ll manage strategic initiatives and a program roadmap to keep the teams on track to meet our goals, and aligned with the larger online strategy. So how does the Digital Media Intern make great experiences for players? They: works with the Digital Service Delivery team managers to keep track of goals, create roadmaps, and sets milestones to achieve their goals drives programs through each stage of the greenlighting and lifecycle process defines KPIs for success and tracks them to ensure programs are on target and effective develops proposals for new programs or program advancement looks for opportunities to connect the online experience across multiple digital spaces: forums, social, and web collaborates with our service design team to eliminate friction in the web user journey and keep EA fans at the center of everything we do collaborates with stakeholders across the organization to identify needs and pain points, then develops plans to address them communicates changes in program status, deliverables, and key dates to all stakeholders designs and documents program processes and frameworks for how we work eliminates barriers that prevent the team from doing their best work tracks resource allocation to ensure we have what we need to complete the work on time and on budget If This Role Is For You, Then You Are a multi-tasker extraordinaire – you can handle multiple things coming your way at the same time collaborative – you play nicely with others and can work across multiple teams to find solutions pragmatic - you approach lofty goals by breaking them down into steps and setting milestones to achieve them a dots connector – you love a good puzzle and can take complex ideas and identify dependencies, risks, and opportunities a confident communicator – you present and share information in a way that your audience can easily understand, whether they are new hires or senior leaders detail-oriented – you pay attention to the little things, have strong organizational skills, and always follow through If you’re interested in this role, you’ll need these skills or experiences : interest in program management and digital content management or publishing, web optimization, or user journey analysis working toward your BA in Business, Marketing or other related discipline. Must be graduating no earlier than December 2023. strong Project Management skills, especially scheduling and time management and critical-thinking skills passion for creating world-class digital experiences ability to adapt quickly to new technology polished in presentation and communication highly organized and detail-oriented with an exceptional sense of accountability ability to manage multiple projects and creative ideas in a fast-paced environment research skills, including the ability to interpret insights and data and then translate that data into actionable results a strong sense of personal integrity, contributing to a culture that values diversity in the workplace game, entertainment, or technology industry experience is helpful, but not required

jobTitle: Director, Finance - Casual/Lifestyle Mobile Studios FP&A
jobDescription: Director, Finance - Casual & Lifestyle Mobile Studios FP&A #WeAreEA and we exist to inspire the world to play. EA values creativity, pioneering, passion, determination, learning, and teamwork. We mean things like acting with curiosity, speaking up with original ideas, and committing to each other as one team. We're looking for all the best kinds of people to make great experiences for our players. We celebrate diversity and inclusion by creating a place where you can come to work and be yourself. Role Overview: Our Financial Planning and Analysis (FP&A) team provides strategic and financial partnership to EA's Leadership team. We achieve this through engaging with our partners to understand our broad strategy, analyzing data, and delivering insights to guide EA's performance. You will lead business support for EA Mobile's Casual and Lifestyle studios as a collaborative & trusted advisor to leadership, driving reporting and rhythm of the business. These studios develop games for a strategic player base and need an experienced partner to help guide these businesses forward. You are able to navigate across a matrixed structure and engage with senior executives. Knowledge of the gaming industry, especially free to play business models, advertising and user acquisition would be beneficial. You will report to the VP of FP&A, EA Mobile Studios. Key Responsibilities Provide financial guidance and strategic partnership to Casual and Lifestyle teams Lead the financial planning process, including the long-range, annual, and quarterly planning cycles. Provide strategic advice and financial rigor, ensuring the implications of business decisions are understood & aligned with profitability goals. Manage the studio P&L and influence product decisions to maximize the health of the business. This includes partnership with multiple partners on live service revenue forecasts, user acquisition plans, and managing development budgets. Manage risks and opportunities to maintain financial goals. Create P&L modeling and evaluate opportunities in support of new product incubation. Lead strategic projects and support senior leadership on ad hoc projects Manage three direct reports. Experience / Capabilities 10 or more years in mid-to-senior level finance roles. Experience evaluating performance metrics and implementing action plans Healthy impatience for change. Willingness to ask the tough questions and ensure partner agreement on complex decision points. Demonstrates initiative, flexibility, maturity under pressure & anticipates and resolves problems proactively. Ability to resolve complex business issues, ability to move beyond reporting to synthesis and insight Communicate to executive audiences in person, written, and through clear presentations. Preference for experience in game development, mobile entertainment, or digital businesses. Support, manage and coordinate the revenue forecasting process, delving into key metrics to understand and influence how game teams can meet operational and financial targets. Team-Related Influence, motivate and collaborate with your partners and FP&A team Foster an inclusive culture supporting career development of the team Work closely with our FP&A partners across commercial, marketing and corporate functions. Technical Skills Bachelor's degree required Experience with P&L management, financial modeling, forecasting, reporting and analysis. Experience evaluating business performance metrics and translating to applicable recommendations. Proficiency in Accounting and general GAAP knowledge. Knowledge in Anaplan, Power BI, and Oracle. People management & developing a strong team.

jobTitle: Director of Product Management - Technology Growth Strategy
jobDescription: The EA Technology Growth Strategy team creates momentum for EA to continually evolve, keep the roadmap relevant to changing needs and build an innovation-focused environment to stay ahead of the curve. As a Director, Product Management reporting to the group VP, you will create a customer-focused product roadmap to identify the technologies EA needs for the future of gaming. You will create the long-term roadmap to implement the vision of the team with a high degree of ownership over the entire experience. You will work with other PMs, analysts, designers, and developers to be the voice of the players and creators. You will balance data, design, and user experience. You will also be expected to analyze quantitative and qualitative data to deliver relevant insights that will help shape the roadmap. Responsibilities Tell the story of the Tech Growth Strategy team, Putting together a clear roadmap for all programs: Tech M&A, External Partnerships, Future Tech Strategy, Tech Incubator and Tech Advocacy. You will produce product strategy, and present clear measurable goals that will lead to achieving our business goals. Write clear and detailed specifications, working across multi-disciplinary teams (design, UX, art, engineering) to launch features and content, and analysing the impact of those releases Partner with other product managers and analysts to analyse the impact of projects and provide relevant recommendations that will affect future iterations Define short- and long-term KPIs to establish success criteria and maintain these to track project quality, delivery, and predictability. Provide insights to prioritise the roadmap and measure risk/reward payouts against the cost Qualifications 8+ years of experience in product management, business, program, operations and/or engineering management experience. Track record of successfully leading the creation of many high quality, large-scale software products Experience with game development and the business models involved. Analytical and modelling skills with a focus on data-informed decision-making. Outstanding written and verbal communication skills across all levels of an organization Strong project management skills and ability to present to executive staff Driven individual with the guile to sell your ideas to other partners, and the desire to implement those ideas cross-functionally Must love creating fun, compelling and engaging user experiences Ability to operate in an entrepreneurial environment, to excel at an extremely fast pace, and to find creative ways to get things done

jobTitle: Director of Program Management - Technology Growth Strategy
jobDescription: The EA Technology Growth Strategy team creates forward-thinking momentum for EA to evolve, keep the roadmap relevant to changing needs and build an innovation-focused environment to stay ahead of the curve. As a Director, Program Management, you will guide planning for multiple programs and ensure seamless operations across all of them. You will work in close collaboration with other PMs, product managers, analysts, designers, and developers to be the voice of our players and creators. Responsibilities You will lead planning of large-scale company wide programs in collaboration with multiple disciplines and teams across EA. You will build the operational plan/project schedule for the team and make it always visible to management and partners, and bring it through to completion. You will proactively assess and mitigate risk for assigned scope. You will ensure the team has solid organizational structure and practices that allow them to produce high-quality work on time and on budget. You will establish, implement, monitor, prioritize, optimize, and help to automate key processes such as project and capacity planning, progress tracking, and team-wide collaboration and communication. You will keep stakeholders up-to-date with progress on key projects. You will define short- and long-term KPIs to establish success criteria and maintain these to track project quality, delivery, and predictability. Qualifications 8+ years of experience in program management, business, product, program, operations and/or engineering management experience. Track record of successfully leading the creation of many high quality, large-scale software products Substantial project management background in Agile development of large software codebases within a distributed, global development environment that spans multiple locations Exceptional analytical and quantitative forecasting/modelling skills with a focus on data-informed decision-making. Outstanding written and verbal communication skills across all levels of an organization Strong project management skills and ability to present to executive staff Ability to operate in an entrepreneurial environment, to excel at an extremely fast pace, and to find creative ways to get things done

Company Overview Electronic Arts is a creative tech company that creates incredible experiences for millions of gamers around the world. But what matters most is our people who inspire us, and the world, to play. As we bring new forms of entertainment to people around the world, we need collaborative, diverse and creative people to keep making Electronic Arts better. Role Overview - Director Product Marketing - Battlefield Mobile As the Director Product Marketing - Battlefield Mobile - you will bring mobile games marketing experience to the team including go-to-market strategy and planning, creative strategy, user acquisition and cross-functional leadership. Working with the game studio, UA, creative development, data and analytics, PR, external agencies, and research teams to develop marketing campaigns to support player acquisition, retention, and engagement. You will report to the Senior Director - Brand Management. Responsibilities Campaign strategy and marketing execution including the Go to Market Plans across all marketing channels alongside marketing partners Lead marketing strategies to achieve these goals aligned with financial plans, product roadmap, and audience insights Collaborate with studio game teams to develop campaign roadmap and plans around user acquisition, engagement and retention, and help accomplish all tactical plans. Lead development of creative strategies to maintain a cohesive brand vision across UA, App Stores, Owned and Earned channels. Manage relationships with internal partnerships across studio, publishing and other teams. Maintain 3rd Party relationships across marketing to manage asset approvals and highlight opportunities for partnerships Work with UA, PM, Finance, and Analytics to build financial models and business cases for launch and live services. Build omni-channel campaigns that expand the reach of our products through a combination of paid and organic growth marketing strategies Connect marketing activities to measurable results and make strategic decisions that balance short-term return on investment with long-term brand growth Analyze and test campaigns and projects based on predetermined success metrics. Conduct ongoing competitive marketing analysis to ensure consumer and market trends are informing campaign strategies & execution Skills / Experience / Competencies 10+ years of experience developing campaign strategy, managing marketing campaigns, and working within a mobile game marketing organization Experience leading high scale apps/products including media buying, asset development, messaging, and marketing strategy across UA, Brand, Comms, and Social Excellent Project Management skills Have led a large cross-functional , culturally diverse & inclusive team Have developed and implemented a go-to-market strategy from end to end Embrace working in a dynamic, flexible, ever-changing environment High energy and passion - enjoys a fast-paced environment Proficient in Mobile/Gaming User Acquisition Solid businessLead, analytical and critical thinking skills Experience with consumer live services Prior experience in Asian markets a plus Qualifications BA/BS degree MBA preferred Minimum 10+ years of marketing experience in top-tier gaming or mobile gaming organizations Excellent Microsoft Office skills and advanced proficiency in PowerPoint Experience with mobile marketing What’s in it for you? Glad you asked! We love to brag about our great perks like comprehensive health and benefit packages, tuition reimbursement, RRSP company match and, of course, many other perks! And since we realize it takes world-class people to make world-class games, we offer great compensation packages and a culture that values creativity and individuality. At EA, we live the "work hard/play hard" credo every day.

We are EA—the world's largest video game publisher. You are probably familiar with many of our game franchises— Apex Legends, Star Wars Jedi , and Battlefield to name a few. But what does that mean for you? It means more opportunities to unleash your creativity, be inspired by those around you and ignite your path in any direction you choose. You would report to the Global Director of UX Research to lead the UX Research teams supporting all EA Shooters franchises (Apex Legends, Star Wars Jedi , and Battlefield). You would ensure that research insights are being integrated by development partners to deliver outstanding experiences for the millions of EA Shooters players around the world. Responsibilities Create the overall strategy for Shooters UX Research at EA. Empower UX Researchers in Los Angeles, Vancouver, Seattle, and Stockholm to have maximum impact. Advocate for the player experience and the role of UX Research with game development partners. Ensure that UX Research is integrated into game development plans to ensure world class player experiences. Ensure that UX Research is properly staffed to meet the needs of development partners. Qualifications You have an advanced degree in experimental psychology (experimental, social, cognitive), human computer interaction, human factors, or a related field, or equivalent industry experience . You have 5+ years' industry experience in research design and conducting user research across platforms. You have 5+ years' industry experience leading research teams including research managers. At EA, we believe that every member of the UX Research team has the opportunity to influence not only the player experience of their games but also the future of the UX Research team. Everyone on the team is encouraged to bring their true selves to every discussion.

jobTitle: Esports Brand Marketing Manager, Apex Legends Global Series
jobDescription: Esports Brand Marketing Manager, ALGS Electronic Arts is the leading interactive entertainment company, powered by innovative technology. We create incredible experiences for millions of players around the world. But what matters most is our people who inspire us, and the world, to play. As we bring new forms of entertainment to people around the world, we need creative, collaborative, diverse and adaptable people to keep making Electronic Arts better. We’re looking for a Brand Marketing Manager to come and join EA’s Esports Brand team. The Esports Brand team delivers competitive experiences that amplify tentpole brand moments from launches to major live service beats. We leverage competitive gaming to advance the strategic priorities of our brands across new regions, platforms, audience targets, and game experiences. This is a pivotal marketing role accountable for architecting and delivering innovative, impactful global go-to-market campaigns for the ALGS, from concept to final marketing execution. You will be part of our Esports Brand Marketing team, reporting to the Sr. Director of Esports Brand. Responsibilities Architect high-impact marketing campaigns and lead the creation of high-quality esports marketing assets that drive outstanding reach and positive product recognition and engagement Partner with the Apex Brand team to lead the development of go-to-market strategy and multi-channel, global marketing execution for the ALGS Partner with cross functional touchpoints to ensure esports brand strategies are integrated and translate to consistent, amazing experiences for fans and players. Develop and leverage strong relationships with agencies, production partners and other key external stakeholders Establish and evolve marketing KPIs that improve viewership acquisition, engagement, retention and evangelism Author campaign briefs, track beat readiness and partner with cross functional global and regional marketing teams to activate campaign beats Work with analytics, consumer insights, and other cross-functional partners to identify market opportunities and build plans to unlock them. Drive brand positioning exercises, partnering with product, commercial and marketing to ensure cross-discipline alignment. Own the important Brand milestone deliverables (long range roadmap, brand experience guide, business brief, player needs analysis) and presentations. Qualifications 7+ years of experience in brand development, campaign strategy, and/or product marketing Experience taking a product or service from consumer insight, to ideation, to market Ability to gather and interpret data, and distill meaningful insights Relationship builder, able to galvanize and influence stakeholders across disciplines, at all levels Able to work well in a highly matrixed environment Demonstrable experience in marketing, campaign management or growth in esports, video games or relevant industry sector Passionate and knowledgeable about video games, popular culture, and/or esports with strong interest in digital entertainment experiences Self-starting and entrepreneurial with a growth mindset Analytical, well organized and able to work well under pressure and deliver against deadlines as part of a team Excellent written and verbal communication skills About EA At Electronic Arts, we exist to Inspire the World to Play. We create extraordinary new game experiences for our millions of players everywhere by bringing together talented people that combine creativity, innovation, and passion. We know that our strength lies in the diversity of our people. We immerse our employees into an inclusive culture, and provide opportunities for learning and leading that allow them to do the most impactful and rewarding work of their careers. We put our people first. We provide comprehensive benefit packages with a focus on health and wellbeing to support your needs and help you balance your career and personal life. We provide access to dynamic and collaborative work environments, opportunities to connect and contribute through our Employee Resource Groups, and support for a balanced life with paid time off and maternity and paternity leave, plus free video games and so much more! Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Electronic Arts also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

The Challenge Ahead If you can manage complex projects and excel at helping leaders do more, be more efficient, then we might have the perfect role for you. This role supports VPs, teams and floater assistant coverage for the other Executive Assistants on the CTO team as appropriate. What An Executive Assistant Does At EA Independently provide high quality support that anticipates the needs of the executives you will support Assume full ownership and maintenance of the calendar; scheduling, confirming, and coordinating for meeting space and attendees Coordinate domestic and international travel including international visas Track relevant travel and expense receipts for accurate accounting reconciliations. File and track reimbursements, credits, and refunds through to completion in the iExpense tool Prepare and polish documents in Word, Excel, PowerPoint. Works well with high-level candidates and executive search firms both in person and by email/phone Handle highly confidential information Coordinate events at onsite or offsite venues Understand important functions and projects in the department. Provide monitoring and support on action items in progress Coordinate with other executive assistants to help coordinate joint projects; serve as back-up for other Executive Admins Process electronic purchase orders through I-procurement Function as Office Manager, maintaining supplies and coordinating activities Request, confirm, and provide all meeting room technology and needed equipment or supplies You will manage multiple special projects across two departments and teams, including large-scale meetings, event planning for conferences/exhibitions, and meetings with partners Other responsibilities as assigned The Next Great EA Executive Assistant Also Needs A successful track record supporting VPs or above for 3+ years: Executive level experience A person who works with little or no management, and shows initiative, teamwork, and anticipates and resolves problems before they escalate Proficient in organizing worldwide travel Collaborative with multiple levels About EA At Electronic Arts, we exist to Inspire the World to Play. Electronic Arts is an innovative tech company that creates incredible experiences for millions of players around the world. But what matters most is our people who inspire us, and the world, to play. As we bring new forms of entertainment to people around the world, we need creative, collaborative and diverse people to keep making Electronic Arts better. ENTERTAINING IS OUR PASSION #WeAreEA the world's leading video game publisher and we exist to inspire the world to play. EA values creativity, pioneering, passion, determination, learning, and teamwork. We mean things like acting with curiosity, speaking up with original ideas, and committing to each other as one team. We're looking for all the best kinds of people to make great experiences for our players. We celebrate diversity and inclusion by creating a place where you can come to work and be yourself. Role Overview Our Financial Planning and Analysis (FP&A) team helps provide strategic partnership to leaders across EA. We achieve this through engaging with our partners to understand our broad strategy, analyzing data, and delivering insights to help guide EA's performance. You will partner with internal Mobile FP&A, Commercial and Mobile Studio Leadership teams. Our Mobile team creates engaging and evolving daily entertainment through mobile games people love to play. Knowledge of the gaming industry, especially free to play business models, advertising and user acquisition are a significant advantage. You will report to the Director of FP&A. What You'll Do Business Partnering Develop relationships with leadership to help deliver the long-term strategy Guide and assist teams to provide accurate reporting to assist with decision-making and value creation. Influence decisions by understanding the big picture combined with providing underlying deep financial analysis Prepare and hold business reviews for EA's leadership team Financial Forecasting and Reporting Manage Mobile Platform consolidation (Revenue, Opex, Capex, and Headcount) Collaborate with Commercial team on long range, annual and quarterly revenue forecasts by title Lead financial reviews with budget owners to develop annual plans and subsequent forecast updates Provide analysis to highlight variance drivers and identify opportunities to mitigate risk and improve performance Responsible for purchase order approvals, budgeted spend tracking, monthly close activities, and headcount management. Set control processes in place to manage spending and headcount within plan. Close Responsibilities Manage all close activities for assigned departments including identifying and preparing accrual and reclass entries to ensure precise accounting of known activities Ensure compliance with EA's policies and procedures. FP&A Excellence Build and retain our world-class FP&A team. Manage 2 Senior Financial Analysts Identify and lead projects to standardize forecasting and reporting processes Who You Are Motivated, passionate Ability to handle multiple and competing priorities, meet tight deadlines, and to thrive in a fast-paced environment with high degree of change Ability to work with ambiguity and independence A team player able to work collaboratively, within the group and across EA as a leader and partner Experience And Technical Skills Bachelor's degree required. Minimum 8 years of related financial experience Motivated, passionate, comfortable presenting to senior management Experienced people manager to lead finance team and provide executive management support A team player able to work collaboratively, within the group and across business groups Demonstrated increasing levels of responsibility and independence Demonstrated proficiency in Accounting and general GAAP knowledge Business acumen with understanding of functional linkages and build relationships with partners in both operational and financial roles

Finance Manager - Mobile FP&A (Vancouver, Canada Redwood City and Los Angeles, California, United States) EA's CFO organization comprises a broad group of finance disciplines. Our common goal is partnership with business teams delivering strategies and providing our players with amazing experiences. All of our finance teams assist the business in achieving profitable creativity by providing financial insight, reporting and guidance. We use progressive tools to analyze and visualize data, telling the story of financial drivers, performance, risks and opportunities. We value attributes like collaboration and learning. We celebrate diversity and inclusion by creating a place where you can come to work and be yourself. Our Financial Planning and Analysis (FP&A) team provides strategic partnership to leaders across EA. We do this by engaging with our partners to understand our broad strategy, analyzing data, and delivering insights to help guide EA's performance. Role Overview This Finance Manager role is a unique opportunity to be a collaborative partner and trusted advisor to the EA Mobile Growth team. You will report to a Senior Finance Manager on the Growth team, which manages User Acquisition, Marketing and Brand activities across the EA Mobile portfolio and drives continued growth in our high priority strategic franchises. Knowledge of the gaming industry, especially free-to-play business models, advertising and user acquisition are a significant advantage. What You'll Do Business Partnering You will provide financial guidance and support strategic decision-making, including budget allocation Develop relationships with business partners to help forecast revenue growth (including titles in development) You will assist with P&L modeling and evaluate business opportunities Prepare and hold portfolio and forecast reviews for leadership teams Financial Forecasting, Reporting and Close Manage quarterly forecasting and monthly reporting activities Assist leadership to set and manage budgets across projects and titles Guide partners on developing OpEx forecasts, including headcount planning Analyze performance of user acquisition, brand and marketing investments for live games Lead long-term business planning and modeling with studio leadership Design and run complex financial and operational models to develop meaningful insights Guide FP&A Excellence Help build and retain our world-class FP&A team. Identify and lead programs to automate forecasting and reporting processes Experience And Technical Skills Bachelor's degree Minimum 5 years of related financial experience Experience with P&L management, forecasting and reporting Expert in Excel (can build complex spreadsheets) Experience with financial forecasting and reporting tools such as Anaplan and Power BI

Description Reporting to the Senior Fraud Manager, you will help to develop the creation of an incident-based security program within the Fraud and Player Security team. Maintain reporting for the program and team and help coordinate engineering efforts. We ask that you have a unique combination of security/program management expertise, coupled with investigative and development experience. Responsibilities Collaborate with internal partners to represent as central security to support incidents and recommend improvement opportunities. Create incident tickets; prioritize, assign and manage progress and take responsibility to complete on time. Work with Product and Engineering to manage feature engineering tickets and bug tickets. Gather and document requirements, lead internal prioritization discussions, manage ticket progress, and conduct validation in INT and PROD. Conduct research and analytics, which may require complex SQL queries, and make data-driven improvement recommendations. Monitor health of main player security metrics, research further for important anomalies detected, and coordinate policy and modeling support. Support visualization dashboards and associated data aggregation. Qualifications 2+ years of project management and analytics experience Experienced with JIRA, SQL, and MS Products Experience with business intelligence and visualization tools like Tableau or others You have an eye for detail Bachelor's degree in analytics related field or equivalent professional experience. Bonus Knowledge of account security and gaming industry

Bonus Knowledge of account security and gaming industry

Finding great talent and supporting our studios to be the best place for people to make an impact is central to our philosophy. This is the principle behind our newly formed EA Studio in Seattle focusing on open-world action-adventure games and pioneering next-generation emergent storytelling. Join us to pursue your passion to create unique, groundbreaking and inclusive games that empower players to produce incredible stories of heroic adventure. Become a foundational part of a respectful and diverse team as we are looking for a Design Manager to join our team. As the Design Manager, you will improve the day-to-day life of every member of the design team. You will meet them where they are, get to know their motivations and aspirations, their fears and passions. You will help them build on their strengths and navigate their growth areas, providing whatever they need to unlock their full potential. You will report to the VP Creative and will work with individuals across departments to evaluate designers' performance, both advocating on their behalf and ensuring accountability, providing coaching, support and counseling as needed. Responsibilities Manage and support the design team in both their immediate project goals and longer term career goals ensuring they have what they need and nothing is holding them back from realizing their full potential Be a, steady advocate for members of our design team, and providing whatever they need to perform at their peak without directing the design of the game. Partner with the production department, leadership, and recruiting on staffing plans and hiring efforts for the design team Provide 1:1 coaching with individual designers to ensure career goals, team alignment, and team health are maintained Helping to develop and make clear paths for designers' career development and facilitate performance reviews for the team Qualifications 3+ years of experience in Management or Leadership roles in a large game development team 3+ years of experience with staffing, hiring, interviewing and team building Experience working specifically in game design Benefits We love to celebrate our great perks like comprehensive health and benefit packages, tuition reimbursement, 401k with company match, of course, free video games and more!
