Game Integrations Manager #WeAreEA and we exist to inspire the world to play. EA values creativity, pioneering, passion, determination, learning, and teamwork. We mean things like acting with curiosity, speaking up with original ideas, and committing to each other as one team. We're looking for all the best kinds of people to make great experiences for our players. We want a job that inspires them while giving them room to enjoy their lives. And we want to give them that. We celebrate diversity and inclusion by creating a place where you can come to work and be yourself. And we want you to join us. We're hiring a Game Integrations Manager. You will be part of EA's Customer Experience organization. The Customer Experience organization strives to make EA known for taking care of its players. We're players taking care of players and people talking to people – whenever, wherever, and however they need us. You will lead the systems integrations, in collaboration with EA game teams and IT groups by creating the technology requirements to ensure game data is integrated into customer experience tech and tools such as self-service, CRM and toxicity management applications. You will work with the IT groups of multiple EA organizations as well as with partner groups from game studios, central services and within CE. We are looking for a Game Integrations Manager with experience in the product space, with the technical skills to operate with multiple IT teams. You will have a wide range of responsibilities and reports to the Director of Systems and Lifecycle Services. So how does the Game Integrations Manager make great experiences for players? They: Systems integration Review, comprehend and translate business requirements into clear, consumable user stories that the development teams Help build contingency planning and guide the team through unplanned changes and pivots Partner with developers within game teams, collaborating on having unified goals when it comes to the integration's service to both groups and the player experience Prepare to be able to identify risks before they materialize and swiftly escalate with the game teams to ensure both groups are informed and working together in mitigating Work with partner teams, looking for opportunities for improvements in efficiency, reporting and execution of the systems integrations Lead/promote discussions in the POD format with regards to the decisions on the strategic approach to an individual title as well as the approach of the group Team member and partner relationship management Collaborate with partners to ensure they are informed and updated on integrations schedules, statuses and blockers Work with all partners to ensure their needs and concerns are considered and addressed in a timely and informed manner Manage relationships with game teams, central services teams, and integration-affecting partners as the main point of contact for your integration Implement, as an important primary team member of the Experience Lifecycle pods, on the assigned tasks but also participate as part of the team, ensuring all the team's activities are completed as well Help communication between two external partner teams (studio or central) when matching them for recommendation or reference purposes on anything from scope definition, risk mitigations and timeline development Release management Ensure documentation on sprint schedules, reporting and associated variances is maintained and up-to-date Accountable for the sprint release notes creation and distribution Collaborate with QA and UAT to ensure testing preparedness, documentation and reporting for your integrations Maintain accurate documentation aimed at ensuring knowledge is not siloed and/or limited to one person or group Collaborate with leadership in the continuous improvements to processes associated with and impactful the game integrations team Operational knowledge Ensure the integrations are constantly meeting the shared goals of CE as they pertain to achieving the best player experience possible Listen to internal product users to understand how they use the integrated tools and features Establish documentation of existing capabilities in order to use the knowledge and context when recommending to game teams the business appropriate solution Participate in periodic roundtable sessions and focus groups of product users impacted by the integrations pre and post project completion Understand the impact of the integrations on the operational indicators and the advisor experience Product knowledge Have a deep understanding of the user experience, the short- and long-term strategy and the associated functionality of CE systems that are integrated Constantly work with partners in the System Owners and Product Management groups to ensure information is always being exchanged between the teams Collaborate with the product launch partner teams such as the Lifecycle Experience Managers and Live Experience Specialists to ensure understanding and proper knowledge transfer on the games that are being integrated From the Game Integrations space, partner with the Product Management teams in generating short and medium-term, quick win, solutions that can offer swift operational improvements and indicator lifts If you're interested in this role, you'll need these skills or experiences: A bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Information Systems, Business, or a related field 2+ years of experience working within or in close partnership with a systems integrations team 4+ years of experience as a product owner, program manager or system admin Strong business strategy and critical thinking skills with the ability to get into the technical details Proficient knowledge of the product development process and the associated concepts Experience managing technical programs involving partners from different departments working towards a unified solution across divisions Experience as a JIRA power-user Experience networking and collaborating Understand trends and convert into applicable efforts Experience working with an outsourced development team

Global Audit Intern (Summer 2023) The CFO organization comprises a broad group of finance disciplines, with the common goal of partnering with business teams delivering strategies and providing our players with amazing experiences. Our finance teams assist the business in achieving profitable creativity by proving financial insight, reporting and guidance. We use progressive tools to analyze and visualize data, telling the story of financial drivers, performance, risks and opportunities. We value attributes like collaboration and learning. We celebrate diversity and inclusion by creating a place where you can come to work and be yourself. Global Audit Departmental Overview Global Audit is an independent and objective assurance and business advisory organization designed to provide assurance to the Audit Committee of the Board of Directors, contribute to senior management and improve EA’s operations. It helps EA to accomplish its goals by bringing a top down, risk-based approach to evaluate and improve the effectiveness of risk management, internal control, and governance processes. The Global Audit organization reports directly into the Audit Committee of the Board of Directors. Main Purpose of the Role The Global Audit Intern will work with multiple functional groups to experience numerous areas and processes of audit. You will play an active role in participating on operational audits where you will be exposed to IT and business processes and controls, as well as supporting the EA SOX compliance program and our data analytics effort. You will have the opportunity to learn new skills, be involved in a fun and active office community, and build strong relationships with members of Electronic Arts. Key Duties And Responsibilities Develop an understanding of the audit approach, methodology, and tools; Establish working relationships with teammates and key contacts; Work closely with teammates on all phases of audits; Assist in the development of auditing with data analytics; Collaborate with the Finance and Operational audit teams; Participate in the annual Sarbanes-Oxley control testing. Skills And Knowledge Developed written and verbal communication skills in English and excellent soft-skills; Excellent MS Office skills (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Visio); Familiar with data analysis and data analytics tools Comfortable with learning and working with new computer tools and applications; Interest in a digital business or similar industry. Qualifications Full time undergraduate student; Strong academic credentials (Minimum GPA of 3.0); Currently studying Business Administration, Accounting, Data Analytics/Science, or Management Information Systems is preferred. Applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States on a fulltime basis. Visa sponsorship is not available for this position.

EA SPORTS is one of the leading sports entertainment brands in the world, with top-selling videogame franchises, award-winning interactive technology, fan programs, and cross-platform digital experiences. EA SPORTS creates connected experiences that ignite the emotion of sport through industry-leading sports video games, including Madden NFL football, EA Sports FC, NHL® hockey, NBA LIVE basketball, and EA SPORTS UFC. EA SPORTS Madden NFL is the best-selling sports property in U.S. video game history. Madden NFL is an immersive, simulation-based, authentic NFL interactive experience that empowers fans to play out their NFL fantasies. Madden NFL has entertained fans for over three decades with more than 130 million lifetime units sold. Madden NFL is developed at EA's Tiburon Studio in Maitland, FL, and Madrid, Spain by a team that prides itself on innovation and creative collaboration. We're looking for talent with an experience with sports to create experiences that connect with football fans around the world to grow the love of the sport. As a Rendering Engineer, your implementations will change how Sports creates games. You will be reporting to the team's Development or Technical Director, you will be a part of ensuring the studio and adopt new technology and always improve the way we work. Within Sports and EA, you will have a driving partnership with the Frostbite development team, you will work with leading industry talent in one of the world's largest and leading game development communities. You will participate in both internal and external graphics conferences to both gain and share knowledge. Your Responsibilities: You will develop core rendering features, engine components and tools. You will research and implement rendering techniques. You will create reusable and flexible rendering technologies. You will write technical design specifications. You will design, maintains, implements, tests and debug code, pipelines and other rendering-related sub-components and packages. You will optimize rendering modules of a game engine. Stay up to date with latest hardware & software changes enhancing the rendering domain. Your Qualifications: Experience working on or creating real-time rendering engines. Experience developing rendering techniques and implementing white papers Experience in modern graphics APIs such as DirectX12, Vulkan, or Metal Experience with the following: PC, PS4, Xbox One, PS5, Xbox Series S/X Experience with graphics performance analysis, optimization, and associated tools such as PIX, RenderDoc, Razor Experience with art and content pipelines and workflows Experience investigating and optimizing low-level game engine code on multiple platforms Communication ability that supports an open working environment regarding feedback A desire to improve visual quality together with art and design Stay up to date with latest and the greatest techniques in computer graphics Excellent debugging and multi-threading skills

EA SPORTS is one of the leading sports entertainment brands in the world, with top-selling videogame franchises, award-winning interactive technology, fan programs, and cross-platform digital experiences. EA SPORTS creates connected experiences that ignite the emotion of sport through industry-leading sports video games, including Madden NFL football, EA Sports FC, NHL® hockey, NBA LIVE basketball, and EA SPORTS UFC. EA SPORTS Madden NFL is the best-selling sports property in U.S. video game history. Madden NFL is an immersive, simulation-based, authentic NFL interactive experience that empowers fans to play out their NFL fantasies. Madden NFL has entertained fans for over three decades with more than 130 million lifetime units sold. Madden NFL is developed at EA's Tiburon Studio in Maitland, FL, and Madrid, Spain by a team that prides itself on innovation and creative collaboration. We're looking for talent with an experience with sports to create experiences that connect with football fans around the world to grow the love of the sport. As a Rendering Engineer, your implementations will change how Sports creates games. You will be reporting to the team's Development or Technical Director, you will be a part of ensuring the studio and adopt new technology and always improve the way we work. Within Sports and EA, you will have a driving partnership with the Frostbite development team, you will work with leading industry talent in one of the world's largest and leading game development communities. You will participate in both internal and external graphics conferences to both gain and share knowledge. Your Responsibilities: You will develop core rendering features, engine components and tools. You will research and implement rendering techniques. You will create reusable and flexible rendering technologies. You will write technical design specifications. You will design, maintains, implements, tests and debug code, pipelines and other rendering-related sub-components and packages. You will optimize rendering modules of a game engine. Stay up to date with latest hardware & software changes enhancing the rendering domain. Your Qualifications: Experience working on or creating real-time rendering engines. Experience developing rendering techniques and implementing white papers Experience in modern graphics APIs such as DirectX12, Vulkan, or Metal Experience with the following: PC, PS4, Xbox One, PS5, Xbox Series S/X Experience with graphics performance analysis, optimization, and associated tools such as PIX, RenderDoc, Razor Experience with art and content pipelines and workflows Experience investigating and optimizing low-level game engine code on multiple platforms Communication ability that supports an open working environment regarding feedback A desire to improve visual quality together with art and design Stay up to date with latest and the greatest techniques in computer graphics Excellent debugging and multi-threading skills

jobTitle: Group Technical Director - Mobile Automation Engineering
jobDescription: Do you want to help make games better? As a Group Technical Director in the Mobile Quality Engineering team , you will report to the Head of Mobile QV. As part of the worldwide Quality Verification organization you will help improve the way we make and test games across the EA's Mobile studios group. We are looking for a curious and passionate person who is always looking for ways to improve the quality of life for QA, developers, and the ultimate experience for our players. Your insights and your influence will allow us to make the highest quality games possible and have fun whilst doing it. Using automated testing, workflow tools, and data insights, your team makes it as easy as possible to create and test high-quality games, you will help ensure that the game will always be stable through all stages of development. Are you someone who knows "we can do better", and can walk that path? Then we want to hear from you. Responsibilities Create technical strategies to ensure effective QA engagements across multiple groups and projects. Manage a team of Technical Directors across engagements to ensure technical strategies are successful at satisfying Studio and QV requirements. Guide the quality development discipline forward as part of the global Quality Technology Council and the worldwide Quality Verification organization. Participate in the Quality Verification planning and strategies for each product within the Mobile group. Ensure the excellence of our embedded and in-sourced tools development services. Oversee all project dependencies, risks, and critical paths. Promote achievement of the Quality Verification team’s business goals and develop policies for sharing software, technical innovation, business processes and other intellectual property. Help create a strong technical community by developing excellent relationships with technical peers in game development teams and other groups throughout EA studios. Work with other team leaders to manage change. Lead, coach and mentor software engineers on the team. Recruit and retain great people to the team and company. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science, Engineering or Software Engineering or equivalent. At least 10 years’ technology industry technical experience working on tools, test automation, and software development. At least 5 years in a leadership role including some experience managing other managers. At least 2 years experience in providing enterprise technology solutions. Experience leading solutions development on mobile or related platforms. Knowledge of game application technologies, spanning client, server, live operations and infrastructure systems. Balance technical, team, product, project, support, and business requirements for successful outcomes. Experience leading technical teams that are distributed across multiple studios and time zones. Change management, experience adapting/changing status quo and traversing changes with people, products, and processes. Experience with development supporting multiple independent stakeholders. Experience developing new talent.

jobTitle: Head of Engineering, Social and Marketplace Platform
jobDescription: Description Reporting to the Head of EADP, the Sr. Director of Social and Marketplace will promote EA's technical strategy for our core in-game social and marketplace strategies, in close coordination with our gaming studios and other CTO partners. You will lead a global engineering team in building our virtual economy platform, social platform, positive play products, interoperability layer and core platform for running live services. You will also work with peers in EADP to bring outstanding central technology offering for the game studios at EA. You will ensure that EA games have excellent solutions available to them. Responsibilities Set the vision, goals, and overall direction for EADP's marketplace and social products. Inspire the team to delight our customers. Build relationships with leaders across our game studios and be an expert in this space. Guide and evaluate the work of the team through the lens of delighting our internal customers. Provide products to enhance online experiences for players and improve game studios' development efficiency in building their games and operating their live services. Build a healthy culture with a focus on delivering value to our game studios, building lasting partnerships, and maintaining a sense of empathy. Shape people's careers as you mentor your team to help them build great products and reach their full potential. Work with your peers and the product management team to influence and guide strategy for the larger EADP organization. Qualifications 15+ years of experience in the software engineering space with cross related experience with product management and high-level architecture. 8+ years leading impactful engineering teams. Experience working in high technology services and support (e.g., online services, software, web technologies). Passionate about customer needs and focus: responsive to the needs of our studios and customers. Preferably experience building or working with virtual economies and social networks. The ability to translate tactical customer asks into a strategic vision for your portfolio. Skills at promoting agreement across a range of different opinions and interests; experienced at building agreement within federated, complex environments with a specific goal of promoting an enterprise-wide strategy across EA's divisions. Can envision and build a new and inspiring direction that ensures EA is building the right thing with creative differentiators that improve impact. Knowledge of core online gameplay experiences - seen as an expert in the field. You take high-level direction and manage team execution within an iterative software development model. Bonus Video Game industry experience Exhibit a history of embracing working within a creative, technology enabled atmosphere in which fun and entertainment remain the central themes Background in planning and delivering in an large industry or organization across geographic boundaries Establish and translate a vision into plans Experience leading large organizations across time zones

Insights Analyst – Internship (BS, MS) (Summer 2023) Electronic Arts is looking for high performing students to join our world-class internship experience. Summer 2023 will be better than ever as we bring all interns together on-site for orientation week and prep students for the future ways of work by offering remote and hybrid opportunities depending on your location. For more information about our Next-Gen Program, visit https://www.ea.com/careers/interns-and-university-graduates #WeAreEA and we exist to inspire the world to play. EA values creativity, pioneering, passion, determination, learning, and teamwork. We mean things like acting with curiosity, speaking up with original ideas, and committing to each other as one team. We celebrate diversity and inclusion by creating a place where you can come to work and be yourself. We want you to join us. We're looking for an Insights Analyst Intern within EA's Customer Experience organization. You're the questioning type and have a passion to analyze user behavior, feedback, and experiences. You want to understand why things happen and you want to share your insights to improve EA’s Customer Experience. A day in the life of an Insights Analyst Internship looks like: Work across Insights and Operations to provide analysis to understand where there are opportunities with a specific area of focus, recommending short range solutions Monitor KPI performance, identify improvement opportunities, understand the WHY Work with other teams and partners to identify trends and areas for improvement Provide reporting and support inquiries for our partners Review impacts across multiple regions to understand player and advisor differences and how those impact operational indicators Manage the story and actions performed by the business that impact metrics If you're interested, you'll need these skills or experiences: You are currently enrolled in a Bachelor's or Master's program and are slated to graduate after Summer 2023 (i.e. Fall 2023, Spring 2024, and beyond) You are proficient in SQL and understand how to query large sets of complex data You have experience with a programmatic data analysis tool (e.g., R or Python) You are somewhat familiar with data visualization applications and techniques (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Shiny) You know how analyze large data sets to produce strategic insights that inform business decisions You understand how to communicate data to non-analyst audiences and create digestible reporting You are curious in your validation and cross-reference multiple sets of data to support your hypotheses

EA is a world-renowned entertainment leader, creating top-selling videogame franchises, award-winning interactive technology, fan programs and cross-platform digital experiences enjoyed by players all over the world. EA Create's Animation team is responsible for animation across EA's entire game catalog, providing high-quality performance in all aspects of their work. They know how to reveal emotions, attitude, and mood through a character's movement and behavior, creating memorable characters that appeal to players. In the end, the look of a game is a significant factor in a game's overall impact to players. What You Will Do At EA We are looking for artists to help us build cinematic scenes and content for non-interactive moments in-game. You will build the cinematic scene from start to finish. Using in-game characters, you will add motion capture performances onto the scene timeline, edit the performance together, blend clips if necessary, finish the performance to meet the final animation quality, and stand the scene up in-engine in partnership with the development team. You will report to our Animation Department Director. ** This is a 12-month contract** Responsibilities Build scenes using a combination of assets: characters, motion capture clips, props, etc. Edit the scene animation timeline, editing and adjusting clips to layout the required performance Integrate cinematic animation content into game engine Once the cinematic timing is complete, finish the performance: address any motion issues and edits, complete the animation (body and/or face) Address feedback from the game studio's Animation Director Maintain the scope, schedule and assignments for on time delivery throughout the project Work and collaborate with the main client partners (animation, art, rigging, engineering and production) Provide creative and technical problem solving to deliver efficient quality animation Qualifications 2+ years of in-game cinematic experience Proficient in standard industry tools (Maya and MotionBuilder) Experience with realistic body mechanics, anatomy and motion Proficiency in motion capture and animation processes Experience with face and body motion capture animation Familiarity with animation content integration in engine Understanding of body and facial production rigs Proactive, self-directed work ethic Excellent communication and problem solving skills Plus Familiarity in C#, C++, MEL, and Maya API Experience with editor-based game development environments example: Unreal Join us in driving the next revolution in games.

You will report to our Animation Department Director. ** This is a temporary contract** Responsibilities Build scenes using a combination of assets: characters, motion capture clips, props, etc. Edit the scene animation timeline, editing and adjusting clips to layout the required performance Integrate cinematic animation content into game engine Once the cinematic timing is complete, finish the performance: address any motion issues and edits, complete the animation (body and/or face) Address feedback from the game studio's Animation Director Maintain the scope, schedule and assignments for on time delivery throughout the project Work and collaborate with the main client partners (animation, art, rigging, engineering and production) Provide creative and technical problem solving to deliver efficient quality animation Qualifications 2+ years of in-game cinematic experience Proficient in standard industry tools (Maya and MotionBuilder) Experience with realistic body mechanics, anatomy and motion Proficiency in motion capture and animation processes Experience with face and body motion capture animation Familiarity with animation content integration in engine Understanding of body and facial production rigs Proactive, self-directed work ethic Excellent communication and problem solving skills Plus Familiarity in C#, C++, MEL, and Maya API Experience with editor-based game development environments example: Unreal Join us in driving the next revolution in games.

Overview Lead Product Manager, Employee Experience As part of the EA Employee Experience team, you will lead products that allow everyone at EA to do the best work of their lives. From communication, to collaboration, to work management - you will create value by solving the foundational needs of a modern hybrid workforce. You will report to the Employee Experience Product Director based in Redwood Shores, CA, but we are flexible with hybrid work. We are passionate champions of our diverse, global employees. We listen to their needs, identify impactful opportunities, and lead teams to make solutions come to life! Responsibilities Create product line vision, goals and roadmap based on solving customer's biggest problems You will work with employees to uncover underlying perspectives and pain points (focusing on the "why") to make the case for change and decide what problems to invest in You will influence and collaborate with partners across all EA teams to build roadmaps and deliver products that align with EA's product ecosystem, considering industry trends, vendor market, and organizational priorities Determine what capabilities and delivery approach will have the biggest return on investment You will define the EA customer journeys, process maps, and detailed user stories/requirements You will partner with engineering, experience design, and external vendors to assess build vs. buy options, focused on delivering simple and scalable solutions with a reasonable time to value Manage delivery cycle to take ideas from concept to implementation You will refine requirements based on prototyping, hands-on testing, and iterative feedback, acting as a bridge between customer desires and technical realities You will lead a product team and support sprint plans, issues, and decisions, anticipating risk and ensuring focus stays on maximizing value within a timeline and resource constraints Manage change and improve product to adapt to changing customer needs You will build awareness, excitement and knowledge of new features through communication and training material creation and facilitation of training sessions You will solicit feedback and analyze data to constantly evolve product and approach Qualifications Business/Information Technology degree or equivalent professional qualification Experience managing internal products and driving value for employees 10+ years industry experience leading system evaluations and implementations in either product, business analyst, or program management roles. Agile experience Experience managing resource allocation, budgets, tracking and communicating progress while managing user/leadership expectations Experience driving decisions, prioritizing, and adapting to changing business models and organizational structures. Facilitate small and large meetings/workshops, create written deliverables (presentations, requirement documentation, emails, etc.), and communicate current and future product capabilities We're a game company, so love of games is encouraged.

Legal Approvals Associate (Non-Attorney Position) Electronic Arts Inc. is a global leader in interactive entertainment. We develop and deliver games, content and online services across platforms. We have a broad portfolio of brands that span the most popular genres. We exist to Inspire the World to Play. We create extraordinary new game experiences for our millions of players everywhere by bringing together talented people that combine creativity, innovation, and passion. We immerse our employees into an inclusive culture and provide opportunities for learning and leading that allow our employees to do the most impactful and rewarding work of their careers. We are seeking an enthusiastic, organized, and collaborative legal professional (non-attorney) to join our team. This position will report to Managing Counsel and join the Approvals team, a group of legal professionals who support our product and marketing teams on the creation of games, marketing campaigns, and policies to help deliver upon EA’s mission to be the world’s greatest games company. This position may work from our offices at either Seattle, Washington or Los Angeles, California. The ideal candidate is a highly motivated, self-starter, who is inquisitive and has a passion for video games and technology. Join us in driving the next revolution in games. What’s in it for you? Glad you asked! Partner with Product Counsel and Specialist Counsel to support game development teams on legal issues such as content clearance, trademark clearance, in-game advertising and reviewing specific game features. Review and approve all consumer-facing product and marketing materials to ensure compliance with legal and regulatory requirements, including ratings requirements, IP, advertising and privacy guidance, and regional-specific requirements. Help maintain and develop internal guidance and policies relating to marketing compliance. Prepare rules and disclosures for promotions including contests, sweepstakes, tournaments, and promotional offers. Review registration, marketing, and promotional materials related to Competitive Gaming tournaments and other live events. Perform trademark searches, content clearance research or other legal research as needed. General Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree. 2+ years of relevant experience at in-house legal department or a law firm. Excellent communication, attention to detail, and project management skills. Manage multiple projects in a fast-paced legal department. Experience or familiarity with video games is a big plus. We love to celebrate our great perks like comprehensive health and benefit packages, tuition reimbursement, 401k with company match, of course, free video games and more!

(Orlando, Florida London and Guildford, United Kingdom) We are looking for a passionate, collaborative, and motivated product counsel to join our team. You will report to EA's Senior Product Counsel. We are flexible as to which EA office you work from and will consider partial remote work. Join us in driving the next revolution in games. Role Responsibility Details You will engage early and often with EA's studio, product development, and marketing teams. Cultivate collaborative partnerships across EA's studio, product development, product marketing teams and EA's legal teams. Success in this position relies heavily on collaborating with numerous teams and developing trust across those teams. Bring a deep working knowledge of U.S. and international laws and regulations related to game design, monetization, advertising, in-game content, and technology for console, PC, cloud gaming, mobile games, and subscription-based business models. You will provide practical, clear and easy to understand legal advice to the business often explaining complex legal advice in business-friendly terms. You will conduct rights clearance and risk assessment for publishing our games on new platforms and business models. You will partner with members of EA's legal team to develop policies and guidance supporting EA's game development. General Qualifications J.D. or similar educational level for candidates educated outside of the US, and 6+ years' relevant experience including 4+ years of experience working as in-house product counsel at a technology or entertainment company. Experience counseling product development or entertainment content creation teams working with the production teams, marketing teams, engineering teams, and creative teams. Demonstrated ability to work independently on diverse matters, successfully lead cross-functional projects, and comfortable finding creative and practical solutions. Working knowledge of intellectual property, privacy, marketing, and commercial law. Collaborative by nature and able to build partnerships across diverse teams. Comfortable in a fast-paced environment with a diverse and complex workload working on legal matters where there may be ambiguity and a lack of legal precedent. Available to travel as necessary to support the needs of the product teams.

Electronic Arts is looking for high performing students to join our world-class internship experience. Summer 2023 will be better than ever as we bring all interns together on-site for orientation week and prep students for the future ways of work by offering remote and hybrid opportunities depending on your location. For more information about our Next-Gen Program, visit https://www.ea.com/careers/interns-and-university-graduates The EA Digital Platform Data & AI Group provides unified Artificial Intelligence (AI) resources across all franchises within Electronic Arts. Our group develops machine learning, AI, and data-driven solutions to game team problems, and a powerful AI live-service system for use in every facet of the company. From data modeling to model building, we use a modern tech stack with excellent tools to provide live-service solutions and platforms to enhance player in-game experience and power the future of game marketing and sales. We're looking for talented and motivated engineers to help us create and expand recommendation live-services to develop ML applications that power our games. What You’ll Do Help design core recommendation live-service system components to ease the creation and management of AI/ML models and recommendation logic. Work side-by-side with AI Scientists and Data Scientists to build new models. Work with existing code to add new features and adapt code to new requirements. Work closely with the core development teams to deploy models seamlessly as part of production systems. Establish scalable, efficient, automated processes for large scale data analyses, model development, model validation and model implementation. Who you are Must be currently enrolled in a university and graduate after summer 2023. Must have experience with programming languages such as Python, Ruby or Java. Must be familiar with ML domain and common workflows. Bonus: experience with large scale data processing. Bonus: experience with distributed system development. What’s in it for you… A paid internship Game credit perks Intern events to connect the EA community We ask that you are legally authorized to work in the US on a full-time basis during the 12-week internship. Visa sponsorship is not available for this position.

Electronic Arts is looking for high performing students to join our world-class internship experience. Summer 2023 will be better than ever as we bring all interns together on-site for orientation week and prep students for the future ways of work by offering remote and hybrid opportunities depending on your location. For more information about our Next-Gen Program, visit https://www.ea.com/careers/interns-and-university-graduates The EA Digital Platform (EADP) group provides central services that help game teams to tap into the power of the global EA ecosystem. Compatible across multiple platforms and devices, our platform empowers teams to foster deeper, more meaningful relationships with our players. EADP is the foundation on which EA's games are built. By providing reusable capabilities that game teams can easily integrate into their games, we allow them to focus on making incredible games. The Experimentation team is looking for an AI engineer to help build the Experimentation live service/Data processing pipeline and drive the innovation and excellence that will help facilitate the experimentation platform in the global EA ecosystem. Responsibilities You will help build a unified platform across EA, extract and process massive data from spanning 20+ game studios, and use the insight to serve massive online requests You will develop reporting systems that inform on important metrics, detect anomalies, and forecast future results You will develop batch and real-time processing to solve data mining problems, using Hadoop, Airflow, Presto, etc. You will develop large-scale online platform to personalize the player experience and provide reporting and feedback, focusing on content optimization and experimentation You will write reliable and efficient programs to process and consume massive (petabyte) datasets with large clusters of machines You will work with data modelers, data analysts, and BI developers to understand requirements, develop ETL processes, validate results, and bring them to production You will develop state-of-the-art ML / statistical algorithms for content personalization, recommendations, and experimentations. You will research and implement novel ML / statistical approaches for new problems. Qualifications Masters or PhD student in Computer Science, or related fields (focus in AI, ML, or statistics background) Passionate about relative research in online experimentation and solving open-ended problems. Proactive collaborators and excellent communicators that work well with multiple teams to deliver production. Strong programming skills (object-oriented and functional paradigms), fluent in at least one programming language such as Jave, Python, Ruby or C++. Familiar with scripting languages such as bash, awk. Experienced in building large-scale data and distributed systems

We are EA—the world’s largest video game publisher and leading interactive entertainment software company. You’re probably familiar with many of our titles—Madden, FIFA, The Sims, Need for Speed, Dead Space, Battlefield and Star Wars: The Old Republic, to name a few. But maybe you don’t know how we’re committed to creating games for every platform—from console to PC to online to mobile — to give our consumers that anytime, anywhere access they demand. What does that mean for you? It means more opportunities to unleash your creative genius, be inspired by those around you and ignite your path in any direction you choose. We are open to considering candidates at the Manager or Senior Manager level, depending on capabilities. * Manager/Senior Manager, Corporate Development Join EA’s fast-paced Corporate Development team where energy, teamwork, original ideas and contribution are highly valued. We’re looking for an experienced Manager/Senior Manager to join our Corporate Development team in the Bay Area. EA’s Corporate Development team is responsible for the evaluation and execution of M&A and strategic initiatives globally across EA’s business units. The group partners closely with the company's executive management and business unit leaders to: (i) identify growth opportunities for EA (ii) source and evaluate strategic initiatives that will capitalize upon these opportunities and drive shareholder value and (iii) manage the transaction execution and integration process. Primary Responsibilities Lead the evaluation and execution of M&A opportunities and strategic initiatives, including acquisitions, investments, divestitures, and strategic projects & partnerships: Opportunity evaluation and assessment Financial modelling and valuation Business case development Diligence & issue resolution Transaction execution & integration Management of internal and external transaction team Effectively partner with cross-functional teams and business unit colleagues Prepare and deliver presentations to business unit leaders and senior management Source, research, and recommend potential M&A and strategic opportunities Monitor and assess market participants and trends in the gaming, interactive entertainment, and related sectors Experience & Skills Required MBA from top-tier institution Total work experience of 10+ years with a minimum of 4 years in corporate development at a large technology or media company, and a background in investment banking Excellent financial analysis and valuation skills, including understanding of merger/acquisition analysis and related issues Excellent business sense and ability to understand and resolve complex business issues Dynamic interpersonal skills and ability to interact and influence across all levels within and outside the company Excellent communication (written/verbal) and presentation skills Excellent critical thinking, problem solving, and analytical skills A strong personal interest in the gaming industry Other Qualifications Ability to manage multiple projects in a fast-paced environment Ability to clearly communicate and present to executive management Ability to assimilate and work with multiple business units within the company Strong understanding of corporate finance and financial modelling best-practices Collaborative, team player Fun, outgoing, and easy to work with Interested in gaming It’s not easy building the world’s best digital playground. It’s hair-standing-on-end exhilarating. It’s down-in-the-trenches challenging. It’s stroke-of-brilliance-at-midnight creative. It’s you—taking risks, challenging yourself, pursuing ideas, changing the way millions of people do something they love: play. In an industry that’s changing every day, EA is positioned for growth thanks to smart business plans, strategic acquisitions, and most importantly, our creative people around the world who gather each day to unite the world through play. We take that last part very seriously, so if what you’re reading excites you as much as it does us, apply today.

Job Title: MBA Associate Product Manager Intern (Summer 2023) #WeAreEA and we exist to inspire the world to play. EA values creativity, pioneering, passion, determination, learning, and teamwork. We mean things like acting with curiosity, speaking up with original ideas, and committing to each other as one team. We’re looking for all the best kinds of people to make great experiences for our players. The best people want a job that inspires them, while giving them room to enjoy their lives. And we want to give them that. We celebrate diversity and inclusion by creating a place where you can come to work and be yourself. And we want you to join us. We’re hiring an Associate Product Manager Intern. This role is part of EA’s Customer Experience (CE) organization. CE strives to make EA known for taking care of its players. We’re players taking care of players and people talking to people – whenever, wherever, and however they need us. This role is responsible for helping define and execute on the technology and innovation that makes it possible for EA Customer Experience to deliver unique player experiences. In this role, you will interact with the IT group responsible for engineering and development as well as with stakeholder groups within CE and EA to ensure a consistent, streamlined, end-to-end support solution for both game teams and players. We are looking for an Associate Product Manager skilled in the art of product management to join the Product Management team. The Associate Product Manager is a critical input to the roadmap definition process for products associated with their product line. This role has a wide range of responsibilities and reports to the Director of Product. So how does the Associate Product Manager Intern make great experiences for players? They: Subject matter expertise Operate as the business representative to IT and subject matter expert for the assigned product(s) with multiple touchpoints and parallel initiatives Transfer knowledge and empower the user acceptance team early in the sprint planning process to ensure their input is provided and incorporated Leverage and incorporate data and insights during the planning, prioritization and validation phases to help articulate the impact to the business Collaborate in and/or lead player experience design exercises that may lead to Service Design Council presentations Stakeholder and partner relationship management Consistently communicate and collaborate with partners and stakeholders to ensure they are familiar with the backlog, roadmap and schedule Work closely with all stakeholders to ensure their needs and concerns are considered and addressed in a timely and informed manner Operate as the point of contact for your product with the various EA central services teams and participate in the partnership through submitting CE requests Contribute to the ideas, feedback and data to the roadmap discussions with colleagues within the product line as well as the Principal Product Manager Product Management Complete the planned activities in a complex business environment with shifting stakeholder needs and timelines Develop research plans using qualitative and quantitative data that influences the product roadmap for enhancing existing products and future innovations Represent the business when working with the IT department during development Track, prioritize and continuously groom defects and their impact to the business while the product is still in one of the phases of Test and Learn, Execute, and Measure Participate and collaborate, as the representative for your product, on cross-functional initiatives driven out of the associated internal teams Operational knowledge Listen to internal and external product users to understand how they use the respective products Identify and mitigate product risks once in the production environment and prior to hand-off to the systems team Leverage the measurable success criteria and metrics that we can use to track progress Release management Ensure documentation on sprint schedules, reporting and associated variances is maintained and up to date Accountable for the sprint release notes content Collaborate with QA and UAT to ensure testing preparedness, documentation and reporting for your product launch Consistently generate and maintain accurate and consistent documentation aimed at ensuring knowledge is not siloed and/or limited to one person or group Collaborate with leadership in the continuous improvements to processes associated with and impactful the Product Management team If you’re interested in this role, you’ll need these skills or experiences: Working toward a bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Information Systems, Business, or a related discipline (December 2023 or Spring 2024 grads) Previous intern experience in product or program management is helpful Strong business strategy and critical thinking skills with the ability to get into the technical details Confident communicator who likes to present and can share information in a way that both technical and non-technical audiences can easily understand Curiosity and passion for improving the customer experience – and experience doing that! Experience managing technical initiatives involving stakeholders from different business units working towards a unified solution across divisions Experience with JIRA Proven ability to network and collaborate Ability to understand trends and convert into actionable efforts

EA Create is a collective of content production teams partnering with EA Studios game teams to deliver outstanding visuals, audio, and technology. Our teams consist of artists, engineers, technicians, designers, and development directors. Worldwide, we combine our teams to form a global group of extraordinary individuals fueled by imagination and a unified experience creating amazing visuals, sound, and experiences. We are a diverse team, unified through collaboration, culture, and craft. The EA Create Capture team is made up of industry-experts responsible for motion and performance capture, 3D body and facial scanning, data processing, and virtual cinematography. We are looking for a Motion Capture Technical Supervisor to join EA's Create Capture team, working out of its LA motion and performance capture facility. As a member of the team, you will be directly responsible for maintaining and upgrading studio technologies and supporting multiple game development teams with the creation of animation content. You will help integrate motion data by using EA proprietary technologies to maintain the highest quality animation possible. You will report to the Senior Acquisition Manager, work with the studio manager, motion capture technicians, postproduction, and development teams through all phases of a project. You will have... 10+ years of experience as a motion capture technician. (Vicon preferred) 5+ years of on-set experience in live performance industry (Mocap preferred.) Experience working in a busy production environment. 5+ years of experience in Maya, Motion Builder and/or Unreal Engine. Experience working on at least one shipped AAA game title. Familiar with other motion capture hardware/software. Expertise with several of the following technologies: optical motion capture, stretch sensor gloves, inertial motion capture, volumetric capture, virtual production, virtual cameras, 3D and 4D scanning, photogrammetry, FACS direction, photometric scanning, audio/visual systems, timecode/genlock and computer networking. Scripting knowledge a plus. Attention to detail and solve complex problems and the ability to adjust priorities Passion for technological advancements within the industry Pleasant and professional nature. Time and task management. Ability to work on-site at our studio Excellent troubleshooting abilities. Manage accurate documentation of configurations and procedures. What you will do... Work with the studio manager to ensure studio technology is up-to-date, maintained and prepared to meet scheduled demand. Take responsibility of studio technologies ensuring they meet the demand of development teams and the needs of on-set studio technicians. Lead a team of motion capture technicians to capture the highest data possible. Work with development teams to help plan out their mocap sessions, anticipate technical requirements and ensure those requirements are ready in time for their sessions. Troubleshoot systems during mocap sessions. Quality control of captured data. Understand automation pipelines and workflows and captured data can run through pipelines. Review and provide feedback on project streamlining. Foster positive working relationships, teamwork within the production teams. Work with 3rd parties to quickly troubleshoot and resolve problems. Identify areas for improvement and work with other technical groups within Capture on implementing them.

Music Intern Please include a cover letter with your submission Electronic Arts is looking for high performing students to join our world-class internship experience. Summer 2023 will be better than ever as we bring all interns together on-site for orientation week and prep students for the future ways of work by offering remote and hybrid opportunities depending on your location. For more information about our Next-Gen Program, visit https://www.ea.com/careers/interns-and-university-graduates Our teams build meaningful relationships with hundreds of millions of players around the world who love our games. We aim to be the best at meeting players where they are and supporting them throughout their journey with EA. Our teams develop the strategic vision of our products, run outstanding multi-channel campaigns, build global engagement across all touch points, develop global insights, and propel sales and global publishing. We understand the dynamic global landscape so we can bring relevant content, promotions, and help to players anywhere. Responsibilities You will work with music supervisors to promote production processes across all titles. You will support music marketing for trailer production, and will conduct analyses of social media impact in tandem with EA music related launches. You will analyze the social media presence of soundtrack artists before launches to identify Marketing priorities. You will track soundtrack engagement on social media and worldwide reception. Help produce multiple soundtracks. Create weekly reports on new music, latest artists, worldwide music headlines. Help create music team weekly meeting agendas. Help search for trailer songs. Assist music supervisors with asset and production flow. Oversee shipments and tracking to external partners and talent. Support quality control and testing all final assets before game implementation. Participate in marketing brainstorm meetings. Conduct and present on multiple case studies on latest music usage in tech and media. Qualifications Enrolled in a bachelor's program Someone who loves music and desires to work in the music industry. Someone who has an ear to the ground for new music trends and new artists. Someone who excels in a team environment and can also work independently. Someone who maintains a professional demeanor, especially when dealing with talent and executives. Someone who understands projects based on quick instructions. Someone who works well under time constraints in a fast-paced environment. Someone who understands and respects the importance of department confidentiality.

Someone who understands projects based on quick instructions. Someone who works well under time constraints in a fast-paced environment. Someone who understands and respects the importance of department confidentiality.

Electronic Arts Inc. is a global leader in interactive entertainment. We develop and deliver games, content and online services across platforms. We have a broad portfolio of brands that span the most popular genres. We exist to Inspire the World to Play. We create extraordinary new game experiences for our millions of players everywhere by bringing together experienced people that combine creativity, innovation, and passion. We immerse our employees into an inclusive culture and provide opportunities for learning and leading that allow our employees to do the most impactful and rewarding work of their careers. Join us in driving the next revolution in games. Make An Impact The Network Engineering & Architecture team is looking for a Network Architect to help us build great online gaming experiences for our fans all over the world. You will bring expert knowledge in putting a solid network foundation in place. You will work with other game development areas, studio and other IT functions to provide best in class solution. The main goal will be to design and implement technologies and networks that will be the backbone of our game development. You will report to the Sr. Manager of Network Engineering and will work with different groups within the infrastructure and EAIT umbrella. Responsibilities Design & build multi-site, multi-cloud and DC/Colo network infrastructure. An important member of the team and responsible for design/develop scalable and high available global network architectures to meet the needs. Develop scripts and processes to deploy and validate changes across all network Infrastructure-as-Code. Partner with vendors to select appropriate technical solutions. Develop technology appropriate to provide stable and scalable technical solutions. Collaborate with partners to develop agreement, achieve results, and accomplish projects across the organization on time and within budget. Analyze processes and workflows within the existing infrastructure and network services lifecycle including the delivery for customers, looking for ways to improve its performance and secure it. Contribute to standards and design patterns. Provide solutions tailored to internal requirements. Articulate design rationale, flexibly adapt solutions, and iterate designs. Provide 3rd level support and input to teams diagnosing reported issues, providing root cause analysis. Enhance efficiency with automation when and wherever possible. Cross train other team members on projects, and network technologies. Qualifications & Skills Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Science or a related engineering field, or commensurate work experience. 12+ years of relevant technology and network engineering/architecture experience. 3+ years of hands-on cloud & hybrid networking experience with at least one of the leading public cloud platforms, AWS, GCP, Azure, etc. Solid experience with multi vendor technologies and platform, like Cisco, Arista, PA, SilverPeak, F5 and Citrix. In-depth understanding of modern, software-defined, cloud-native networking technologies. Experience with full networking stack, technology, and protocols, including VxLAN, NFV, CNF, SmartNIC, Routing Protocols (BGP, MP-BGP, EVPN, OSPF), Wireless (IoT), Firewall, Load Balancer and SD-WAN. Solid technical understanding of hybrid, multi-cloud architectures (engineering/operations experience a bonus). Experience with programming and know at least one programming language such as Python and Java. Must be a team player and able to collaborate with a global team. Comfortable working with global teams operating across different time zones.

Next-Gen Talent Senior Recruiter We’re the Next-Gen Talent team (NGT to our friends). Our mission: to find the next generation’s next-level talent who will inspire the world to play. We help interns and recent grads turn their dreams into dream jobs. In addition to recruiting, we also create memorable and meaningful experiences for our emerging talent and encourage their development through our programs and initiatives. If you’re ready to help shape the future of gaming, we’re ready to meet you. We're looking for an enthusiastic Senior Recruiter to join our team and guide our efforts in intern and University grad recruitment. You will understand technical recruitment requirements, maintain an inclusive candidate pipeline, and provide a top-notch experience for candidates and hiring partners. You will report to the Manager of Next-Gen Talent and serve as a primary advisor in driving EA's Next-Gen recruitment. If you're ready for an exciting challenge with this team, we'd love to hear from you! What a Next-Gen Talent Senior Recruiter Does At EA Full-cycle recruitment (application review, candidate screen, interview coordination, offer creation, and closing of candidates) for technical teams across the US and Canada Work with recruitment and department leads in the development of hiring strategies Cascade headcount targets to hiring teams, identify job descriptions, and curate inclusive hiring approaches in conjunction with your hiring partners Be the expert for hiring managers providing guidance on recruitment and interview practices, candidate sharing, and assessment of candidates Regular report outs on recruitment progress to hiring partners and technical leader Provide memorable and unique experiences to our cohorts of intern/co-op and University grads Who You Are Bachelor's degree or equivalent 5+ years of experience as a recruiter, preferably in tech Foundation of best practices regarding tracking, communication, and reporting Experience serving as a recruitment advisor and partner to hiring teams You have a true passion for inclusivity Consultative, influential, and collaborative with all levels of team members Be willing to travel - up to 50%

Marketing Our Marketing Team at large exists to tell the story of Electronic Arts and expand the positive power of play. This encompasses all our amazing games and experiences, including The Sims, Madden NFL, FIFA, Apex Legends, Battlefield 2042, and It Takes Two (Game of the Year, 2021). At the forefront of building meaningful relationships with our players around the world, we're a multi-functional group driven by social purpose and inclusive values. We develop the strategic vision of our products, run world class multi-channel campaigns, execute on innovative global engagement across all touch points, and make sure our brand is consistently awesome everywhere we show up Join us in driving the next revolution in games as our PR Manager, North American Football. In this role, you will report to the Integrated Communications Director, North American Football. We are open to remote or hybrid talent located within North America or within proximity to a North American Electronic Arts office. Responsibilities Lead the development of the public relations plans for Madden NFL and EA SPORTS College Football in partnership with EA Tiburon and EA SPORTS marketing teams. Plan, implement and manage strategic PR plans that result in positive coverage and conversations about North American football titles Management of external-facing communications materials including press releases, messaging documents, blogs, fact sheets and more. Plan and budget for different PR events, programs and initiatives Quickly grow and maintain a healthy relationship with key spokespeople on the Studio and Brand teams Coordinate and staff media interviews with Sr. Leaders and C-suite level executives, and provides interview preparation for each spokesperson Measure and provide reports on each PR campaign and their individual campaign beats Strengthen and create relationships with relevant journalists across endemic and mainstream media Develop and implement crisis communications recommendations as needed Ensure all Electronic Arts standards and processes are observed and followed. Requirements You have 5+ years of experience in a public relations or integrated communications role, working within the sports or video game industry You have Bachelor's degree in Communications, Marketing or related field You can manage numerous projects simultaneously, while prioritizing high-return work. You have a passion for storytelling and an editing eye. You are able to manage multiple priorities and achieve high-quality results on deadlines. You are familiar with EA, our games, and the gaming industry.

We are hiring a Principal Data Scientist for our Studio Data and Insights (SDI) Data Science team. SDI Data Science partners with all of EA’s game studios to offer data science products and solutions. Our principal data scientists are expected to provide expert level knowledge surrounding AI/ML and engineering, being able to execute on data science best practices, take part in driving our data science strategy, mentor junior data scientists and incorporating cutting edge AI/ML technology into the internal products we offer. What You'll Do Work directly with game teams/partners (internal clients) to understand their offerings/domain and create data science products and solutions to solve for their use cases. Drive long term strategic vision for data science products and services across all of our titles. Design, improve and work with our data pipeline that transfers and processes petabytes of data using S3, Kubernetes, Python, Apache Kafka, & Hive. Build data manipulation, processing, and data visualization tools and share these tools across the team and stakeholders. Leverage your statistical and computational knowledge to build algorithms for calculating variances, state predictions, and find trends. Apply data analysis, data mining and data engineering to present data clearly and develop experiments (A/B testing). Ensure high-quality methodology and experimental design and how these experiments can produce actionable, trustworthy conclusions. Assist game teams and data teams in making key business decisions. Work with development teams to build tools for data logging and repeatable data tasks that will accelerate and automate data scientist duties. Effectively communicate data science projects and products both within the organization and externally. Experience Background PhD/Master's in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or another quantitative field OR 12+ years experience in data industry 8+ years of professional experience manipulating data sets, building statistical models and productizing models along with experience applying Data Science methodologies to real-world problems. Ability to drive projects to their completion. Expert status in analyzing extremely complex, multi-dimensional data sets with a variety of tools. Data warehouse and non-relational data techniques knowledge to work with engineering partners Programming experience in a system programming language such as C/C++ or Java. Familiarity with at least one scripting language: R, Python, or Scala. Experience using SQL or other query languages. Big data technologies such as Hadoop, MapReduce, Hive, and Pig Superior verbal, visual and written communication skills to educate and work with cross functional teams on controlled experiments. Application deployment using AWS, GCP, Virtual Machines, or Docker Experience working for stakeholders with non-data science backgrounds A willingness to learn, share, and improve. Interest in games a big plus Games and gaming are changing. Over the next few years, that change is going to accelerate and without the proper knowledge and toolsets to exploit this, many developers will struggle to keep up with it. Our job as the studio’s data science team is to ensure that our studios are equipped with as much insight and clarity as possible to not only keep pace but become the shapers of that evolution, to help EA lead into the future. We find that exciting and we hope that you do, too. About EA At Electronic Arts, we exist to Inspire the World to Play. We create extraordinary new game experiences for our millions of players everywhere by bringing together talented people that combine creativity, innovation, and passion. We know that our strength lies in the diversity of our people. We immerse our employees into an inclusive culture, and provide opportunities for learning and leading that allow them to do the most impactful and rewarding work of their careers. We put our people first. We provide comprehensive benefit packages with a focus on health and wellbeing to support your needs and help you balance your career and personal life. We provide access to dynamic and collaborative work environments, opportunities to connect and contribute through our Employee Resource Groups, and support for a balanced life with paid time off and maternity and paternity leave, plus free video games and so much more! Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Electronic Arts also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

Position: Product Manager Pathfinder Intern (Summer 2023) Electronic Arts is looking for high performing students to join our world-class internship experience. Summer 2023 will be better than ever as we bring all interns together on-site for orientation week and prep students for the future ways of work by offering remote and hybrid opportunities depending on your location. For more information about our Next-Gen Program, visit https://www.ea.com/careers/interns-and-university-graduates At EA, we believe in the power of positive play. Being part of a gaming community should be fun, fair, inclusive and safe for all. And that is the heart of the Positive Play Group. From partnering with game development teams to implement best practices; to innovating new features; to the player community guidelines we've developed, our team is dedicated to making a difference. All of our efforts are part of our commitment to build better, healthier communities inside, and outside, our games. Join us as we positively impact the future of play. We are currently seeking an enthusiastic Product Manager Intern for our Positive Play Group (Connection) team. As a Product Manager Intern in EA’s Positive Play Group, you will work on a product that will help players have enjoyable connected experiences; you will also apply the Positive Play lenses to augment positive social interactions. For EA to inspire the world to play, we must be the caretakers of a global, online community who feel welcome, safe, and rewarded every time they play. At the Connection team, the social product aims to facilitate serendipitous and joyful experiences. Product managers wear many hats in gaming. You will help us with: Product Research : you will research trends, ask thought-provoking questions, and identify opportunities to level up players’ positive experiences and connections Data Analysis : you will analyze, synthesize and tell a story from multiple sources of data using different tools and data analysis Experimentation : you will design and complete experiments to validate or invalidate hypotheses critical to developing and executing our product strategy. Responsibilities You have an analytical mind with a passion for understanding root causes and breaking down complex problems & processes into simplified, consumable steps. You are curious about players’ social behaviors and are interested in connecting data to players' motivations and interests to create a multifaceted view of the player. In partnership with your team, you will develop an understanding of the key product metrics from inception to post-launch analysis in order to clearly identify strengths and weaknesses. You will leverage creativity and problem-solving skills to iterate on development processes. You will craft Product Requirement documents and UX/UI wireframes that are supported by data. You will organize and monitor projects from beginning to end. You will design and execute analytical experiments methodically to help solve various problems and make a true impact on the player experience. You will develop insightful dashboards, memos & presentations that summarize insightful and actionable data. Comfortable with ambiguity, curious about player behaviors and motivations, excited to understand the players’ multi-faceted interests and affinities. Qualifications Freshman or Sophomore working towards a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a similar field of study with a minor or double major in business administration. Demonstrate structured and analytical thinking on nebulous problems. Demonstrate Product Sense. Ability to be a self-starter, think strategically, thrive under pressure, and embrace ambiguity. A desire to learn, grow and work independently.

Electronic Arts is looking for high performing students to join our world-class internship experience. Summer 2023 will be better than ever as we bring all interns together on-site for orientation week and prep students for the future ways of work by offering remote and hybrid opportunities depending on your location. For more information about our Next-Gen Program, visit https://www.ea.com/careers/interns-and-university-graduates What You'll Do You will report to the Product Management Director of People Experience Technology in IT and will help build the next generation of products to prepare our organization for the workforce of the future. Partnering with People Experience (HR), game teams, and other important business groups, you will identify impactful opportunities and work with delivery teams to make solutions come to life! You will create product line vision, goals and roadmap based on solving customer's biggest problems Uncover underlying customer needs by understanding end-user perspectives and pain points (focusing on the "why") Determine product strategy that aligns with EA's complex product ecosystem, considering industry trends, vendor marketspace, and organizational priorities You will determine what capabilities and delivery approach will have the biggest return on investment Define and communicate customer journey, process maps, and detailed user stories/requirements Partner with engineering, UX, and external vendors to assess build vs. buy options, focused on delivering simple and scalable solutions with a reasonable time to value Communicate trade-offs and fit gap analysis to guide product decisions and set partner expectations SME in people experience/HR domain- Talent Acquisition, Performance Management, Learning Management, Total Rewards You will manage delivery cycle to take idea from concept to implementation Refine requirements based on prototyping, hands-on testing, and iterative feedback, acting as a bridge between customer desires and technical realities Bring end-to-end product release including feature development, integrations, data migration, cutover from legacy applications, and stabilization/support Manage sprint plans, issues, and decisions, anticipating risk and ensuring focus stays on maximizing value within a timeline and resource constraints You will manage change and improve product to adapt to changing customer needs Facilitate collaboration with partner groups on process, people and policy changes to enhance product changes Build awareness, excitement and knowledge of new features through communication and training material creation and facilitation of training sessions Solicit feedback and analyze data to constantly evolve product and approach Qualifications Pursuing a Bachelors or Graduate degree in Computer Science, Business, Economics, or a related field and graduate after summer 2023 Demonstrate structured thinking on complex customer and business problems Demonstrate a strong sense of data-forward decision making Demonstrate exceptional written deliverables (presentations, requirement documentation, emails, etc.) for core team, stakeholders and executives What's In It For You… A paid internship focused on developing core Product Management skills within a global technology environment Game credit perks to use across the EA family of products EA intern community events to connect with other aspiring product & gaming professionals We ask that you are legally authorized to work in the US on a full-time basis during the 12-week internship. Visa sponsorship is not available for this position.
