Project Manager The Brand team for Electronic Arts is in its second year of building our brand and we're looking for a Project Manager to help manage our projects and improve our process. You will report directly to the Senior Director of Brand Operations. The role of the Program Manager consists of managing the delivery process to support scalability and collaboration. You will manage projects, several teams, onboarding clients and vendors, troubleshoot and provide mentorship. You will support the Operations team with; projects, cross functional programs and improvement on documentation, process and tools to support the Brand Department. You will be integral to ensuring that projects run smoothly and delivering projects using the highest standards. We are looking for you to work with cross functional teams, providing management, guidance and executional support, utilizing our project management standards, methodologies, and best practices. You will also provide management oversight and monitoring of process and workflows to guide consistency and quality ensuring that internal processes are adequate and functional. The Project Manager is essential in the onboarding and transition of new clients and vendors to ensure the success of project work. While engaging company partners, you will lead project delivery and sustainable project benefits. What We're Looking For 5+ years of Project Manager/Integrated Producer/Project Manager experience in a Marketing Agency, SAAS or Gaming Industry Experience managing projects from strategic and creative design to technical implementation – Expertise in multiple areas of Digital/Social/Banner/Web/Video. Calm, cool, collected and collaborative. Experience with project management tools. Client management and team management skills Daily Responsibilities Lead multiple projects as the project lead. Improve and govern processes. Advocate for project management discipline with clients and partners. Develop project management and change management plans that incorporate all business, technology and operational aspects of a project. Deep understanding and ensuring project management best practices are followed to ensure efficient delivery of the end product. Identify process improvements or resource issues and work with teams to address those issues or process improvements. Manage overall delivery and executional excellence. Work with team leads and project managers to establish project planning, such that priorities can be communicated and adjusted with awareness of the potential impact on quality, cost or timeliness. Foster a positive work environment to allow team members to grow. Monitor and report on requirements, compliance issues, impacts and resolution status to leadership. Ensure efficient onboarding process to ensure new employees are provided with the tools and information. Foster collaboration between all teams. Provide support to projects and manage operational changes. About EA At Electronic Arts, we exist to Inspire the World to Play. We create extraordinary new game experiences for our millions of players everywhere by bringing together talented people that combine creativity, innovation, and passion. We know that our strength lies in the diversity of our people. We immerse our employees into an inclusive culture, and provide opportunities for learning and leading that allow them to do the most impactful and rewarding work of their careers. Development Technology and Services (DTS) powers EA studios to create even greater player experiences. We help shape the future from the way games are created, to how they are played and viewed. We are a global team and also the largest studio within EA! DTS proudly consists of the following teams: Engineering Services (ES), Studios Data Insights, and Quality, Verification, and Standards. The Challenge Ahead We are looking for a Sr. Research Operations Project Manager, to join our globally distributed team. You will report to the Manager of Research Operations and will partner with our User Research team, Development teams and other partners to manage the end-to-end operations for Large-scale User Research sessions. What We're Looking For You will form and maintain partnerships across many levels of EA. You will evaluate options and produce creative solutions. You will feel comfortable and in your element as part of a globally distributed team. You understand video games and the people who play them. What You'll Do You will coordinate the logistics of User Research to screen, schedule, communicate, and compensate participants using different software and communication methods. You will manage multiple ongoing projects in varying stages of completion. You will maintain the calendar of research events, working with teams across EA to schedule the right events at the right points in development to deliver the necessary research data. You will work with technical and data teams to grow and evolve the technical capabilities of the team. You will evolve the project management processes and capabilities of the team to fit the varying needs of game teams across EA. You will follow and inform others of the policies and ethical codes related to conducting user research at EA.

We are looking for an enthusiastic Recruiting Assistant to join our team in Baton Rouge. Reporting to the Lead of Operations, you will work together with the Operations Team and our onboarding partners to bring in great testing talent. The Recruiting Assistant is often the first contact for our applicants. They help ensure that all candidates who connect with Electronic Arts Baton Rouge have a pleasant, seamless, and efficient recruiting experience. In collaboration with the operations team, the Recruiting Assistant balances multiple tasks to help organize the hiring process. We are looking for someone who communicates openly with candidates, management and other teams that work together to attract and onboard our employees. What You’ll Do… Support the recruitment process by assisting in screening of candidate resumes. Initiate and communicate next steps process with forward moving applicants. Conduct phone screens and organize in-person interviews. Complete tasks timely and effectively. Partner with team leadership in scheduling candidate interviews. Ensure coordination and completion of new hire onboarding tasks. Stay up to speed with hiring needs and help fill roles. Track candidate progress from application to assignment confirmation. Document daily movement of the recruiting process. Be enthusiastic about learning as you become comfortable with the ownership of your role. Who You Are… Someone who is passionate about conveying the positive company culture, having efficient processes, open with feedback, and who would like to add to their experience in the Talent Acquisition / HR industry. Someone who has 1+ years experience in a related field is desired, though not required. An ideal Recruiting Assistant will have… The ability to identify candidates appropriate for advancement. The ability to correspond well in writing. The capability to verbally express information in a respectful manner. Detailed practices regarding tracking candidates, communication, and follow ups. Excellent time to task management skills. A patient and helpful nature when working with applicants and the community. A passion for improvement as a team and personally. Experience using Outlook, Google Drive, Zoom, Skype, and Applicant Tracking Systems. Compensation $21.45 per hour, working through PRO Unlimited on an assignment with EA Assignment term for this role is 90 days, with possibility for a full year extension. If this opportunity sounds like a great fit for you, we look forward to seeing your resume!

jobTitle: Security Engineer - Architecture and Design – EA Security
jobDescription: The Challenge Ahead You will work as part of the EA Production Security team responsible for the design of security architecture, security infrastructure management and advanced technical support that power our games and live services. You will provide the technical leadership required to create high-quality, security solutions and services that meet EA's needs. Description We are looking for a Security Engineer to improve the security posture of our games and services. You will be involved with the entire product development lifecycle, working with partner teams to help them make the best security design choices. You will find and fix security and gameplay integrity issues at scale, reporting to the Senior Director, GRC and Production Security. Responsibilities You will be involved with design assessments on EA products running on PC, web, mobile and consoles, identifying and participating in the remediation of security and gameplay integrity issues. You will develop a broad and deep technical understanding of EA products, services, networks, and architectures, and use that understanding to guide your reviews and recommendations. You will apply security policy and principles into concise documentation that can be understood and repeatedly applied by partner development teams You will recognize repetitive issue patterns across our games and services, and partner with EA Security, Studio and Platform teams and their leadership, to solve these at scale. You will identify and distill external research, influencing how EA identifies and mitigates emerging security and gameplay integrity issues. Qualifications At least three years of experience designing and recommending security controls for complex services. Expertise in multiple of the following domains: Linux(preferred), Networking, OS Internals, Cloud Architecture, Identity and Access Management, Database Security, DevSecOps.

EA Create is a collective of content production teams partnering with EA Studios game teams to bring outstanding visuals, audio and technology to life. Our teams comprise of artists, engineers, technicians, designers and development directors. Worldwide, we combine our teams to form a global group of extraordinary individuals fueled by imagination and a unified passion for creating amazing visuals, sound and experiences. We are a diverse team, unified through collaboration, culture and craft. The Rigging team works closely with a variety of Game Team partners to build systems to accomplish production needs, create game content (body deformation, facial rigging, cloth/hair simulation, animation control systems), and expand our internal pipelines while pushing quality and shipping a diverse array of titles. Responsibilities Ownership of assigned deliverables, including problem solving within established pipelines Creating and overseeing the development of skeletons, control rigs, secondary animation, and skin deformations Proactive in problem identification while developing and delivering solutions, ensuring milestones and deliverables are executed to a high standard Push for improved visual quality with a focus on high end character deformation Define and estimate tasks in a well-organized manner Interact and collaborate with the key client stakeholders Mentoring Junior Riggers Qualifications 6+ years of technical art/rigging experience with multiple shipped game titles and/or VFX/feature animation Demonstrated ability to transfer anatomical knowledge into a 3d character Strong Knowledge of Maya Proficient scripting experience with Python and PyQT/PySide Strong background in rigging and skinning complex assets Expert knowledge and understanding of animation principles and human anatomy Having a proactive work ethic, capable problem solver who is not afraid of big challenges Ability to prioritize deadlines and maintain consistent productivity in a fast-paced environment Strong communication and documentation skills required to educate artists on new tools and workflows Bonus Training in computer animation or applicable technical subject Knowledge of C++ and familiarity with Maya API Houdini Experience Familiarity with Motion Capture Solid understanding of 3D math Industry experience working on AAA titles Facial Rigging Experience

jobTitle: Senior Creative Copywriter, EA SPORTS FIFA/FC Global Marcom
jobDescription: About The Job The global in-house Marcom creative team at EA SPORTS FIFA is looking for a new signing to add to our squad. The Senior Creative Copywriter role is for a talented, ambitious individual with an impressive mastery of copywriting & creative concept work, along with a proven portfolio of doing what it takes to bring the best ideas to life. This is a rare, yet vital opening for a skillful playmaker who is willing to get stuck in and leave their mark on the beautiful game, learn & grow alongside an industry-leading team, and help craft the voice & creative vision for the future of EA SPORTS FIFA and EA SPORTS FC. What We Are Looking For A unique, adaptable candidate that is as passionate about making the best work possible as they are about EA SPORTS FIFA & football, masterfully crafting a line of copy or creating a campaign from the ground up. A positive, contagious presence on the pitch – leading with optimism, collaboration, and a sense of ownership, who is equally as able to work as a unit as they are to go on a mazy solo run when called upon. A self-driven doer who isn't afraid to explore creative territories on their own or ask questions that will help them develop match-winning concepts. Someone tapped into art, design, and the creative world at-large, finding ways to communicate fresh ideas clearly within the world of FIFA. Ultimately, a Senior Creative Copywriter developing world class ideas, supported by a work ethic to take them from a slide in a deck to a full stadium. Responsibilities Develop and build concepts for various FIFA campaigns Immaculate attention to detail and sharp tone of voice Work alongside the global creative team to craft the FIFA voice across various brand campaigns and day-to-day social & digital copy responsibilities Develop product messaging and feature naming for EA SPORTS FIFA/FC games. Create and maintain the EA SPORTS FIFA/FC Messaging Framework that defines our tone of voice for each campaign moment across key channels. Review and approve copy for use across channels including email, first party, club and talent partner, social, and beyond. Lead copy creation across web, editorial content, product features, and more Work with cross-functional FIFA team members to create content that will span across various EA & partner channels (including Instagram, TikTok, Twitter, and more.) Reinforce the voice of FIFA, working to make sure that we are present in important cultural conversations across all content and platforms. Work alongside design leads, production partners, game capture teams and agencies to bring your ideas to life. Ensure creative ideas are well-articulated and on-brief. Qualifications 5+ years of experience in a creative role. Experience in creative work across copywriting, campaign concepting and execution, social media, film, or video. You are a creative storyteller at heart. You are interested in the power of football and understand the cultural and creative potential of the sport. If you are new to this space, you are eager to develop a deeper connection with the sport. About EA SPORTS FIFA At the heart of EA SPORTS is the FIFA franchise. EA SPORTS FIFA is the world's #1 best-selling video game with over 200M engaged players across multiple platforms, including console, PC, and mobile. Innovation, passion, and teamwork are at the heart of everything we do. With studios in Vancouver, Bucharest, and Cologne, we're looking for the brightest talent, so we can continue to create experiences that connect with millions of hearts and minds the world over.

jobTitle: Senior Creative Copywriter, EA SPORTS FIFA/FC Global Marcom
jobDescription: About The Job The global in-house Marcom creative team at EA SPORTS FIFA is looking for a new signing to add to our squad. The Senior Creative Copywriter role is for a talented, ambitious individual with an impressive mastery of copywriting & creative concept work, along with a proven portfolio of doing what it takes to bring the best ideas to life. This is a rare, yet vital opening for a skillful playmaker who is willing to get stuck in and leave their mark on the beautiful game, learn & grow alongside an industry-leading team, and help craft the voice & creative vision for the future of EA SPORTS FIFA and EA SPORTS FC. What We Are Looking For A unique, adaptable candidate that is as passionate about making the best work possible as they are about EA SPORTS FIFA & football, masterfully crafting a line of copy or creating a campaign from the ground up. A positive, contagious presence on the pitch – leading with optimism, collaboration, and a sense of ownership, who is equally as able to work as a unit as they are to go on a mazy solo run when called upon. A self-driven doer who isn't afraid to explore creative territories on their own or ask questions that will help them develop match-winning concepts. Someone tapped into art, design, and the creative world at-large, finding ways to communicate fresh ideas clearly within the world of FIFA. Ultimately, a Senior Creative Copywriter developing world class ideas, supported by a work ethic to take them from a slide in a deck to a full stadium. Responsibilities Develop and build concepts for various FIFA campaigns Immaculate attention to detail and sharp tone of voice Work alongside the global creative team to craft the FIFA voice across various brand campaigns and day-to-day social & digital copy responsibilities Develop product messaging and feature naming for EA SPORTS FIFA/FC games. Create and maintain the EA SPORTS FIFA/FC Messaging Framework that defines our tone of voice for each campaign moment across key channels. Review and approve copy for use across channels including email, first party, club and talent partner, social, and beyond. Lead copy creation across web, editorial content, product features, and more Work with cross-functional FIFA team members to create content that will span across various EA & partner channels (including Instagram, TikTok, Twitter, and more.) Reinforce the voice of FIFA, working to make sure that we are present in important cultural conversations across all content and platforms. Work alongside design leads, production partners, game capture teams and agencies to bring your ideas to life. Ensure creative ideas are well-articulated and on-brief. Qualifications 5+ years of experience in a creative role. Experience in creative work across copywriting, campaign concepting and execution, social media, film, or video. You are a creative storyteller at heart. You are interested in the power of football and understand the cultural and creative potential of the sport. If you are new to this space, you are eager to develop a deeper connection with the sport. About EA SPORTS FIFA At the heart of EA SPORTS is the FIFA franchise. EA SPORTS FIFA is the world's #1 best-selling video game with over 200M engaged players across multiple platforms, including console, PC, and mobile. Innovation, passion, and teamwork are at the heart of everything we do. With studios in Vancouver, Bucharest, and Cologne, we're looking for the brightest talent, so we can continue to create experiences that connect with millions of hearts and minds the world over.

This is a contract role for 6 months. What The Senior Data Analyst Will Do At EA The Senior Data Analyst will focus on improving data capabilities and business intelligence for our Quality verification teams, astute at spotting patterns, identifying risk and opportunity and convey complex concepts, using game data to improve our Development and Quality Verification strategies. You will report to the Development Manager of Analytics. You will prepare detailed reports and presentations that help your team identify essential areas of opportunity and insight to guide future design. You will evaluate and interpret data to find risks and opportunities, relaying them to the team and management. You will connect with multiple data providers and customers in the organization, specifically in the development of data requests, checking of data received and following up on data issues. You will conduct analysis using SQL and other database tools. You will guide best practices in tools and visual technologies to help evolve the project dashboards to provide essential data for project monitoring. You will develop scripts and queries to import and manipulate clean data from multiple sources. You will help us promote a data-driven culture and lead data governance practices to support us in our Organization's data transformation. You will be a champion for data quality by creating data quality policies and monitoring tools. You will mentor Data Analysts from a technical perspective. The Next Great Senior Data Analyst Needs 5+ years of professional analytical experience, using data to improve processes. Programming and Database experienced with advanced SQL experience and efficient in Python. Knowledge of different data software analytics and visualization tools such as New Relic, Tableau and PowerBI. Build data modeling and understand data warehousing. An enthusiasm for creating solutions involving all team members. Excited to manage processes to increase efficiency on behalf of the team. Develop relationships with development partners, customers, support teams and management.

EA Mobile has a diverse portfolio featuring original and licensed IP titles like FIFA Mobile, Star Wars Galaxy of Heroes, Design Home, APEX Mobile and Golf Clash. As the Senior Director Mobile Product Marketing, you will lead a team of diverse product marketing to develop the best go-to-market strategies, collaborative leadership to achieve business goals. In close partnership with EA Mobile game studios, marketing leaders across User Acquisition, Creative, Research, Data, Communications and Platform Marketing, your marketing marketing campaigns will increase player acquisition, retention, and engagement. You will report to the Head of Mobile Growth Responsibilities Develop a Mobile Product Marketing framework and playbook across EA Mobile games Create and lead marketing strategies aligned with financial plans, product roadmaps and audience insights Build relationships with leaders across the organization including, User Acquisition, Creative, Analytics, Brand, Communications, Regional Marketing and Platform Marketing to meet a common goal Lead team of product marketers to deliver impactful marketing campaigns Create data-driven marketing strategies to capture target audiences and increase market share Build test-measure-learn into all campaign strategies to connect activations to measurable results and goals. Collaborate with Finance and studio to build financial models and business cases for marketing campaigns Develop framework for omni-channel go to market campaigns that expand the reach of our products and live services Conduct ongoing competitive marketing analysis of the mobile games market and with products to ensure consumer and market trends are informing campaign strategies & execution Collaborate with studio to develop roadmaps that align with acquisition, engagement and audience growth strategies Qualifications BA/BS degree 10+ years of experience developing marketing and go to market strategy for live service apps/products and managing marketing campaigns 5+ years leading a large, diverse and inclusive team of product marketers 5+ years collaborating with teams across product, marketing, brand, analytics and finance Communicate at all levels of an organization including executive management Advanced proficiency in PowerPoint Values We value living up to and iterating on our team culture. We invest time, care, and effort in your career growth, role evolution, and learning. Environment of Respect Fun Empathy Collaboration Transparency We look forward to hearing from you!

jobTitle: Senior Engine/System Engineer - FPS Incubation Project
jobDescription: Founded in 2010 by the original creators of the Call of Duty Franchise, Respawn was created with the philosophy that when talented people have creative freedom, they'll make extraordinary games that achieve the unexpected. From our roots as an indie studio to joining the expansive roster of studios at Electronic Arts, this remains our guiding principle. We truly love what we do and want to share our passion with players worldwide. Our shipped titles include critically acclaimed multi-platform games Apex Legends, Titanfall, Titanfall 2, Star Wars™ Jedi: Fallen Order and Medal of Honor: Above and Beyond. Join us for the opportunity to create groundbreaking games with some of the best developer talent in the industry. As a Senior Systems Engineer ( FPS Incubation Title ) you will design, build, and maintain technology that enables the team to create engaging gameplay and fantastic experiences. You will work closely with other Engineers, Design, Art, Animation, and Audio to gather requirements, design, implement, test, optimize and enhance features and toolchain support for those features. You will have an opportunity to work on a wide variety of systems, including collision, physics, audio, low-level OS and hardware support, common libraries, data packaging, asset management, scripting language support, user input, debugging and profiling support, AI, general game simulation management, rendering support, and many others. Requirements Passion for making and playing games. Excellent C/C++ skills. 5+ years of experience. Excellent math skills with an emphasis on 3D math. Excellent understanding of computation and evidence-based optimization. Experience with large code bases and optimizing code, data, and bandwidth to improve both memory consumption and execution speed. Console programming experience on a multiplayer AAA game. 5+ years of professional experience as an engineer on a game team. Nice to Have Shipped at least one AAA title Degree - Bachelor's CS/Math or higher preferred. ( Or Equivalent work exp) Engineering experience working with consoles (Sony/Nintendo/Microsoft) Engineering experience working with window PC ( Microsoft/Steam/Origin) Solid foundation in TCP and UDP networking. Prior professional experience as a respected engineer on a game team. Comfortable in/with Windows, Linux, Perforce, Visual Studio, curl, PHP, LUA/Squirrel If all this excites you, then we want to talk to you. Don't let doubt deter you! We are an equal opportunity team excited about our next journey. Please submit your resume to apply. We will get back to you once we have a chance to review.

*Please note, this is a remote or hybrid opportunity!* Finding great talent and supporting our studios to be the best place for people to make an impact is central to our philosophy. This is the principle behind our newly formed Seattle Studio focusing on open-world action-adventure games and pioneering next-generation emergent storytelling. Join us to pursue your passion to build unique, groundbreaking, and inclusive games that empower players to create incredible stories of heroic adventure. Become a foundational part of respectful and diverse team as we are looking for a Senior Environment Artist II to join our team. Reporting to the Principal Art Director you will help create the visual and gameplay experiences for the immersive and rich worlds our players inhabit. The Senior Environment Artist II will partner with all relevant disciplines in the creation of unique biomes, architecture, flora, and geology from prototype to final assets. You love to study the world around you, are fascinated with the history of architecture, and delight in applying you're artistic and technical abilities to make beautiful gameplay worlds that engage our players to explore. Responsibilities Collaborate with Creative and Technical leadership in the creation of environment content that supports gameplay, environmental world building, and storytelling. Work with Creative leadership to ensure product environment style is consistent with larger product goals. Research, develop and recommend construction and pipeline best practices/improvements in the creation of high-quality environment content. Work with Technical Art and Engineering team to ensure that environment assets are optimized and performant while maintaining visual quality. Qualifications A portfolio/reel that demonstrates your aesthetic and technical environment skills. Please make sure to include samples that demonstrate the creation of biomes, architecture, flora and geology. Minimum 10 years' experience as an environment artist/designer in the video game industry. We encourage you to apply, even if you don't match every qualification listed above. Let us know why this role appeals to you, why you will be great, what unique perspectives you will bring, and which requirements will challenge you to grow. We love to celebrate our great perks like comprehensive health and benefit packages, tuition reimbursement, 401k with company match, of course, free video games and more!

Senior Financial Analyst EA's CFO organization comprises a broad group of finance disciplines. Our common goal is partnership with business teams delivering strategies and providing our players with amazing experiences. All of our finance teams assist the business in achieving profitable creativity by providing financial insight, reporting and guidance. We use progressive tools to analyze and visualize data, telling the story of financial drivers, performance, risks and opportunities. We value attributes like collaboration and learning. We celebrate diversity and inclusion by creating a place where you can come to work and be yourself. Role Overview We have an exciting opportunity to join our EAIT Financial Planning and Analysis (FP&A) team. This team provides budgeting, forecasting, analytical and financial support for EAIT. You'll jump right in and partner with budget owners to forecast OpEx and CapEx spend for multiple departments, locations and projects. Your business partners will look to you for financial support and to provide insightful reporting, analysis and strategic direction. Key Responsibilities You will deliver quarterly and annual forecasts in partnership with teams Perform monthly close analysis and reporting to senior management You will identify risks and opportunities based on business insights Focus on continuous improvement – drive efficiencies, standardization and automation Leverage data-driven analysis to influence decision making and value creation Approve spend requests for OpEx, CapEx and headcount in line with functional budgets You will ensure compliance with EA's policies and procedures Experience Bachelor's degree required 3+ years of experience in a divisional or corporate finance role (FP&A or accounting) Experience with budgeting, forecasting, reporting and analysis Skills & Capabilities You can quickly manipulate large volumes of data to find the story Ability to simplify complex analyses into concise messages You work independently and as a team player across multiple functions Proficient with MS Office products including Excel, PowerPoint and Word Experience with Anaplan as well as Power BI, Tableau or other BI, reporting and Data visualization tools

Key Responsibilities You will deliver quarterly and annual forecasts in partnership with teams Perform monthly close analysis and reporting to senior management You will identify risks and opportunities based on business insights Focus on continuous improvement – drive efficiencies, standardization and automation Leverage data-driven analysis to influence decision making and value creation Approve spend requests for OpEx, CapEx and headcount in line with functional budgets You will ensure compliance with EA's policies and procedures Experience Bachelor's degree required 3+ years of experience in a divisional or corporate finance role (FP&A or accounting) Experience with budgeting, forecasting, reporting and analysis Skills & Capabilities You can quickly manipulate large volumes of data to find the story Ability to simplify complex analyses into concise messages You work independently and as a team player across multiple functions Proficient with MS Office products including Excel, PowerPoint and Word Experience with Anaplan as well as Power BI, Tableau or other BI, reporting and Data visualization tools

About The Role At Maxis, creator of The Sims™, we value outrageous thinking. It's the fuel that inspires the best life simulation games in the world. We're innovators and great storytellers. But it's not just about amazing your peers—it's about amazing yourself and our fans. Take risks, collaborate with brilliant minds and dare to dream big. Together, we can affect millions of players every day. As a Game Analyst on The Sims 4, you'll be handed the keys to massive volumes of player behavioral data and responsible for unearthing insights that inform the development of our games. You'll report to the Director of Analytics. You will work with team leaders from our Product Management, Design, Engineering, Production, User Experience and Data Products team, supporting the Sims 4 live service throughout its entire life-cycle. From pre-launch insight delivery and modelling to post-launch measurement and recommendation, you will have a significant influence on the game. You'll be working with a large but tight-knit studio of enthusiastic industry craftspeople from all walks of life. You'll also join a group of experienced data scientists, analysts, and data engineers as a member of the embedded-and-dedicated Studios Data and Insights (SDI) team. The Sims 4 has an extremely unique player base, attracting a large, young, female-skewing audience. If you're excited about creating the best possible experience for these players, come join us! Main Responsibilities Live Service Analyst: Query large behavioral datasets to evaluate game performance. Measure the impact/success of live service events, free content updates, and DLC launches. Establish benchmarks, and provide both projections and actionable recommendations from planning through launch. Behavioral Change Agent: Influence product strategy and business decisions through fact-based, data-driven insights and analysis; Data expert: Serve as a go-to expert for quantitative methodology; provide assistance to less data proficient members of the studio; make data-driven recommendations Predictive Modeling : Leverage demonstrated experience building, validating and deploying predictive models and algorithms to personalize the player experience. Education and Training: Be a contributor in our team's data democratization and education effort. Teach, coach, and encourage hypothesis-driven thinking. Requirements 4+ years of experience working as a data analyst in a professional setting; Deep statistical knowledge including an understanding of probability, correlation, regression, classification, and A/B testing. Advanced/expert proficiency querying large datasets with SQL; Hands on experience using Python and/or R for data analysis; Ability to translate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders; Plusses: Experience with: Looker, machine learning/AI methods

Electronic Arts Inc. is a global leader in interactive entertainment. We develop and deliver games, content and online services across platforms. We have a broad portfolio of brands that span the most popular genres. Finding great talent and supporting our studios to be the best place for people to make an impact is central to our philosophy. This is the principle behind our newly formed Seattle Studio focusing on open-world action-adventure games and pioneering next-generation emergent storytelling. Join us to pursue your passion to build unique, groundbreaking and inclusive games that empower players to create incredible stories of heroic adventure. Become a foundational part of an ambitious, respectful and diverse team as we are looking for a Senior Designer to join our team. Reporting to the Design Manager The Senior Designer, Encounters works with all disciplines to bring a rich, exciting open world to life for players to discover. The Senior Designer, Encounters is aware of current open world action games best practices, and is ready to push sandbox gameplay and interactive storytelling forward. The Senior Designer, Encounters will spearhead a team in bringing a rich and dynamic game world to life. You'll contribute to the design and structure of the world and own in detail how the world is populated with memorable characters and enemies. You'll also guide standards, process, and workflows to unlock the creative power of your team and work with the wider team to accomplish the gameplay vision through playable content and regular playtesting. Requirements Oversee the creative and technical implementation of encounters, systems and activities across an open world game. Work with tools developers to build and iterate tools and processes that allow the team to create content and populate the world with activities and missions. Help establish and enforce consistent design practices, constraints, and metrics throughout the project. Help set quality-bar through hands-on ownership of open world content from conception to the final stages of polish, facilitating communication and coordinating departments to ensure the vision is clearly understood. Qualifications 8+ years experience on AAA games including at least one project in a senior role Experience with modern AAA open world games and their sandbox systems and mechanics We encourage you to apply, even if you don't match every qualification listed above. Let us know why this role appeals to you, why you will be great, what unique perspectives you will bring, and which requirements will challenge you to grow. Benefits We love to celebrate our great perks like comprehensive health and benefit packages, tuition reimbursement, 401k with company match, of course, free video games and more!

jobTitle: Senior Gameplay Engineer Single Player FPS
jobDescription: External Description: Founded in 2010 by the original creators of the Call of Duty Franchise, Respawn was created with the philosophy that when talented people have creative freedom, they’ll make extraordinary games that achieve the unexpected. From our roots as an indie studio to joining the expansive roster of studios at Electronic Arts, this remains our guiding principle. We truly love what we do and want to share our passion with players worldwide. Our shipped titles include critically acclaimed multi-platform games Apex Legends, Titanfall, Titanfall 2, Star Wars™ Jedi: Fallen Order and Medal of Honor: Above and Beyond. Join us for the opportunity to create groundbreaking games with some of the best developer talent in the industry. As a Senior Gameplay Engineer you will work closely with Design, Animation, and Audio to create new gameplay experiences and take ownership over large gameplay features. You will be working on an early stage incubation project so a flexible mindset is a must, and your opportunity to participate in design and have your voice as part of the product will be high. Responsibilities Work on a game with fast, responsive controls, and fluid gameplay. Work closely with designers, artists, and animators to gather requirements and own feature development. Build, improve, and maintain gameplay systems. Proactively identify issues and fix bugs. Own a problem or feature and see it to resolution. Requirements Passion for making and playing games. Excellent C/C++ skills. 5+ years of experience. Excellent math skills with an emphasis on 3D math. Experience with large code bases and optimizing code, data, and bandwidth to improve both memory consumption and execution speed. Console programming experience on a multiplayer AAA game. 5+ years of professional experience as an engineer on a game team. Nice to Have CS or Comp Eng degree preferred. Shipped at least one AAA title Prior gameplay experience on a AAA shooter Console programming experience on a AAA game. Prior professional experience as an engineer on a game team. If all this excites you, then we want to talk to you. Don't let doubt deter you! We are an equal opportunity team excited about our next journey. Please submit your resume to apply. We will get back to you once we have a chance to review.

Are you an experienced, passionate pioneer in technology - a solutions builder, a roll-up-your-sleeves technologist who wants a daily collaborative environment, think-tank feel and share new ideas with your team? As a part of the HRIT team, you will be a Workday and HR Process SME, working across many teams to expand, enhance and sustain our deployment of Workday across our 20+ countries . You will be working with a great team and contributing to creating amazing experiences for our users and business partners. What are we looking for? Preferably located on the West Coast We are seeking an experienced individual with Workday techno-functional expertise. This role will be a point-of-contact and subject matter expert for various areas within Workday, such as Core HR, Time Tracking and Absence Management. You will build strong relationships and collaborate closely with our business partners to understand business challenges, capture requirements and deliver solutions in Workday. You will provide your expertise in helping to support our end users and partners. This role will stay connected and be proactive in Workday's roadmap as we evaluate and adopt new functionality to enhance our deployment. Role Details Provide functional consulting services to HR by acting as the subject matter expert for Workday Lead various projects involving new functionality, process improvement and related integrations. Ability to analyze functional specifications and change requests and deliver Workday solutions Develop and deliver solutions end-to-end, from end-user experience to system impact and support. Continually seeks ways to improve the process of delivering Workday solutions. Support upgrades, enhancements, testing, validation, and overall system performance Provide both leadership and support for Workday issue resolution. Understand and follow Data Governance and ensure attention to data quality Understand and ensure security and data privacy standards Workday-Specific Experience Strong experience with Core HR, Workday Time Tracking and Absence Management configurations, with the ability to provide senior level configuration expertise Proficient in Workday report writing. Possess knowledge of security architecture, fields, domains and data objects in Workday Ability to develop and support integrations (EIB), for inbound and outbound data exchange between Workday and other internal/external systems (preferred) Experienced in Workday compensation configurations, including the Advanced Comp Module (preferred) Required Qualifications & Experience 6+ years of experience implementing and managing HR Systems 4+ years hands-on experience configuring and/or implementing Workday HCM Experience in business analysis and business process improvement, preferably in a 10k+ employee, global company Experienced with configuring and deploying Workday Time Tracking and Absence Management (Time Off) Proven experience managing stakeholders, leading projects and designing and delivering complex solutions Experience with general HR processes and data, HR systems design, structure, functions and processes Superior project management skills Strong customer orientation and excellent communication skills, with ability to communicate and manage both internal and external stakeholders Self-motivated, innovative person with analytical, problem solving, organizational, and interpersonal skills with the ability to adapt to changes and think outside the box Preferred Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology, Human Resources, or related field

Reporting to the Senior Director of Employee Communications, the Senior Manager of Employee Communications, you will be the driver for creation, planning and activation of the internal communications strategy and key initiatives with global impact. With a focus on promoting employee engagement in partnership with our People teams, key areas will include: development of innovative programs to support internal information flow, support on special projects and initiatives, and management of high-impact internal events at Electronic Arts. What You'll Do Facilitate strategic communications to propel corporate priorities, strengthen employee engagement and optimize internal executive engagements. Collaborate with teams to align employee engagement with external communications. Ideate and drive high-level initiatives designed to creatively engage employees in our company, business and culture. Write and edit enterprise-wide communications, and facilitate content distribution across multiple internal communications platforms (email, intranet, video and events). Engage with teams across EA to develop and manage editorial calendar and content strategy, implement strategy on internal communications plans and channels. Partner with cfx teams to lead internal employee events including Global Town Halls, Q&A sessions and other high-impact employee and executive engagements. Develop and maintain strong relationships with HR, Talent Acquisition and Marketing teams to drive integration of Employee Communications as a key channel in global communications and marketing executions. Track results of employee communications programs against KPIs to improve retention and engagement in activities. Education & Skills Required 8+ years of experience in PR/communications, including specific experience and a passion for employee communications. Experience working directly and synthesizing input from executives and key functional leaders. A self-starter with a strong viewpoint about the employee experience. Strong organizational and analytical skills; good attention to detail. Manage multiple priorities and deliver high-quality results on time and budget. Strong written and oral communication skills. Excellent collaboration and relationship-building skills. Experience with social media platforms, internal communications tools, G-suite and creative tools.

Senior Analyst, Marketing Analytics Location: Redwood City, CA The EA Marketing Analytics team is looking for an analytics professional to take on the role of Senior Analyst, reporting to the Director for Marketing Analytics. We are looking for someone who can take our analytics to a new level by digging into diverse data sets relating to our marketing campaigns, applying leading edge data analytics techniques, extracting insights, creating data visualizations and communicating recommendations to our marketing partners in ways that create clarity, guide action, and bring impact. If you can combine this with a pioneering spirit, commitment to team success, and a passion for the video game industry, this might just be the right job for you. What You Will Do Lead conversations with senior leaders, provide structured thinking and analytical recommendations with the right level of details Work closely with marketing partners to understand their needs and deliver data analysis to support decision-making that leads to improved marketing performance, ultimately becoming a trusted advisor. Take initiative, find opportunities to make business impact, and drive for strategic change within the business Provide advice to other analysts to help them improve analyses and provide effective feedback Approach analyses with minimal guidance and have structured, strategic thinking to design a plan before digging into data. Select, process, and explore data from an array of internal and third-party data sources for marketing channels such as video, social media, websites, email, and more to find the signal in the noise. Create presentations with crisp data visualizations to tell compelling data stories to partners and influence the business. Collaborate across a global network of colleagues, with teamwork as a priority. Manage multiple projects involving complex data collection, analysis and application Work with the Director and other Senior analysts on the team to create a strong team culture with efficient cross-franchise insights sharing. Your Profile: Strong communication skills - regular project updates, communication with and across teams, and analytical “storytelling” - distilling quantitative insights into easy to digest and intuitive presentation form. Strong analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills. Able to operationalize abstract questions into a quantitative investigation and tackle them in a data-driven manner. Ability to work collaboratively as a team, and with other teams spread globally. Curious and creative, you enjoy exploring data and finding the next big opportunity. You have the enthusiasm and motivation to challenge thinking and promote meaningful change. You view challenges as opportunities and enjoy solving problems and removing obstacles. Background and Technical Skills: Bachelor’s degree in STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math) field or economics; Advanced degrees preferred. 3-5 years relevant hands-on analytical experience, with ability to manage the analytical process and translate findings from the data into recommendations for our partners. Advantage for previous marketing analytics experience. Experience with stakeholder management, especially with senior leadership. Deep knowledge-of and practical experience with statistics, probability, and hypothesis testing. Knowledge of experimental design and execution is a plus. Strong SQL skills including experience querying complex datasets from a variety of multiple sources. Proficiency in R statistical programming (or equivalent) to explore diverse data sets and create descriptive and predictive models using methods like correlation analysis, regression modeling, cluster analysis. Strong visualization, dashboarding (Looker), and BI skills are an advantage.

Electronic Arts Inc. is a global leader in interactive entertainment. We develop and deliver games, content and online services across platforms. We have a broad portfolio of brands that span the most popular genres. We exist to Inspire the World to Play. We create extraordinary new game experiences for our millions of players everywhere by bringing together talented people that combine creativity, innovation, and passion. We immerse our employees into an inclusive culture and provide opportunities for learning and leading that allow our employees to do the most impactful and rewarding work of their careers. Join us in driving the next revolution in games. A Senior Producer that could lead a franchise team and delegate effectively. Self-starts campaign planning. Possesses skills for leadership and driving team decisions. Delegates to junior team members, while providing strong assistance for managers. Provides strategic recommendations and drives business initiatives with oversight from a team leader. By fostering close relationships with content creators and keeping in constant communication with partners, the Senior Producer guides the production of assets from creation to deployment. Responsibilities Content Production – Help create, organize and execute the production of video and design assets; Key Art, Design systems, and Video Liaise daily between cross functional teams Daily tracking of all assets and approvals Can work autonomously, however relies on Production manager for support Able to filter and clearly communicate notes/ feedback to the team Initiate music licensing and composition requests with EA's music group, confirming usage, territory, timeline, and artist credits. Send trailers and other assets to EA's Legal team and ESRB with proper caveats for review and confirm required disclaimers. Forecasts plan and allocate resources for up coming fiscal +/- 5 % Sync with EA's localization team to confirm on time delivery of localization projects and assets. Provide rapid response to executive & senior leadership team requests for assets for special use cases, events, board meetings, award shows, etc. Source in-game assets for vendors including working with studio producers to understand asset availability and also directly pulling assets from asset libraries. Leads asset discussions and meetings with senior partners across brand, dev, comms, strategy, campaign and video to better understand asset challenges while identifying creative solutions in an actionable way. Communicates asset vision and creative to the team and actively updates them during the creative process, sometimes across multiple franchises. Can mitigate problems before things arise and plan for solutions Guides and mentors' other members of the team in ideation, design process, and creative execution. Monitors tasks and reports on status of external dependencies Uses effective conflict management skills to resolve/diffuse issues during collaborative efforts across multiple teams/disciplines. Maintains positive relationships with other teams. Qualifications 9+ years experience in a related field Ability to work well under pressure and independently look for ways to support and improve the team Proven track record working with developers and vendors Strong communication skills Willing to travel when necessary Partner with main team leaders to guide the creative execution and production of AAA assets for a global gaming audience. Be an accomplished mediator and resolver of conflicts, able to help people and teams with opposing points of view come together and agree on goals and solutions. Interacts with proficient knowledge of production tracking tools, such as Asana, Shotgun, Airtable Can distill complex plans down to their path and essential milestones.

jobTitle: Senior Product Manager, People Experience Systems
jobDescription: Role : Senior Product Manager, People Experience Systems Location: EA Redwood Shores, CA, Austin, TX, Seattle, WA, Vancouver, Los Angeles, CA Would you like to help EA build innovative games by creating experiences that attract and develop the best talent? Are you passionate about how technology can enable employees to do their best work through collaboration and productivity ? Are you strategic in your vision yet h ands-on in your delivery? Responsibilities You will report to the Product Management Director of People Experience Technology in IT and be responsible for building the next generation of products to prepare our organization for the workforce of the future. Partnering closely with People Experience (HR), game teams, and other critical business groups, you will identify impactful opportunities and work with delivery teams to make solutions come to life! Create product line vision, objectives and roadmap based on solving customer’s biggest problems Uncover underlying customer needs by understanding end user perspectives and pain points (focusing on the “why”) Influence others to make the case for change and decide what problems to invest in Collaborate with stakeholders to define objectives that drive cohesive end to end experience s Determine product strategy and roadmap that aligns with EA’s complex product ecosystem, considering industry trends, vendor marketspace, and organizational priorities Determine what capabilities and delivery approach will have the biggest return on investment Transform specific customer requests into prioritized capabilities that solve the underlying need Define, document & effectively communicate customer journey, process maps, and detailed user stories/requirements Partner with e ngineering, UX, and external vendors to assess build vs. buy options, focused on delivering simple and scalable solutions with a reasonable time to value Clearly communicate trade-offs and fit gap analysis to drive product decisions and set stakeholder expectations SME in people experience/HR domain- Talent Acquisition, Performance Management, Learning Management, Total Rewards Manage delivery cycle to take idea from concept to implementation Refine requirements based on prototyping, hands on testing, and iterative feedback, acting as a bridge between customer desires and technical realities Drive end to end product release including feature design & development, integrations, data migration, cutover from legacy applications, and stabilization/support Proactively manage sprint plans, issues, and decisions, anticipating risk and ensuring focus stays on maximizing value within timeline and resource constraints Manage resource allocation, budget and spend Track and communicate progress while managing user/stakeholder/leadership expectations Manage change and continuously improve product to adapt to changing customer needs Facilitate collaboration with stakeholder groups on process, people and policy changes to enhance product changes Build awareness, excitement and knowledge of new features through communication and training material creation and facilitation of training sessions Solicit feedback and analyze data to constantly test, learn and evolve product and approach Qualifications Business / I.T. Degree or equivalent professional qualification Deep subject matter expertise in HR domain Talent acquisition, talent management, performance management, people benefits & mobility, workforce planning & analytics Hands on experience in implementing/delivering core HR products/tools 10-12 years industry experience with leading system evaluations & implementations in either product, business analyst, or program management roles (agile experience preferred) Ability to work independently with little direction as well as to manage the work of others Demonstrated ability to achieve strategic goals and tangible objectives in a complex, ambiguous, and fast paced environment through: Proactive, organized, and detailed planning including timeline & budget considerations Attention to detail and comprehensive end to end thinking Anticipation of potential issues with ability to drive creative solutions Strong decision making and prioritization skills Being adaptable to changing business models and organization structures Excellent verbal and written communication and influencing skills to convey ideas and manage conflict including: Facilitation of small and large meetings/workshops Creation of written deliverables (presentations, requirement documentation, emails, etc.) for core team, stakeholders and executives Communication of current and future product capabilities

Responsibilities You will report to the Product Management Director of People Experience Technology in IT and be responsible for building the next generation of products to prepare our organization for the workforce of the future. Partnering closely with People Experience (HR), game teams, and other critical business groups, you will identify impactful opportunities and work with delivery teams to make solutions come to life! Create product line vision, objectives and roadmap based on solving customer’s biggest problems Uncover underlying customer needs by understanding end user perspectives and pain points (focusing on the “why”) Influence others to make the case for change and decide what problems to invest in Collaborate with stakeholders to define objectives that drive cohesive end to end experience s Determine product strategy and roadmap that aligns with EA’s complex product ecosystem, considering industry trends, vendor marketspace, and organizational priorities Determine what capabilities and delivery approach will have the biggest return on investment Transform specific customer requests into prioritized capabilities that solve the underlying need Define, document & effectively communicate customer journey, process maps, and detailed user stories/requirements Partner with e ngineering, UX, and external vendors to assess build vs. buy options, focused on delivering simple and scalable solutions with a reasonable time to value Clearly communicate trade-offs and fit gap analysis to drive product decisions and set stakeholder expectations SME in people experience/HR domain- Talent Acquisition, Performance Management, Learning Management, Total Rewards Manage delivery cycle to take idea from concept to implementation Refine requirements based on prototyping, hands on testing, and iterative feedback, acting as a bridge between customer desires and technical realities Drive end to end product release including feature design & development, integrations, data migration, cutover from legacy applications, and stabilization/support Proactively manage sprint plans, issues, and decisions, anticipating risk and ensuring focus stays on maximizing value within timeline and resource constraints Manage resource allocation, budget and spend Track and communicate progress while managing user/stakeholder/leadership expectations Manage change and continuously improve product to adapt to changing customer needs Facilitate collaboration with stakeholder groups on process, people and policy changes to enhance product changes Build awareness, excitement and knowledge of new features through communication and training material creation and facilitation of training sessions Solicit feedback and analyze data to constantly test, learn and evolve product and approach Qualifications Business / I.T. Degree or equivalent professional qualification Deep subject matter expertise in HR domain Talent acquisition, talent management, performance management, people benefits & mobility, workforce planning & analytics Hands on experience in implementing/delivering core HR products/tools 10-12 years industry experience with leading system evaluations & implementations in either product, business analyst, or program management roles (agile experience preferred) Ability to work independently with little direction as well as to manage the work of others Demonstrated ability to achieve strategic goals and tangible objectives in a complex, ambiguous, and fast paced environment through: Proactive, organized, and detailed planning including timeline & budget considerations Attention to detail and comprehensive end to end thinking Anticipation of potential issues with ability to drive creative solutions Strong decision making and prioritization skills Being adaptable to changing business models and organization structures Excellent verbal and written communication and influencing skills to convey ideas and manage conflict including: Facilitation of small and large meetings/workshops Creation of written deliverables (presentations, requirement documentation, emails, etc.) for core team, stakeholders and executives Communication of current and future product capabilities

We make games - that's awesome. In fact, our software entertains millions of people around the world with the most fantastic and immersive interactive experiences ever made, and we strive to exceed ourselves with every new title. Amazing games are made by amazing people. That's why we employ the most creative and passionate people in the industry. Together, we enable our players to be heroes, whether by saving the planet from alien invaders, slaying dragons or scoring the winning touchdown. Yup - It's the coolest job on the planet! As a Senior Site Reliability Engineer, you will report to the SRE - Lead. The Challenge Ahead Cloud innovations change the gaming industry landscape every day, adding new capabilities, enabling new scenarios, and redefining the category. Within EA, the Game Server Hosting organization builds the critical, cloud-native game server infrastructure and studio-facing tooling that underpins EA's current generation of multiplayer games and fuels innovation of the next wave. We are looking for an experienced Site Reliability Engineer to support the GSH team by writing tools to make it easier for EA's game teams to onboard with and use our services. Responsibilities You will create monitoring, alerting and dashboarding solutions that improve visibility into EA's application performance and business metrics. You will help design and develop robust, supportable tools to automate the deployment and management of distributed, large-scale production systems on cloud services. You will perform root cause analysis and post-mortems with an eye towards future prevention. You will use automation technologies to ensure repeatability, eliminate toil, reduce mean time to detection and resolution (MTTD & MTTR) and repair services. You will produce documentation and support tooling for online support teams. Qualifications 5+ years of experience monitoring infrastructure and application availability to ensure SLI and SLO. 3+ years of experience with managing cloud-based service infrastructure and software using Kubernetes and Docker. Strong understanding of *nix operating systems. Network experience, including an understanding of standard protocols/components. Familiarity with common infrastructure and software deployment automation tools such as Terraform, Helm and ArgoCD. Experience writing code in Golang, Python, or Java and scripting with Bash. Experience working with distributed systems.

We are EA And we make games – how cool is that? In fact, we entertain millions of people across the globe with the most amazing and immersive interactive software in the industry. But making games is hard work. That’s why we employ the most creative, passionate people in the industry. The Challenge Ahead This is a technical role in the Game Development Application Services team and offers a recognized expert the opportunity to participate in the envisioning, designing and building of a variety of enterprise-level solutions in support of Application Lifecycle Management for EA’s video games and central services teams. This role includes the creation of the solution architectures that will incorporate custom, COTS and packaged applications together with integrations with products such as Slack, JIRA, Perforce, GitLab. These solutions are built upon a cloud-first philosophy and leverage public cloud services from leading providers such as Azure, AWS and Google. Coupled with the power of the cloud, the ideal candidate will lead small agile teams to architect, design and engineer applications that will support thousands of current users. You will have the chance to work with game teams across the entire organization, including FIFA, Madden, Battlefield and Battlefront, and central teams such as Frostbite and Origin. You should have a strong focus on innovation and leverage a deep technical background and experience. You will contribute to the roadmap, architecture and technical and business delivery of various software applications. Strong soft skills are required to collaborate with individual game teams, in order to gain adoption and enhance these solutions. Enterprise-level Solution Experience Key Responsibilities Contributes across an entire project lifecycle, which includes gathering requirements from key technical leaders, creating a vision and strategy, presenting to leadership, developing the product roadmap, ensuring projects are on track and completed on time, managing communication with all stakeholders, and collaborating with the development team Participates in all aspects of the proposed service end-to-end, including design, implementation, support, vendor relations and customer interaction Manages the relationship with vendors if applicable, including sourcing, evaluation, and escalation Coding, Language, Architectural Design, Testing And Support Develops solutions as part of the game development application services portfolio that are modular, portable, testable and reliable Drives usage of coding best practices and standards; Participates in code reviews and provides constructive feedback on design and implementation to help others improve coding skills Oversees support and administrative actions related to the installation and maintenance of production systems, while also engineering solutions that require minimal support Leverages the cloud where appropriate, utilizing automation, cloud computing and configuration as code Job Qualifications And Requirements 8+ years of experience developing enterprise level solutions 7+ years of source control management experience including advanced concepts like branching strategies and developer workflows 7+ years of experience with enterprise SDLC/ALM tools, such as JIRA, Perforce, Artifactory, and Jenkins 7+ years of experience with automated build pipelines, continuous integration, and continuous deployment 7+ years of experience of working with .NET web development tools including NET Core, C#, ASP.NET MVC, HTML 5+, CSS3+, JavaScript, WCF, REST API, jQuery 7+ years of experience in database development 3+ years of experience with virtualization and cloud platforms , Azure Preferred 3+ years of experience with JavaScript frameworks (e.g. Angular, React, Node.js) Preferred Requirements Good understanding of various project management models (specifically Agile) Excellent verbal and written communication, and customer service skills Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, high volume, deadline-driven environment Experience developing automation solutions using tools like Chef, Puppet, Ansible, or Terraform is an asset Experience in container technologies like Docker and Kubernetes is an asset Experience with Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning is an asset Azure certifications

Electronic Arts Inc. is a leading global interactive entertainment software company. EA delivers games, content and online services for Internet-connected consoles, personal computers, mobile phones and tablets. Finding great talent and supporting our studios to be the top choice for people to truly shine is central to our philosophy. This is the principle behind our newly formed Seattle Studio focusing on open-world action-adventure games and pioneering next-generation emergent storytelling. Join us and pursue your passion to create high quality, groundbreaking games that empower players to produce incredible stories of heroic adventure. Help form the foundation of our ambitious, creative, diverse and inclusive team as we embark on this exciting journey! We are looking for an accomplished Senior Software Engineer with a passion for innovative and engaging experiences to help us realize our vision of player-driven narrative in a AAA open world action RPG. Your primary role will be to work closely with our design team and author robust and flexible systems in support of our dynamic narrative gameplay goals. You will have the support of both a lead for technical guidance and a manager to ensure professional growth and well-being. And as a core member of our highly collaborative team, your influence will span as much of our codebase and design as your skills and interests dictate. Responsibilities Collaborate with partners across the team to develop the interconnected systems that will drive our procedural relationships and stories Partner with a mix of technical and less technical team members to establish requirements Design, author, refine and maintain your systems to meet all functional, technical, and schedule requirements Work with QA and technical leadership to ensure stability and robustness of your systems Help grow your knowledge and skills and that of those around you by working closely with your peers through impromptu conversations, technical discussions and code reviews Be supportive of those around you and open to both proposing and exploring new ideas, technologies and practices Qualifications Degree in Computer Science or equivalent 5+ years of professional C/C++ experience Experience shipping complex gameplay systems (RPG systems, world state and narrative systems) Eager collaborator with both engineers and content creators Passion for excellence in both your individual contributions and the quality of the game Appreciation for robust, maintainable, easily readable code

EA Create is a collective of content production teams partnering with EA Studios game teams to provide outstanding visuals, audio and technology. Our teams consist of artists, engineers, technicians, designers and development directors. Worldwide, we combine our teams to form a global group of extraordinary individuals fueled by imagination and a unified passion for creating amazing visuals, sound and experiences. We are a diverse team, unified through collaboration, culture and craft. Create Audio is looking for an enthu siastic and creative Sound Designer who will embrace our inclusive culture and share their hard-earned expertise to contribute to an incredible experience for our players. You will work within the Create Audio team and with all other aspects of game development to push the quality bar for game audio. Our new team member will be passionate about the Apex universe, with a talent for creating immersive worlds and competitive gaming feedback. If this sounds like you, we look forward to seeing your resume and demo reel! Responsibilities Design and implement audio that fits in the Apex Universe to immerse the player into the game’s world (including Legend abilities, weapons, ambiences, and foley). Establish scope and submit final audio files on or before required deadlines. Edit and implement audio assets directly in our audio tools and game engine (Miles and Source). Work with Audio Director, Design, Animation, VFX and to ensure that audio matches the vision of the game. Provide the audio on budget as defined by Create Audio and the game team. Help onboard new team members. Troubleshoot and help fix audio bugs. Requirements Minimum of seven years game audio and/or post-production experience. Strong artistic and creative sensibilities with a focus on the big picture. Expert knowledge of modern sound design creation techniques, processing and standards. Experience with audio design from scratch, field and foley recording, processing and editing. Comfortable with modern audio equipment, proficiency in at least one DAW and PC software. Proficient in using game development tools, technology and pipelines (Wwise, FMOD, Perforce) Self-motivated with a solution-oriented attitude. A positive communicator who excels as part of a team. Good technical thinker. Please provide a link for a demo reel in your application.

Development Technology & Solutions spans four continents, bringing together diverse individuals passionate about their craft from across the globe. We partner in every development phase while improving our expertise to create greater experiences for players. DTS participates in creating some of the most beloved games and supports ongoing live services. The STG Tools and Technology Team is looking for accomplished people to help us fulfill our mission of providing creative tools and workflows that allow EA to lead the industry in content quality. Our group strives to build an ecosystem of modular components that are efficient, adjustable to trends and allow for quick iteration of any artistic idea into reality. As a Senior Technical Artist, you will lead the development of the latest Content Creation tools to improve the ways assets are and iterated on across the different departments involved in our AAA games. Our team partners with several groups spanning all aspects of asset creation including characters, world building, animation, rigging, audio and scanning, with whom we collaborate to bring art for modern games to life. Your job will be to identify global problems, propose solutions, develop tools, and build technologies that help our partner teams be more efficient in all aspects of asset creation; all with an eye towards common, scalable solutions that work across all groups and titles. You will report to a team Development Director. Day To Day You Will Identify complex, systematic problems in the domain of tools, pipelines, and workflow development Analyze problem spaces, risks, and dependencies across multiple domains and toolsets Partner with end-users, both local and remote, to understand their workflows and toolset needs Use creative and pioneering work to grow EA's technologies Design, implement, and debug tools Develop coding standards across team and projects Mentor junior team members Who You Are Relevant Bachelor's degree OR equivalent training and professional experience (6+ years) Production experience with content creation/management pipelines for game production Production experience with DCC apps such as Maya, Houdini Production experience with programming/scripting languages. Python required. Previous experience in tool development that may include procedural content creation, character editing tools, 2D and 3D art content pipelines, art importers/exporters, and GUI development Passionate about working with both artists and engineers, understanding the gap between both disciplines Bonus If You Have Experience with C# Production experience with a game engine such as Unreal, Unity Experience working with Source Code Control Systems (such as TFS, Perforce, Source Safe, SVN, GIT) Exposure to unit testing concepts or frameworks (such as MBUnit, NUnit) Exposure to build systems and concepts (such as TFS, Jenkins, NANT) Experience with Agile (Scrum) development methodologies
