Day To Day You Will Identify complex, systematic problems in the domain of tools, pipelines, and workflow development Analyze problem spaces, risks, and dependencies across multiple domains and toolsets Partner with end-users, both local and remote, to understand their workflows and toolset needs Use creative and pioneering work to grow EA's technologies Design, implement, and debug tools Develop coding standards across team and projects Mentor junior team members Who You Are Relevant Bachelor's degree OR equivalent training and professional experience (6+ years) Production experience with content creation/management pipelines for game production Production experience with DCC apps such as Maya, Houdini Production experience with programming/scripting languages. Python required. Previous experience in tool development that may include procedural content creation, character editing tools, 2D and 3D art content pipelines, art importers/exporters, and GUI development Passionate about working with both artists and engineers, understanding the gap between both disciplines Bonus If You Have Experience with C# Production experience with a game engine such as Unreal, Unity Experience working with Source Code Control Systems (such as TFS, Perforce, Source Safe, SVN, GIT) Exposure to unit testing concepts or frameworks (such as MBUnit, NUnit) Exposure to build systems and concepts (such as TFS, Jenkins, NANT) Experience with Agile (Scrum) development methodologies

Development Technology & Solutions spans four continents, bringing together diverse individuals passionate about their craft from across the globe. We partner in every development phase while improving our expertise to create greater experiences for players. DTS participates in creating some of the most beloved games and supports ongoing live services. The STG Tools and Technology Team is looking for accomplished people to help us fulfill our mission of providing creative tools and workflows that allow EA to lead the industry in content quality. Our group strives to build an ecosystem of modular components that are efficient, adjustable to trends and allow for quick iteration of any artistic idea into reality. As a Senior Technical Artist, you will lead the development of the latest Content Creation tools to improve the ways assets are and iterated on across the different departments involved in our AAA games. Our team partners with several groups spanning all aspects of asset creation including characters, world building, animation, rigging, audio and scanning, with whom we collaborate to bring art for modern games to life. Your job will be to identify global problems, propose solutions, develop tools, and build technologies that help our partner teams be more efficient in all aspects of asset creation; all with an eye towards common, scalable solutions that work across all groups and titles. You will report to a team Development Director. Day To Day You Will Identify complex, systematic problems in the domain of tools, pipelines, and workflow development Analyze problem spaces, risks, and dependencies across multiple domains and toolsets Partner with end-users, both local and remote, to understand their workflows and toolset needs Use creative and pioneering work to grow EA's technologies Design, implement, and debug tools Develop coding standards across team and projects Mentor junior team members Who You Are Relevant Bachelor's degree OR equivalent training and professional experience (6+ years) Production experience with content creation/management pipelines for game production Production experience with DCC apps such as Maya, Houdini Production experience with programming/scripting languages. Python required. Previous experience in tool development that may include procedural content creation, character editing tools, 2D and 3D art content pipelines, art importers/exporters, and GUI development Passionate about working with both artists and engineers, understanding the gap between both disciplines Bonus If You Have Experience with C# Production experience with a game engine such as Unreal, Unity Experience working with Source Code Control Systems (such as TFS, Perforce, Source Safe, SVN, GIT) Exposure to unit testing concepts or frameworks (such as MBUnit, NUnit) Exposure to build systems and concepts (such as TFS, Jenkins, NANT) Experience with Agile (Scrum) development methodologies

Electronic Arts Inc. is a global leader in interactive entertainment. We develop and deliver games, content and online services across platforms. We have a broad portfolio of brands that span the most popular genres. We exist to Inspire the World to Play. We create extraordinary new game experiences for our millions of players everywhere by bringing together people that combine creativity, innovation, and passion. We immerse our employees into an inclusive culture and provide opportunities for learning and leading that allow our employees to do the most impactful and rewarding work of their careers. EA values creativity, pioneering, passion, determination, learning, and teamwork. We mean things like acting with curiosity, speaking up with original ideas, and committing to each other as one team. We are looking for people to make great experiences for our players, and we know great talent requires a job that inspires them, while giving them room to enjoy their lives. We celebrate diversity and inclusion by creating a place where you can come to work and be yourself. What's In It For You - Glad You Asked You will lead the global treasury operations and bank connectivity functions, managing two staff members while reporting to the Senior Director of Treasury. Develop a cash forecast in collaboration with Finance. Help set the treasury technology roadmap for EA by identifying opportunities for improved systems and connectivity. Be an advisor on banking issues for the Controllership team and other corporate teams. This opportunity is located in Redwood City, CA. What You'll Do Maintain solid relationship with banking partners Monitor banking activities and services to ensure controls are met. Solve operational problems and initiate/approve electronic funds transfers Oversee weekly and monthly forecasts and reporting of onshore cash Oversee FX settlement process and daily liquidity needs of EA through operational processes such as cash pooling, inter-company netting, and short-term deposits Manage cash flow forecast processes Partner with Europe and APAC subsidiaries to implement cash planning models and manage the process of intercompany funding and settlements. Support the follow- up and reporting on any intercompany capital transactions Be a sponsor for Oracle cash management module: assist Finance teams in documenting processes, identify best practices, be the main contact for any bank reconciliation issues (bank statement missing or linked to cash pooling bookings) Manage bank systems administration Lead the Audit and Sarbanes-Oxley Section 404 support for Treasury Cash and Banking function Work with Accounting, Tax, Legal and other partners to implement projects across multiple geographies Qualifications Knowledge of banking, cash forecasting, cash and liquidity management BA/BS degree in Business, Accounting or Economics; MBA or CTP a + 7+ years of domestic and international treasury experience in a public multinational company Expertise in treasury systems connectivity, bank platforms, Oracle R12, Hyperion Enterprise, Kyriba, FXALL, and Power BI Experience selecting and implementing banking and treasury systems People management experience Working knowledge of treasury accounting for Investments and FX

Game Creation Ops Engineer About EA ENTERTAINING IS OUR PASSION EA was founded over 25 years ago by individuals with a deep passion for making games. Many things have changed over the years as the gaming industry—and the company—has expanded immensely, but we are still driven by the same passion for developing, publishing, and distributing the world's best games. Our history has been one of great success, and our future looks even brighter. Gaming has come a long way from Pac-Man & Space Invaders to modern EA Favorites like Burnout, Battlefield, Mercenaries, Dead Space, Spore, FIFA, Madden, Need for Speed and the world's most successful game franchise, The Sims. Fueled by our talented staff at locations right across the Globe we are united in our passion to continue shaping the future of interactive entertainment. Together we can make a difference. About Game Creation Ops (GCO) GCO maintains and enhances software applications and tools used by all game development teams across EA. These applications include Source Control, Bug Tracking, Test Case Management, Continuous integration and Code Reviews. GCO is fully integrated in a DevOps model where product management, development, operations, vendors, and customer service are tightly woven. GCO adheres to a Service Centric culture, where we listen closely to our customers, develop rapidly, report, iterate, and resolve items together quickly, in an Agile environment. EA game development activities occur globally, 24 hours 7 days a week, therefore our products and services are purpose built to be always available. A critical piece of this service is to monitor closely, optimize and ensure the ecosystem is resilient and performant, operating with high levels of system and service availability. As it relates to providing service for our applications, ownership of the outcome is critical to our customer experience. GCO will own items through the entire service life cycle, regardless of which team may be doing the work, to ensure there is always timely status, transparency and quality communication. It is our mission and core value to provide a superior customer experience, so much so that our emphasis is not on volumes of tickets or request resolution, but instead on how happy our customers are with the service and the quality of the interactions we have with them. While technical skills of our engineers are important to us, we believe that customer service skills, attitude and aptitude are a key to success. Paramount to this is a workplace culture where team members can grow, learn and innovate. We do this through establishing personal development roadmaps, upfront succession plans, celebrating successes, offering a safe place for failure, encouraging an entrepreneurial spirit and offering an inclusive environment. Position Summary The Game Creation Ops Engineer (GCOE) is accountable for overseeing services for all EA locations and clients to ensure consistent performance of our service. The GCOE is responsible for leading technical troubleshooting, driving front line activities for issues, ensuring the uptime and stability of our services, and acting as the first escalation point for all incidents and problems. The GCOE is also tightly integrated into the entire product development process, profoundly contributing to daily stand ups, task execution and coordination, issue tracking, vendor relations, and quality assurance. A critical function of this role is as GCO's service Domain Expert. In this role, the GCOE maintains an expert understanding of all systems, applications and integrations for all services. As part of this, they are continuously improving the services through developments activities, risk assessments, new features, and customer feedback. In addition, they are solely responsible for onboarding new team members, and accountable for identifying and maintaining domain succession plans. Key Responsibilities Operational interface with software developers and creators Provide frontline product expertise, especially during key business events (e.g. title launches, year-end close, M&A, etc..) Operational coverage aligned to usage of the product Resolve operational requests and issues to agreed quality metrics Flag repetitive operational tasks as automation opportunities and drive implementation Manage service interruptions (comms, incident, RCA, corrective actions etc) As part of product team define and deliver enhancements, develop enablers to reduce tech and ops debt, collect and publish performance and usage metrics Manage mandatory nonfunctional upgrades and testing Technical lead for Game Creation portfolio, including day-to-day operations, planning, forecasting, regular maintenance, audits, monitoring, analysis, reporting, and service improvements As a domain expert, support Customer Success Managers (CSM) with onboarding customers and provide 'as needed' training to address specific requests raised by customers Coordinate customers, partners, vendors, and stakeholders worldwide including leading calls and driving resolutions across multi-functional teams Facilitate product vendor relations for organization; interactions include cadence meetings, evaluations, licensing, defect tracking, service and support Provide onboarding, training, coaching, mentoring, and assessments for team members Participant in daily standups, including sprint planning, coordination of effort, and task assignment and completion Proactively engage in continuous service improvements as driven by customer feedback, knowledge of products, product roadmap, and strategic planning Build, maintain, and lead organizational awareness of problems via a 'Known Error Database' Principal leader for service outage & restoration during an incident's life cycle Partner closely with EA security to ensure compliance of existing policies, and new requirements are integrated into planning Partner with Central IT Operations team to align on common process, tools and technology for operations Manage projects from concept to final without direct supervision Desired Skills Software development, DevOps or SRE experience Source control management experience with git, GitLab or GitHub. Perforce experience is a plus. Ability to effectively communicate with senior level stakeholders, including communicating complex technical problems concisely to technical and non-technical audiences Ability to manage multiple projects while maintaining a high quality of work Project management experience (PMP an asset) Experience with Agile and project management methodologies (PMP/ACP) Ability to use a wide variety of open source technologies and cloud services (experience with AWS & Azure is a plus) Strong background in operating systems including Linux, Unix and Windows Administration Advanced understanding of networking concepts; e.g. routing, subnets, DNS, etc. Knowledge and experience with virtualization, servers, and other related hardware Resourceful, proactive, curious and innovative - identifies issues and implements solutions Advanced English and communication skills (both written and verbal) Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills Highly organized with attention to detail and strong time management skills Extremely strong customer service orientation Proven attendance with ability to work shifts, after hours and weekends as required Educational Requirements Bachelor's degree in related area of study or equivalent experience

interactions include cadence meetings, evaluations, licensing, defect tracking, service and support Provide onboarding, training, coaching, mentoring, and assessments for team members Participant in daily standups, including sprint planning, coordination of effort, and task assignment and completion Proactively engage in continuous service improvements as driven by customer feedback, knowledge of products, product roadmap, and strategic planning Build, maintain, and lead organizational awareness of problems via a 'Known Error Database' Principal leader for service outage & restoration during an incident's life cycle Partner closely with EA security to ensure compliance of existing policies, and new requirements are integrated into planning Partner with Central IT Operations team to align on common process, tools and technology for operations Manage projects from concept to final without direct supervision Desired Skills Software development, DevOps or SRE experience Source control management experience with git, GitLab or GitHub. Perforce experience is a plus. Ability to effectively communicate with senior level stakeholders, including communicating complex technical problems concisely to technical and non-technical audiences Ability to manage multiple projects while maintaining a high quality of work Project management experience (PMP an asset) Experience with Agile and project management methodologies (PMP/ACP) Ability to use a wide variety of open source technologies and cloud services (experience with AWS & Azure is a plus) Strong background in operating systems including Linux, Unix and Windows Administration Advanced understanding of networking concepts; e.g. routing, subnets, DNS, etc. Knowledge and experience with virtualization, servers, and other related hardware Resourceful, proactive, curious and innovative - identifies issues and implements solutions Advanced English and communication skills (both written and verbal) Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills Highly organized with attention to detail and strong time management skills Extremely strong customer service orientation Proven attendance with ability to work shifts, after hours and weekends as required Educational Requirements Bachelor's degree in related area of study or equivalent experience

Game Creation Ops Engineer About EA ENTERTAINING IS OUR PASSION EA was founded over 25 years ago by individuals with a deep passion for making games. Many things have changed over the years as the gaming industry—and the company—has expanded immensely, but we are still driven by the same passion for developing, publishing, and distributing the world's best games. Our history has been one of great success, and our future looks even brighter. Gaming has come a long way from Pac-Man & Space Invaders to modern EA Favorites like Burnout, Battlefield, Mercenaries, Dead Space, Spore, FIFA, Madden, Need for Speed and the world's most successful game franchise, The Sims. Fueled by our talented staff at locations right across the Globe we are united in our passion to continue shaping the future of interactive entertainment. Together we can make a difference. About Game Creation Ops (GCO) GCO maintains and enhances software applications and tools used by all game development teams across EA. These applications include Source Control, Bug Tracking, Test Case Management, Continuous integration and Code Reviews. GCO is fully integrated in a DevOps model where product management, development, operations, vendors, and customer service are tightly woven. GCO adheres to a Service Centric culture, where we listen closely to our customers, develop rapidly, report, iterate, and resolve items together quickly, in an Agile environment. EA game development activities occur globally, 24 hours 7 days a week, therefore our products and services are purpose built to be always available. A critical piece of this service is to monitor closely, optimize and ensure the ecosystem is resilient and performant, operating with high levels of system and service availability. As it relates to providing service for our applications, ownership of the outcome is critical to our customer experience. GCO will own items through the entire service life cycle, regardless of which team may be doing the work, to ensure there is always timely status, transparency and quality communication. It is our mission and core value to provide a superior customer experience, so much so that our emphasis is not on volumes of tickets or request resolution, but instead on how happy our customers are with the service and the quality of the interactions we have with them. While technical skills of our engineers are important to us, we believe that customer service skills, attitude and aptitude are a key to success. Paramount to this is a workplace culture where team members can grow, learn and innovate. We do this through establishing personal development roadmaps, upfront succession plans, celebrating successes, offering a safe place for failure, encouraging an entrepreneurial spirit and offering an inclusive environment. Position Summary The Game Creation Ops Engineer (GCOE) is accountable for overseeing services for all EA locations and clients to ensure consistent performance of our service. The GCOE is responsible for leading technical troubleshooting, driving front line activities for issues, ensuring the uptime and stability of our services, and acting as the first escalation point for all incidents and problems. The GCOE is also tightly integrated into the entire product development process, profoundly contributing to daily stand ups, task execution and coordination, issue tracking, vendor relations, and quality assurance. A critical function of this role is as GCO's service Domain Expert. In this role, the GCOE maintains an expert understanding of all systems, applications and integrations for all services. As part of this, they are continuously improving the services through developments activities, risk assessments, new features, and customer feedback. In addition, they are solely responsible for onboarding new team members, and accountable for identifying and maintaining domain succession plans. Key Responsibilities Operational interface with software developers and creators Provide frontline product expertise, especially during key business events (e.g. title launches, year-end close, M&A, etc..) Production Infrastructure & Engineering (PI&E) organization provides the essential platforms and infrastructure hosting solutions that power EA's live services. Our charter is to make EA's games and services available to all players anytime and anywhere. To do this, we focus on the high availability of infrastructure, primary services, and studio services. We aim to help developers to experiment and build new games quickly with infrastructure services on-demand and workflows that promote rapid development in the cloud. In all of this, we focus on being there for players where and when they want to play. As a Site Reliability Engineer, your role covers the entire life-cycle of a product-- from helping developers with architecture and delivery to on-call incident response and triage. Your primary focus will be automation and continuous integration/delivery with an emphasis on solving operations issues using software. You will report to the Senior SRE Manager. Responsibilities You will build and operate distributed, large-scale, cloud-based infrastructure using modern open-source software solutions. You will use automation technologies to ensure repeatability, eliminate toil, reduce mean time to detection and resolution (MTTD & MTTR) and repair services. You will perform root cause analysis and post-mortems with an eye towards future prevention. You will design and build CI/CD pipelines. You will create monitoring, alerting and dashboarding solutions that improve visibility into EA's application performance and business metrics. You will produce documentation and support tooling for online support teams. Qualifications 3+ years of experience with Virtualization, Containerization, Cloud Computing (AWS preferred), VMWare ecosystems, Kubernetes, or Docker. 3+ years of experience supporting high-availability production-grade infrastructure and applications with defined SLIs and SLOs. Systems Administration experience, including a strong understanding of Linux / Unix. Network experience, including an understanding of standard protocols/components. Automation and orchestration experience including Terraform, Helm, Chef, Puppet, Packer. Experience writing code in Python, Golang, or Java. Experience working with distributed systems.

#WeAreEA and we exist to inspire the world to play. EA values creativity, pioneering, passion, determination, learning, and teamwork. We mean things like acting with curiosity, speaking up with original ideas, and committing to each other as one team. We're looking for all the best kinds of people to make great experiences for our players. People want a job that inspires them, while giving them room to enjoy their lives. And we want to give them that. We celebrate diversity and inclusion by creating a place where you can come to work and be yourself. About the Team: The Positive Play team exists to help EA players have positive, fun, fair, and safe experiences in our games. We are part of the Experience organization. You will report to the Sr Director of Player Connection, where you will help to build social systems and features to power the ecosystem in & around our broad portfolio of games, ensuring meaningful connections between our players, our games and our content. The Opportunity Ahead: As the very first lead social designer in Positive Play, your skills and expertise will be invaluable as we aim to more meaningfully connect a diverse range of players. In partnership with the Senior Producer, you'll help re-imagine how players socialize, connect, collaborate, and play together, interfacing with Studio teams across the EA portfolio to pitch, implement and test a range of new social features. You have a blend of experience looking at problems that span across design, product management, and/or strategy, and are energized by tackling unique problems that don't neatly fall into a single discipline. Responsibilities Design and guide the implementation of a cohesive suite of social features with respective studio partners In partnership with the Senior Producer, define a clear, forward-looking vision for social features and requirements; Create player-centered design processes to provide world-class design solutions Analyze and identify social features and experiences both in gaming and outside the industry Collaborate with partner Studio groups to define, evolved and expand features based on player telemetry and feedback Work with our cross-disciplinary team to improve our social offerings through playtesting and feedback, and promote a data-informed and iterative creative process Embrace and advocate for the social needs and expectations of diverse audiences, as well as explore new ways of promoting positive social engagement Qualifications Experience in product design, social game, or related fields Experience developing social platforms, social game mechanics, or other relevant products that connect people to one another Knowledge of UX and/or UI design with an understanding of the user experience Expertise in creating social experiences that bring users and user generated content (UGC) together in new and unexpected ways Proficiency in a variety of design tools (eg. Sketch, Figma, Miro, Adobe Suite, etc.) A strong interest in multiplayer design for PC and console games

Position Title: Software Engineer - II I Location: Austin, TX Description/Background What does the EA IT Employee Experience Engineering Team do? Electronic Arts is a global leader in digital interactive entertainment. The Company's game franchises are offered as both packaged goods products and online services delivered through Internet-connected consoles, personal computers, mobile phones, and tablets. EA has more than 275 million registered players and operates in 75 countries. Our team, the Employee Experience Engineering group is a new central technology team that is responsible for designing, developing and maintaining application and data services as well as enterprise mobile applications that support all employees throughout EA. Our goal is to produce high quality, reusable, services and web and mobile solutions that help each and every EA employee do their job and contribute to the goal of EA making the world’s greatest games. What will you be doing? This role is for an engineer who loves the challenge of building distributed, high availability, and resilient systems. You will be responsible for working with the team’s solution architects and lead engineers to implement their designs. On the services side, NodeJS micro services (REST) and cloud orchestration services. On the web and mobile application side, React and StencilJS applications that can be deployed on web, iOS, and Android. The services and applications need to scale to performantly serve many thousands of users globally. You will be responsible for writing the technical specifications, coding the services and applications in a secure and efficient manner, ensure highly performant and defect-free code through the development of unit and integration tests, and leverage the use of continuous integration systems. You should be familiar with working in an Agile/Scrum model in a modern DevOps organization. You must ensure stellar product quality by adhering to established code best practices and standards,. You should have excellent detailed design and coding skills in building APIs and have the technical experience in OS (Linux and macOS), hybrid mobile and cloud programming models. You will be interacting with product managers, project managers, architects, quality engineers and infrastructure engineers across the US and other geographies Responsibilities Work with PMs, Architects, Network and Systems engineers to understand service and application needs, including build and deployment. Work with Experience Designers to prototype and build web & mobile applications Be able to develop highly available and reliable applications in the cloud. Ensure all solutions being developed are well documented with proper technical specifications, testable and maintainable. Write unit tests for automation, and achieve 80%+ code coverage Implement monitoring, analytics and telemetry in code development Effectively communicate and coordinate with teams across various geographies, mainly US. Effectively communicate progress and issues with engineering and product/project managers. Skills Possess excellent JavaScript and General Programming Skills Knowledge developing high performance cloud-based, REST microservices with latest/recent versions of NodeJS Knowledge developing web applications with modern Javascript frameworks & packages (examples: React, NextJS, GraphQL, Redux etc) Experience coding JavaScript applications/services using Typescript Object Oriented Programming. Work with various NonSQL DB (DynamoDB, MongoDB) and Cache (Redis, Redux, Elasticache, Memcache) Knowledge of unit test frameworks like mocha, chai and jest Experience instrumenting services/apps code for actionable monitoring and analytics using tools like Google Analytics Experience working with Git repositories for code commits, documentation and build automation Experience developing in cloud technologies, preferably AWS Experience working with cross functional teams such as Design and Product teams in an Agile work environment. Experience implementing and integrating with packaged applications (preferably Employee tools such as Slack, G Suite etc) Experience coding in other mainstream languages such as Python, Java Knowledge with Serverless Frameworks (AWS Lambda, API Gateway, Azure Functions, etc...) Knowledge of Data Analysis and Machine learning is a plus. Qualifications Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or equivalent experience Experience in distributed, network, and systems programming in Linux or macOS environment Strong written and oral communication skills are essential Self-starter with an eagerness to constantly learn and pass/share the knowledge along to the team. Strong sense of ownership/‘can do’ attitude and high attention to detail Ability to dive into difficult problems and deliver results on time and on spec Demonstrate a high level of creativity and problem solving

The Production Infrastructure organization provides the essential infrastructure and services that power many of EA's biggest games. Our charter is to make EA's games and services available to all players anytime and anywhere, and to enable developers to experiment and build new games quickly via rapid development in the cloud. We do this with our infrastructure and application management platform, built on Kubernetes. In all of this, we focus on being there for players where and when they want to play. As a Software Engineer, your primary responsibility will be to work collaboratively with a team of engineers to plan and execute on the software design and architecture of our new systems. Most of your time will be spent developing features and optimizing performance, robustness, and scalability of the production infrastructure platform. You will also spend time developing low toil automation tools and workflows in service of maintaining a large fleet of Kubernetes clusters. In this role, you will report to the Director of Engineering. Responsibilities You will maintain and contribute to a large-scale managed cloud service for EA games. You will evolve project statements into preliminary engineering designs. You will expand designs into engineering execution plans and engineering tasks. You will write code and meet peer-reviewed code standards. You will resolve defects during QA testing, load testing, and from the live environment You will engage with clients who use the services and features you create to complete user facing features. You will work with and contribute to the open-source software Kubernetes community. Qualifications Bachelors' degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent work experience. 2+ years of commercial development experience. Proficiency with an OO language. 4+ years of experience with a public cloud provider (AWS, Azure, GCP). 4+ years of experience building, deploying and operating high traffic services. 4+ years of experience with Kubernetes and containerized applications. Experience developing multi-threaded architecture in web and data technologies. Database experience with relational or NoSQL solutions.

Our charter is to make EA's games and services available to all players anytime and anywhere, and to enable developers to experiment and build new games quickly via rapid development in the cloud. We do this with our infrastructure and application management platform, built on Kubernetes. In all of this, we focus on being there for players where and when they want to play. As a Software Engineer, your primary responsibility will be to work collaboratively with a team of engineers to plan and execute on the software design and architecture of our new systems. Most of your time will be spent developing features and optimizing performance, robustness, and scalability of the production infrastructure platform. You will also spend time developing low toil automation tools and workflows in service of maintaining a large fleet of Kubernetes clusters. In this role, you will report to the Director of Engineering. Responsibilities You will maintain and contribute to a large-scale managed cloud service for EA games. You will evolve project statements into preliminary engineering designs. You will expand designs into engineering execution plans and engineering tasks. You will write code and meet peer-reviewed code standards. You will resolve defects during QA testing, load testing, and from the live environment You will engage with clients who use the services and features you create to complete user facing features. You will work with and contribute to the open-source software Kubernetes community. Qualifications Bachelors' degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent work experience. 2+ years of commercial development experience. Proficiency with an OO language. 4+ years of experience with a public cloud provider (AWS, Azure, GCP). 4+ years of experience building, deploying and operating high traffic services. 4+ years of experience with Kubernetes and containerized applications. Experience developing multi-threaded architecture in web and data technologies. Database experience with relational or NoSQL solutions.

Electronic Arts is looking for high performing students to join our world-class internship experience. Summer 2023 will be better than ever as we bring all interns together on-site for orientation week and prep students for the future ways of work by offering remote and hybrid opportunities depending on your location. For more information about our Next-Gen Program, visit https://www.ea.com/careers/interns-and-university-graduates We are EA—the world’s largest video game publisher. You’re probably familiar with many of our titles—Madden, FIFA, The Sims, Need for Speed, Dead Space, Battlefield and Star Wars, to name a few. But maybe you don’t know how we’re committed to creating games for every platform—from social to mobile to console—to give our consumers that anytime, anywhere access they demand. What does that mean for you? It means more opportunities to unleash your creative genius, be inspired by those around you and ignite your path in any direction you choose. The Challenge Ahead The EADP Data Group is responsible for developing a new unified Big Data pipeline across all franchises at Electronic Arts. This platform will incorporate data collection, ingestion, processing, access and visualization all built on a modern, cloud based tech stack with best-in-class tools. The Data Group will provide the tools and platform which powers the future state of game development, marketing, sales, accounting and customer experience. We are looking for developers who are interested in working on a large scale distributed data system from the ground up for one of the most creative, innovative companies in technology. Responsibilities Help us build a unified data platform across EA, spanning 20+ game studios as data sources Develop infrastructure software that slice and dice data, using Hadoop and Map/Reduce Develop reporting systems that inform on key metrics, detect anomalies, and forecast future results Develop complex queries to solve data mining problems Write reliable and efficient programs scaling to massive (petabyte) datasets and large clusters of machines Flexibility to work with both SQL and NoSQL solutions Work with data modelers, data analysts, and BI developers to understand requirements, develop ETL processes, validate results, and deliver to production Coordinate the efficiency, scalability, and stability of data collection, extraction, and storage processes Required Skills Work towards a MS with experience in Computer Science or related technical discipline (or equivalent) Experience working with large-scale systems and data platforms/warehouses A solid foundation in computer science, with competencies in algorithms, data structures, and software design Software development experience, wrHive, or other NoSQL stacks a plus Fluency with Java, SQL, Perl/Python, or C++ Fast prototyping skills, familiarity with scripting languages such as bash, perl, awk, python Experience working with columnar analytics databases or relational databases is a plus Experience with data modeling and BI tools is a plus What’s in it for you… A paid internship Game credit perks Intern events to connect the EA community We ask that you are legally authorized to work in the US on a full-time basis during the 12-week internship. Visa sponsorship is not available for this position.

Electronic Arts is looking for high performing students to join our world-class internship experience. Summer 2023 will be better than ever as we bring all interns together on-site for orientation week and prep students for the future ways of work by offering remote and hybrid opportunities depending on your location. For more information about our Next-Gen Program, visit https://www.ea.com/careers/interns-and-university-graduates What does the EA IT Employee Experience Engineering Team do? Electronic Arts is a global leader in digital interactive entertainment. The Company's game franchises are offered as both packaged goods products and online services delivered through Internet-connected consoles, personal computers, mobile phones and tablets. EA has more than 275 million registered players and operates in 75 countries. Our team, the Employee Experience Engineering group is a new central technology team that is responsible for designing, developing and maintaining application and data services as well as enterprise mobile applications that support all employees throughout EA. Our goal is to produce high quality, reusable, services and web and mobile solutions that help each and every EA employee do their job and contribute to the goal of EA making the world’s greatest games. What will you be doing? As a Software Engineering Intern, your primary responsibility will be to contribute to the development of web applications and/or microservices that power and integrate our worker knowledge, collaboration, and productivity solutions. Working closely with your team lead and solution architect, you will scope and estimate future work, create and contribute to the codebase, fix bugs, and review others’ code. The Next Great EA Software Engineering Intern needs to have: Pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent work experience Experience programming in an OO language Experience designing and/or working with distributed systems Exceptional analytical and creative problem-solving skills Passion for solving hard problems with great people Possess excellent JavaScript and General Programming Skills Bonus Experience Points Front-End Technologies such as Javascript, HTML and CSS and/or Service-Side Technologies such as NodeJS and/or Python Familiarity with Software Unit Testing Public Cloud Technologies such as AWS or Azure Interest in DevOps

Electronic Arts is looking for high performing students to join our world-class internship experience. Summer 2023 will be better than ever as we bring all interns together on-site for orientation week and prep students for the future ways of work by offering remote and hybrid opportunities depending on your location. For more information about our Next-Gen Program, visit https://www.ea.com/careers/interns-and-university-graduates What a Software Engineer Intern does within EPS Social Division at EA: As a Software Engineer Intern, your primary responsibility will be to work collaboratively with a team of engineers to plan and execute on the software design and architecture of our new systems. Most of your time will be spent developing features and optimizing performance, robustness, and scalability of server systems. You will also spend time working with product managers to innovate new features to support EA's many games and reduce technical debt associated with legacy systems through innovation and automation. Additionally, you will be a champion for best practices within the engineering team. Responsibilities Roughly 70% to 85% hands on coding Create and work on large scale distributed HTTP based backend service creating new features and updating existing ones Resolve defects during QA testing, pre-production, production and from the live environment Work with multiple clients working on multiple different platforms who use the services and features you create to complete user facing features Architect and design large portions of the software from features to entire applications Grow and guide other engineers Occasional off-hours support for development needs and support of the live environment helping to ensure our consumer experience is always world class Qualifications Currently Pursuing BS/BA in Computer Science Experience developing object oriented software (preferably in Java/Kotlin) Experience working on online services (via REST or gRPC) at internet consumer scale Experience working on high traffic services and highly scalable systems Experience working with cloud technology and cloud provider services to build SaaS applications Use of technologies such as memcached, redis, message queuing, and NoSQL in production systems Superb communication skills: Demonstrated ability to explain technical issues to both technical and non-technical audiences Strong understanding of the Software design/architecture process Superb ability to take high level direction and know how to execute against it Strong understanding of DevOps, Continuous Delivery, and Agile development Experience with unit testing (JUnit) Experience developing, maintaining, and innovating large scale distributed applications Experience with source control systems Nice To Have Skills Experience with one or more scripting languages Experience with load testing and system analysis Experience with other languages such as Go, C++ or C# Experience working with remote teams Experience with Kubernetes infrastructures and frameworks

Game Server Hosting - Software Engineering Intern (Summer 2023) We exist to Inspire the World to Play. We create extraordinary new game experiences for our millions of players everywhere by bringing together experienced people that combine creativity, innovation, and passion. We immerse our employees into an inclusive culture and provide opportunities for learning and leading that allow our employees to do the most impactful and rewarding work of their careers. Come help us power the future of play. About Your Future Team. Our organization provides central services that allow game teams to run their game servers all over the world and enable players to have great online experiences wherever they are. Compatible across multiple platforms and devices, our platform empowers teams to foster deeper, more meaningful relationships with our players. We are building scalable, distributed, real-time services that help creators to design, launch, and operate new and engaging connected player experiences. At our core, we are passionate about bringing people together, and helping game creators build living experiences for their players. What you’ll do. As a Software Engineer Intern, your primary responsibility will be to contribute to the software, tools, and services that power EA’s game server hosting platform. Working closely with your team lead, you will create and contribute features to the codebase, fix bugs, review others’ code. The platform you contribute to will help ship any incredible games. What we’re looking for. Pursuing Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent work experience Experience programming in an OO language Experience designing and/or working with distributed systems Exceptional analytical and creative problem-solving skills Passion for solving hard problems with great people Excitement for working in the games industry Other Qualifications: Server-side languages such as C#, Java, Go and Python Container technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes Public cloud provider experience (AWS, Azure, GCP, etc.) Full stack experience and/or familiarity with React Experience designing and developing multi-threaded software

EA WWCE Software Engineer Intern (Summer 2023) Electronic Arts is looking for high performing students to join our world-class internship experience. Summer 2023 will be better than ever as we bring all interns together on-site for orientation week and prep students for the future ways of work by offering remote and hybrid opportunities depending on your location. For more information about our Next-Gen Program, visit https://www.ea.com/careers/interns-and-university-graduates #WeAreEA and we exist to inspire the world to play. EA values creativity, pioneering, passion, determination, learning, and teamwork. We mean things like acting with curiosity, speaking up with original ideas, and committing to each other as one team. We’re looking for all the best kinds of people to make great experiences for our players. The best people want a job that inspires them, while giving them room to enjoy their lives. And we want to give them that. We celebrate diversity and inclusion by creating a place where you can come to work and be yourself. We are looking for a Software Engineer Intern (Summer 2023) to join our Customer Experience Innovation Labs team. This role will be responsible for learning new technologies and coming up with proof-of-concept demonstrations. To be successful, the candidate should have a firm grasp of programming concepts and be comfortable with multiple languages (and learning new ones as necessary). So what will you be doing as a Software Engineer Intern in Innovation Labs? Researching new technology areas with the potential to improve customer experience Experimenting with new and existing technologies to prove or disprove hypotheses Demonstrate new ideas to leadership by developing technology proof-of-concepts (POCs) in virtual sandbox environments Candidates Should Be Intellectually curious: Has a naturally curious mind and a desire to frame and solve business problems; actively seeks out best-in-class capabilities. Critical thinker: Strong quantitative and qualitative research and analytics skills; ability to go beyond findings to insights and actionable recommendations. Collaborative: Works well in a collaborative team environment between analysts, internal teams, external partners & clients. Self-starter: A self-motivated individual who can take limited direction and produce tangible results; proactively develops out-of-the-box solutions with the available tools and resources. Technology forward: Has an interest in technology and knows the relevant platforms and models; uses or has a strong understanding of emerging technology trends. Communication: Clear and persuasive oral and written communication skills; an active listener and concise presenter. Positive attitude: Can-do attitude; finds the bright side of even stressful situations and is willing to learn from them. If you’re interested in this role, you’ll need these skills or experiences: You are working toward a BS/MS. in Computer Science or related field. You must not be graduating earlier than 12/2023/ Experience with front and backend development languages (Java, Python, Javascript, React, Swift, NodeJS etc.) Knowledge of databases (e.g. MySQL). Interest in cloud and serverless computation (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure etc.) Knowledge of good software engineering practices. Experience debugging and solving complex problems. Knowledge of source code management: Perforce and Git. General interest in gaming / the gaming industry About EA At Electronic Arts, we exist to Inspire the World to Play. We create extraordinary new game experiences for our millions of players everywhere by bringing together talented people that combine creativity, innovation, and passion. We know that our strength lies in the diversity of our people. We immerse our employees into an inclusive culture, and provide opportunities for learning and leading that allow them to do the most impactful and rewarding work of their careers. We put our people first. We provide comprehensive benefit packages with a focus on health and wellbeing to support your needs and help you balance your career and personal life. We provide access to dynamic and collaborative work environments, opportunities to connect and contribute through our Employee Resource Groups, and support for a balanced life with paid time off and new parent leave, plus free video games and so much more! Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Electronic Arts also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

We are EA And we make games - How cool is that? In fact, we entertain millions of people across the globe with the most amazing and immersive interactive software in the industry. But making games is hard work. That's why we employ the most creative and passionate people in the industry. Save the planet from Alien Invaders. Score the winning touchdown. Yup - It's the coolest job on the planet! The Challenge Ahead Cloud innovations change the gaming industry landscape every day, adding new capabilities, enabling new scenarios, and redefining the category. Within EA, the Game Server Hosting organization builds the critical, cloud-native game server infrastructure and studio-facing tooling that underpins EA’s current generation of multiplayer games and fuels innovation of the next wave. We are looking for a highly motivated Full Stack Software Engineer to work across our portfolio of frontend experiences and backend services to drive our game server platform forward and help ship EA’s next amazing multiplayer games. Responsibilities Contribute to the design and implementation of web applications and user-facing experiences to facilitate interaction with the Game Server Hosting platform Integrate with and contribute to the backend API layer of our platform Collaborate with product, program and project management to ensure clarity and understanding of features and priorities Work directly with divisional and game studio partners to understand priorities and requirements while contributing to releasing games to market. Contribute to the successful launch of online games from some of the industry's top franchises Skills The Next Great Full Stack Software Engineer needs to have: Overall 3+ years hands-on commercial development experience, preferably in a full stack team 1+ years development experience in web UI/UX using a modern UI framework (Angular, React, VueJS etc) 2+ years experience in one or more programming languages such as Golang, Java, Python Experience creating and consuming RESTful/gRPC based web services Experience with building & orchestrating containers using Docker and Kubernetes Exceptional analytical and creative problem-solving skills Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent work experience Bonus Experience Points Public cloud provider experience (AWS, Azure, GCP, etc.) Experience with DevOps tools such as ArgoCD, Git Pipelines, Helm Experience with video game development Engineering Collaboration software - JIRA, Git, Slack, Confluence

EA Create Audio is an award-winning audio team creating audio assets for titles within EA STUDIOS. Through uniting our creative talents and technical expertise, our Audio team is driving industry-leading audio through partnership, professionalism, expertise, innovation, and uncompromising quality. Role Overview We are looking for an experienced Audio Artist who can make an immediate contribution to all aspects of audio development within our team, directly supporting titles in EA Sports. Audio Artists will be responsible for a variety of audio-specific project(s), with the goal of creating a quality audio experience for our players. You would work directly with the Development Manager and Audio Leads. Candidates will need to have skills in post-production and in all phases of audio design and production, with proficiency in more than one of the following components – sound design, music, voice production, and implementation. Key Responsibilities You would be responsible for designing and implementing audio content. Designing and implementing sound patches according to our technical guidelines. You would help debug logic schematics and system components. Responsible for setup, tuning and debugging behavior of coded or prefabricated runtime systems. You would utilize visual programming and scripting languages to achieve desired results from audio runtime systems. Have an understanding of the interactions between various runtime systems, their effects on mix, and other global systems. Understand and author scripted workflows. Required Skills And Experience Minimum 3 years audio production experience (or equivalent) 5+ years of game audio experience Experience in field recording and remote production Fully proficient in DAW production and associated audio production tools Excellent communication skills, written and oral Proficiency in Python scripting a plus Solid experience using game audio development tools, technology, and pipelines Solid understanding of multichannel audio production and object audio considerations Solid knowledge of PC and console audio hardware Outstanding sound design and listening skills Experience in the area of technical implementation of game audio

Development Director Electronic Arts Inc. is a leading global interactive entertainment software company. EA delivers games, content and online services for Internet-connected consoles, personal computers, mobile phones and tablets. Finding great talent and supporting our studios to be the best place for people to do their best work is central to our philosophy. This is the principle behind our newly formed Seattle Studio focusing on open-world action-adventure games and pioneering next generation emergent storytelling. Join us to pursue your passion to craft unique, groundbreaking and inclusive games that empower players to generate incredible stories of heroic adventure. Become a foundational part of an ambitious, respectful and diverse team as we are looking for a Development Director responsible for driving game development strategy and delivering a successful experience in collaboration with the team. Making games is unpredictable, and we're all in it together. Development Directors are our drivers, listening and working with all of our experts to find a way through for our teams. The Development director determines the “how” for the team and is responsible for ensuring the team is focused on the priorities identified by leadership. Our Development Directors work daily leading a team, collaborating with multidisciplinary team-members to decide goals, align and agree on the priorities of the work. Then will follow up when the work is complete to ensure that expectations were met. Responsibilities Works with the Director of Product development to create the project roadmap for their assigned area of responsibility. Work with the disciplinary leadership to understand their goals and create a strategic plan to accomplish their needs along with the project goals. Leads cross disciplinary teams to define the resource needs and build significant aspects of the overall project goals. Inspire fresh thinking and new ideas to ensure the team has the structure and processes that empowers the team to innovate within our games and our development methodology. Communicate the development plan to internal and external stakeholders. You will also have a passion and empathy for solving people's problems and building happy, motivated teams. Qualifications 5+years working with game development teams in a DD or Production role. Experience managing diverse team across different time zones and locations The ability to talk across all levels of an organization Experience of agile project management processes Experience obtaining insights and developing strategies through analytical metrics-driven analysis and design experimentation. Experience using KPIs to set product success goals, monitoring of the product and informing necessary changes to the game. Team player that brings excitement and enthusiasm to work each day. Strong communication and writing skills, with experience preparing and presenting decks to various stakeholders.

jobTitle: Sr Director of Product Development - Battlefield
jobDescription: Senior Director of Product Development Electronic Arts Inc. is a global leader in interactive entertainment. We develop and deliver games, content and online services across platforms. We have a broad portfolio of brands that span the most popular genres. We exist to Inspire the World to Play. We create extraordinary new game experiences for our millions of players everywhere by bringing together talented people that combine creativity, innovation, and passion. We immerse our employees into an inclusive culture and provide opportunities for learning and leading that allow our employees to do the most impactful and rewarding work of their careers. Join us in driving the next revolution in games. Team Overview Quality Verification & Standards (QVS) is a global team leading Quality Verification, Certification, User Research, and Community PlayTesting for all EA products and external Studio partners. We're searching for a Head of QV for the Battlefield franchise. You will report to the Global Head of Quality Verification and be part of a dynamic team of senior Quality leaders, Business leaders, and discipline owners worldwide within QVS. Alongside your team & your peers, you will pioneer verification practices that are both scalable & sustainable in an environment of exponential growth in the scope of experience and choice for our players. You will be an active participant & leader in setting the future direction of QV at EA. You and your team will also be deeply integrated partners in the Battlefield product development organization, ensuring we meet the highest standards of Quality across every Battlefield experience and all aspects of the Development & the Battlefield executive team. The practice of Quality Verification is undergoing dynamic change and transformation. You will demonstrate an analytical approach and be comfortable making data-informed & objective decisions to guide the path forward for your team, peers & partners. Our scale, global reach, and connections require prioritization and focus. The ability to switch priority areas and altitudes is necessary for your success. You are collaborative, build relationships and excel at working with multiple partners. Responsibilities A people manager & team leader. Set inspiring & measurable goals, guide the team toward them, and measure progress Partner with other Sr leaders to build, influence, and strengthen a culture of change and new ideas within your immediate team and partner groups Participate in strategic programs that want to improve or transform quality practices & Quality Verification at EA. Partner with Executives, franchise leaders & the Global Head of Quality Verification to set and deliver the best Quality practices on the Battlefield franchise Work within your immediate leadership group & the QVS Sr leadership team to ensure accuracy in financial, resource and execution plans. Set an inclusive culture. Be communicative and an agent for constructive change within QVS & your immediate team, whether through town halls, reviews, or workshops. Provide necessary oversight for and monitor execution of the Quality Verification strategy on each of your franchise teams Develop an understanding of development practices and frameworks in use. Know how to influence the adoption of improved development practices.. Focus on value and measurable impact Oversight of and accountability for all financial, resource & headcount planning within your franchise teams Deep engagement with essential partners in Development. Focus on mutual influence toward shared franchise goals Measure progress and suggest top-level actions to address progress shortfalls. Commit to predictable delivery and risk management Qualifications People connector who inspires others toward shared goals. Pioneers change Experienced with data-informed decision-making, using business expertise A continuous improvement mindset. Influence-oriented. Excel at collaborating with other leaders and guiding the collective group to the best action, decision, or result Proficient in project & change management Can track, model, and present information in engaging ways Ten years of work experience in a related field (software/game development or related business management expertise)

Senior Manager, Compensation Operations Electronic Arts Remote N America Senior Manager, Compensation Operations Most companies call it HR. At Electronic Arts we made the deliberate decision to brand our organization People Experience (PE). It is not just a play on words. PE is a team of cultural stewards who carefully create programs and talent strategies that directly affect our teams' experience and allow our people to achieve the most meaningful work of their careers. EA's Global Compensation team manages our core compensation programs and provides consultation to our HR partners and business leaders. We stay at the forefront of market trends and combine our knowledge of market practice with the needs of our business to create compelling, competitive, performance-oriented compensation programs that attract, engage, reward and retain EA's talent. Description We are looking for an accomplished analytics or systems expert with experience in and passion for Compensation. In this role leading Comp Operations for the team, you will automate processes, audit our data, own job architecture on behalf of the team, and manage data flows between systems. You are energized by using technology to create efficiencies, and improve operations and working partnerships. You work with and through others to improve systemic issues, learn from experiences, communicate solutions to decision-makers, and bring others along the journey on complex projects. You will report to EA's Senior Director of Global Compensation. Responsibilities You will be the internal expert regarding Compensation analytics, technology, operations, and processes for the company. You will develop the vision, design, and implementation plan for processes to increase efficiency of compensation team members, such as market analysis and job matching, budget development and planning, salary and equity range build. You will lead systems and analytics workstreams during the annual compensation planning process (aka Focal) with effective HRIS, People Analytics, and Talent & Performance team partnerships. You will be the primary contact with our HRIS team, overseeing Comp system integrations and managing data flows between Comp-related systems. Collaborate with HRIS on tool strategy, improvements and enhancements. Lead job architecture for the Comp team, partnering with the Talent & Performance and Workforce Planning teams. Lead Compensation reporting and analytics for our Focal, Talent Planning, and Executive Talent Review processes. Bring strategic partnership, analytical rigor, and change leadership to the budget planning process, including socialization of budget impacts on workforce planning and company operating expenses to executive leadership and business groups. Assess and audit proposed compensation outcomes such as pay gaps, short and long-term incentive provision, and equity participation, by department / location / employee demographics, to assess effectiveness, fairness, and compliance. Manage internal compensation team operations, relationships, and costs pertaining to vendor resourcing, contracts and renewals, survey providers, systems infrastructure, and yearly projects. Participate in relevant compensation surveys, and other vendor-led external events / forums, for benchmarking purposes, and to stay informed about market trends and their potentially applicability to EA's programs. Identify processes or capabilities that could benefit from automation, process enhancements or re-engineering Qualifications Bachelor's Degree- ideally in a business or quantitative field 8+ years of total work experience, with at least 3 years in compensation 5 or more years of experience with visualization tools like Tableau, PowerBI, or similar tools Superb Excel skills (can maintain complex spreadsheets) and data modeling / analytics capability. Demonstrated capability with partner management and experience developing and maintaining collaborative working relationships with multiple partners- including executives, line management, peers, and partners. Experienced in working with sensitive data, providing guidance, and developing data standards and governance (including business rules) for privacy, analysis and reporting Expert at communicating insights, both verbally and through analytical reports and visualizations, and answering business questions with data

EA's Global Compensation team manages our core compensation programs and provides consultation to our HR partners and business leaders. We stay at the forefront of market trends and combine our knowledge of market practice with the needs of our business to create compelling, competitive, performance-oriented compensation programs that attract, engage, reward and retain EA's talent. Description We are looking for an accomplished analytics or systems expert with experience in and passion for Compensation. In this role leading Comp Operations for the team, you will automate processes, audit our data, own job architecture on behalf of the team, and manage data flows between systems. You are energized by using technology to create efficiencies, and improve operations and working partnerships. You work with and through others to improve systemic issues, learn from experiences, communicate solutions to decision-makers, and bring others along the journey on complex projects. You will report to EA's Senior Director of Global Compensation. Responsibilities You will be the internal expert regarding Compensation analytics, technology, operations, and processes for the company. You will develop the vision, design, and implementation plan for processes to increase efficiency of compensation team members, such as market analysis and job matching, budget development and planning, salary and equity range build. You will lead systems and analytics workstreams during the annual compensation planning process (aka Focal) with effective HRIS, People Analytics, and Talent & Performance team partnerships. You will be the primary contact with our HRIS team, overseeing Comp system integrations and managing data flows between Comp-related systems. Collaborate with HRIS on tool strategy, improvements and enhancements. Lead job architecture for the Comp team, partnering with the Talent & Performance and Workforce Planning teams. Lead Compensation reporting and analytics for our Focal, Talent Planning, and Executive Talent Review processes. Bring strategic partnership, analytical rigor, and change leadership to the budget planning process, including socialization of budget impacts on workforce planning and company operating expenses to executive leadership and business groups. Assess and audit proposed compensation outcomes such as pay gaps, short and long-term incentive provision, and equity participation, by department / location / employee demographics, to assess effectiveness, fairness, and compliance. Manage internal compensation team operations, relationships, and costs pertaining to vendor resourcing, contracts and renewals, survey providers, systems infrastructure, and yearly projects. Participate in relevant compensation surveys, and other vendor-led external events / forums, for benchmarking purposes, and to stay informed about market trends and their potentially applicability to EA's programs. Identify processes or capabilities that could benefit from automation, process enhancements or re-engineering Qualifications Bachelor's Degree- ideally in a business or quantitative field 8+ years of total work experience, with at least 3 years in compensation 5 or more years of experience with visualization tools like Tableau, PowerBI, or similar tools Superb Excel skills (can maintain complex spreadsheets) and data modeling / analytics capability. Demonstrated capability with partner management and experience developing and maintaining collaborative working relationships with multiple partners- including executives, line management, peers, and partners. Experienced in working with sensitive data, providing guidance, and developing data standards and governance (including business rules) for privacy, analysis and reporting Expert at communicating insights, both verbally and through analytical reports and visualizations, and answering business questions with data

Senior Manager, Compensation Operations Electronic Arts Remote N America Senior Manager, Compensation Operations Most companies call it HR. At Electronic Arts we made the deliberate decision to brand our organization People Experience (PE). It is not just a play on words. PE is a team of cultural stewards who carefully create programs and talent strategies that directly affect our teams' experience and allow our people to achieve the most meaningful work of their careers. Main Purpose of the Role The PLM Technical Operations Senior Release Manager is a part of the Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) function for delivering EA's franchises to market across all packaged goods, digital & mobile platforms. As a member of Global Operations, you will report to the Senior Manager and you will manage the delivery of content materials for EA's products to our channel partners, including Sony, Microsoft, Nintendo, PC, EA's PC platform, and digital resellers. You also maintain the daily relationship and communication with the First Party Account Management teams to guarantee the release of EA's content plan. You will work with Franchise Leads to set the plan with Studio and Publishing for content required for submission to support each product launch. The role partners with important teams (Franchise Operations, Studio/QA, Digital Sales/Marketing) and external Platform Partners to ensure product delivery through our Real-time Operations (RTO) team. You will also own comprehensive configuration plans to achieve the go to market strategies for your owned projects, following timelines that meet the Franchise Operations schedule. You will ensure understanding across the department for process, product and people. The Release Manager is also responsible for leading the education, development and promotion of external platform tools and systems required for the set up and submission to First Party platform holders. The role partners with EA Studios to ensure accurate set up of content with our platform holders and provides advice and platform guidance to the Commercial and Publishing organization. You will establish processes to develop the Operations team(s) to build expertise of our platform partners' processes, best practices for issue management, and technical knowledge to ensure our team are equipped to communicate and bring the requirements expected across all products. Main Responsibilities Submissions Program manage the submission process to coordinate and communicate submission activities to the assigned portfolios of platform partners, ensuring submission packages are of the highest integrity and punctuality Work directly with Franchise Operations Leads on assigned franchises for process, tools and longer ranging scenarios that improve the submissions process Maintain a complete understanding of all product schedule dependencies on a global scale, and communicate status updates to internal & external partners. Engage with studio personnel, Franchise Leads and EA Certification to establish submission schedules. Partner with and program manage Real-time Operations team in EA Romania and EA Hyderabad to ensure all activities are supported Platform Configuration Create and configure First Party & Platform Partner offers – full game, DLC, Beta, VC, Subscriptions and communicate First Party IDs to relevant internal parties. Provide knowledge and support to Studios to increase their understanding of the submission process, configurations, and requirements Partner with Franchise Operations management team on support for each Studio/Franchise plan Manage process documentation, ensuring it is up-to-date and fit for purpose, including referencing documentation needed for EA Studios to promote consistency of platform requirements Ensure all Global Operations tools and documents correctly reflect the content IDs and Platform Partner information as it pertains to product set up and configuration Participate in regular planning meetings and readouts with external platform partners and internal EA teams Scenario plan and inform partners on what can/can't be done for each configuration and determine the final suggested implementation Experience You have excellent written and verbal communication skills, and the ability to work with all important partners. You also have account/project management skills, be able to understand strategy and technology, and can bring the team to success. 3+ years of experience in product submissions, software configurations, platform setups, or equivalent 1+ years of experience working with remote teams and management Experience managing and working in a diverse environment Knowledge of the technical requirements of at least one console/gaming/retail manufacturer and associated tools/portal or equivalent Why Join Us? We collaborate with our studio teams and partners to create extraordinary new game experiences for our millions of players everywhere. We always celebrate and cultivate a culture of inclusivity & diversity. Medical, Vision, Dental, and Life insurance benefits, and Employee Assistance and Mental Health programs for all employees Flexible Hybrid work model New Parent Assistance programs, including Parental leave for all new parents and adoption assistance programs 401k and Employee Stock Purchase plans Yearly bonus eligibility Gender Pay Gap Reporting and Accountability Global Mentoring program Game Credits, Digital Reimbursement, and Console Reimbursement benefits Team and Social events, including a yearly holiday/winter party Employee-led affinity groups to foster equality in the workplace Charitable donation & volunteer hours gift matching program
