The Production Infrastructure organization provides the essential infrastructure and services that power many of EA's biggest games. Our charter is to make EA's games and services available to all players anytime and anywhere, and to enable developers to experiment and build new games quickly via rapid development in the cloud. We do this with our infrastructure and application management platform, built on Kubernetes. In all of this, we focus on being there for players where and when they want to play. As a Software Engineer, your primary responsibility will be to work collaboratively with a team of engineers to plan and execute on the software design and architecture of our new systems. Most of your time will be spent developing features and optimizing performance, robustness, and scalability of the production infrastructure platform. You will also spend time developing low toil automation tools and workflows in service of maintaining a large fleet of Kubernetes clusters. In this role, you will report to the Director of Engineering. Responsibilities You will maintain and contribute to a large-scale managed cloud service for EA games. You will evolve project statements into preliminary engineering designs. You will expand designs into engineering execution plans and engineering tasks. You will write code and meet peer-reviewed code standards. You will resolve defects during QA testing, load testing, and from the live environment You will engage with clients who use the services and features you create to complete user facing features. You will work with and contribute to the open-source software Kubernetes community. Qualifications Bachelors' degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent work experience. 4+ years of commercial development experience. Proficiency with an OO language. 6+ years of experience with a public cloud provider (AWS, Azure, GCP). 6+ years of experience building, deploying and operating high traffic services. 6+ years of experience with Kubernetes and containerized applications. Experience developing multi-threaded architecture in web and data technologies. Database experience with relational or NoSQL solutions.

Senior Solutions Architect At Electronic Arts, we exist to inspire the world to play. We consider our players' experiences first in everything we do. We create amazing experiences for players, fans, and our employees In this hybrid role based in Austin, the Bay Area, or Orlando you will report to the Sr Manager Engineering for Employee Experience in IT where you'll convert business requirements into technical architecture with a design that will be the blueprint for front-end applications and backend services. You'll be the technical program manager that leads with empathy while challenging the team to accomplish more. Responsibilities Organize and forecast development efforts, create detailed in-scope project plans, manage risk while driving a strategic technical vision throughout implementation. Manage product roadmaps, feature prioritization, project delivery, and technical solution architecture for both custom and packaged products. Produce detailed technical documentation, architecture, and workflow diagrams. Collaborate with partners to define technical product, program, and platform strategy, feature, short-term and long-term goals. Apply a data-driven approach to provide definition for a system, integrating user feedback and requirements into ongoing product experience updates. Requirements Understanding of cloud platform services such as AWS, Azure, and Google GCP. Experience architecting and developing in a server-less platform (e.g. AWS Lambda, Azure Functions, Google Cloud Functions). Proficient in Jira, Confluence, and diagram tools such as Visio and Omnigraffe. Understanding of architecture models and paradigms (e.g. TOGAF, SOA, function oriented architecture). General knowledge of: HTTP, SSL, DNS, Active Directory Forests and LDAP, MySQL, SQL, MySQL, MariaDB, Networking (routing, load balancing, firewalls, tcp/ip, udp), SSH, SCP, Windows and Linux server management, Python, and Node.js. Experience implementing SSO solutions such as Okta, NetIQ, Oracle, Sailpoint, and Dell One. B2B/B2C portfolio (5+ years), spanning both web and mobile, that reflect engineering excellence.

Senior Service Designer What does being a Sr. UX Design Strategist mean at EA World Wide Customer Experience? Do you geek out over understanding how things work? Do you consider yourself to be a highly collaborative & strategic thinker? Do you love a good challenge and opportunity to connect the dots in a meaningful way? If you answered yes, you might be up for the challenge of joining the EA customer experience design team to develop EA fan service designs. At EA, our Service Design team helps establish the standards for our support journeys through service design methodologies and provides a human-centered focus for all of our experience solutions. We help our organization see the big picture as end-users see it and offer tools to infuse design in all of our interactions. The Process and Experience Design team are looking for a systematic big thinker with Service Design talent, who is passionate about making the complex simple. The Service Designer will report to the Director of Experience Design. We lead a fan-centered approach to design with the goal to measurably improving experiences by reducing friction for our fans and employees. The team develops and leads the Service Design practice within our strategic framework, partnering with other teams to put humans at the center of our experiences. Responsibilities Lead co-creation workshops with partners to build service blueprints that allow the business to develop a supporting strategy to accomplish future experiences and mature how we work. Identify opportunities to improve experiences across different touch-points and explain the dependencies and complexities across these touch-points Create Service Design project plans, lead teams in the collaborative development of solutions using design thinking methodologies Perform user research in partnership with our Data Insights and UX teams Produce Service Design Blueprints, Journey maps, and Concept Designs, Service Experience prototypes, Empathy Maps, and Value Proposition Proposals, for the creation and evolution of services Gain an understanding of important challenges, and opportunities for our partners Manage a range of projects, defining project scope, goals, and deliverables in collaboration with partners Work with partners to ensure Product / Policy / Process / System solutions take account of global variances and our business needs Develop full understanding of the problem and goals for all users (depending on type of work - internal or player facing) and communicate how to allow the business to achieve designed solution Analyze and breakout work into executable parts (understanding resource dependencies, jobs to be done and what/how to achieve the blueprint cross-company) Use change management best practices to engage partners throughout the project lifecycle ensuring change is adopted and performed Qualifications Degree in Human-Computer Interactions, Design, Psychology, Organizational Design or related disciplines Expertise in Design Thinking/Service Design/Process Design 10+ years in working Service Design, Organizational Design or relevant equivalent Academic and applied knowledge in one of the following areas: Research, Visual Design, Prototyping, Business Design Experience with conceptualization, ideation, and iterative prototyping and experience employing multiple methods to prototype service concepts such as staging and role-playing approaches Knowledge of Customer Experience Design and its centrality to the future success of large organizations Project and people management skills. Experience functioning as a project leader and an individual contributor Experience organizing data into clear service design blueprints and communicating ideas and designs to diverse groups of partners Proficiency with design and prototyping tools such as Adobe, Miro, Sketch, InVision, or other similar tools used widely to visualize ideas Team player who has experience working within a self-directed culture and navigating ambiguity Socialize and lead change with service design methodologies by creating and promoting relationships and consulting on the practice with partners across EA Communication, analytical and interpersonal skills

jobTitle: Strategic Planning Intern, Worldwide Customer Experience (Summer 2023)
jobDescription: WWCE - Strategic Planning Intern (Summer 2023) Electronic Arts is looking for high performing students to join our world-class internship experience. Summer 2023 will be better than ever as we bring all interns together on-site for orientation week and prep students for the future ways of work by offering remote and hybrid opportunities depending on your location. For more information about our Next-Gen Program, visit https://www.ea.com/careers/interns-and-university-graduates EA’s Worldwide Customer Experience (WWCE) organization exists to inspire the world to play. We support players across the globe in 13+ languages. We value people who will bring new ideas and perspectives to help make WWCE a great place to be and be from. We celebrate diversity and inclusion . It’s just as important for us to create great experiences for our people as for our players. We’re looking for people that will come to the office (or Zoom meeting) excited to work and ready for some fun. You Will Perform high-visibility special projects that inform Leadership and enable decisions in our strategic plan Support the strategic planning lifecycle by: Providing insights into behavioral patterns and opportunities for improvement Conducting internal and industry research that can be used to enable strategic planning maturity Guiding initiative owners through the process of registering their work, gathering resources, and communicating intent and results across the lifecycle of their work Creating transparency through reporting and other communications Scheduling, agenda coordination, meeting room reservation, and preparatory work for recurring meetings and workshops You Have A passion for strategic planning, a drive for decision making frameworks and experience helping others achieve their long-term visions Ability to influence and inform using verbal and visual communication A desire to help others find the balance between data and intuition Consultation experience that resulted in creating team alignment, subject matter clarity and clear, actionable plans You’ll Get The opportunity to develop new skills by: Creating and managing strategic planning frameworks Developing business cases for high-visibility initiatives Practicing facilitation techniques Influencing decision-makers using a variety of tools and techniques Identifying sources of confusion and recommending process improvements You Are Available for a full-time paid internship in the summer of 2023 (May – September depending on start date) Legally authorized to work in the U.S. on a full time basis during the internship Enrolled in an accredited degree program in the summer of 2023, slated to graduate no earlier than December 2023 through June 2024 A US citizen or Permanent Resident Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Electronic Arts also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

Electronic Arts is looking for high performing students to join our world-class internship experience. Summer 2023 will be better than ever as we bring all interns together on-site for orientation week and prep students for the future ways of work by offering remote and hybrid opportunities depending on your location. For more information about our Next-Gen Program, visit https://www.ea.com/careers/interns-and-university-graduates Strategy Associate Intern (Summer 2023) The Strategy team works closely with EA’s executive leadership in shaping strategies to drive decision-making impact across the company. Projects may include business and product strategy with our game studios and game related initiatives, strategic planning, assessing new opportunities and partnerships, and market landscape assessments. The associate intern will have the opportunity to work across projects that support the c-suite, game studios, social, commercial, and technology organizations – based on interest and prior experience. Key Responsibilities Support high-visibility and impactful projects through hypothesis-driven strategic analysis Evaluate key consumer, game, technology, and market changes to identify emerging trends and assess their impact on EA’s strategy Explore competitive and industry dynamics and monitor EA’s performance in relation to the rest of the games industry Communicate and generate support for recommendations among business leaders Skills / Requirements Enrolled in a Bachelor's, Master’s, or MBA program Passion for problem-solving and answering complex business questions Ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment with ambiguity Excellent business writing and verbal communications, including delivery of presentations to senior leaders Be a curious and data-driven strategist Proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint required Strong interest in the games, media, sports, and/or entertainment industries Electronic Arts Inc. is a global leader in interactive entertainment. We develop and deliver games, content and online services across platforms. We have a broad portfolio of brands that span the most popular genres. We exist to Inspire the World to Play. We create extraordinary new game experiences for our millions of players everywhere by bringing together talented people that combine creativity, innovation, and passion. We immerse our employees into an inclusive culture and provide opportunities for learning and leading that allow our employees to do the most impactful and rewarding work of their careers. Join us in driving the next revolution in games.

jobTitle: Summer 2023: Commercial Internships (BA, BS, MS, MBA)
jobDescription: Electronic Arts is looking for high performing students to join our world-class internship experience. Summer 2023 will be better than ever as we bring all interns together on-site for orientation week and prep students for the future ways of work by offering remote and hybrid opportunities depending on your location. For more information about our Next-Gen Program, visit https://www.ea.com/careers/interns-and-university-graduates At Electronic Arts, we are bringing together the creativity, talent and technology to connect players and deliver amazing experiences in entertainment. We thrive on passion and pioneering. It’s the fuel that drives us to inspire the world to play. We make games that resonate with people around the world and believe inclusion transforms the player experience. Today, we have players in more than 200 countries that speak 40 languages. We’re not creating a workforce, we’re evolving one that really is representative of our diverse player network. If you’re interested in a thriving career at EA, join us in this journey! Our Global Commercial team is hiring for our Summer 2023 Intern Cohort. The Global Commercial team builds meaningful relationships with hundreds of millions of players around the world who love our games. We design and execute unparalleled commercial experiences for our players by building joined-up player journeys with our partners in an increasingly dynamic and diverse global landscape. This pipeline job posting is intended to collect candidate interest for multiple roles and hiring locations across our Commercial teams. Your application may be linked to a specific job upon further review. We are looking for Summer 2023 remote interns based in the US or Canada for long-term hiring opportunities tied to our following offices: Austin, TX Los Angeles, CA Orlando, FL Seattle, WA Vancouver, BC We are looking for candidates across every team in our Commercial Organization, including: Franchise Commercial Management -- EA Sports & EA Games Global Commercial Partner Management -- Playstation, Xbox, PC, and Subscriptions Global Commercial Operations Commercial Intelligence & Forecasting Commercial Ventures & Testing Lab You Are A self-starter, hard working, a good communicator, and 100% a team player Constantly learning, finding the balance between data and intuition Collaborative, have extensive experience working cross-functionally with multiple stakeholders, and are excited to work across organizations to drive impact Experienced in consulting or other strategy projects / roles (i.e. professional, extra-curricular, or academic) Requirements Must be available for a full-time 12-week paid internship in the summer of 2023 (May - September depending on start date). We are only considering students who will be enrolled in an accredited degree program in the summer of 2023, slated to graduate no earlier than December 2023 through June 2024. Applicants must be legally authorized to work in the US or Canada on a full time basis during the 12-week internship. Visa sponsorship is not available for this position. Qualifications Enrolled in a BA, BS, MS, or MBA program in Marketing, Communications, Business Administration, or a related field of study. Creative problem-solving skills Aptitude for quantitative and qualitative analysis Excellent written and interpersonal communication skills Excellent project management knowledge Rewards And Compensation EA offers a great compensation package, work from home support, medical benefits, and other exciting perks. Our 2022 Summer interns were invited to participate in more than 50 virtual events, along with receiving support from their managers, mentors, the Next-Gen Talent team, and employees across the company.

Our Global Commercial team is hiring for our Summer 2023 Intern Cohort. The Global Commercial team builds meaningful relationships with hundreds of millions of players around the world who love our games. We design and execute unparalleled commercial experiences for our players by building joined-up player journeys with our partners in an increasingly dynamic and diverse global landscape. This pipeline job posting is intended to collect candidate interest for multiple roles and hiring locations across our Commercial teams. Your application may be linked to a specific job upon further review. We are looking for Summer 2023 remote interns based in the US or Canada for long-term hiring opportunities tied to our following offices: Austin, TX Los Angeles, CA Orlando, FL Seattle, WA Vancouver, BC We are looking for candidates across every team in our Commercial Organization, including: Franchise Commercial Management -- EA Sports & EA Games Global Commercial Partner Management -- Playstation, Xbox, PC, and Subscriptions Global Commercial Operations Commercial Intelligence & Forecasting Commercial Ventures & Testing Lab You Are A self-starter, hard working, a good communicator, and 100% a team player Constantly learning, finding the balance between data and intuition Collaborative, have extensive experience working cross-functionally with multiple stakeholders, and are excited to work across organizations to drive impact Experienced in consulting or other strategy projects / roles (i.e. professional, extra-curricular, or academic) Requirements Must be available for a full-time 12-week paid internship in the summer of 2023 (May - September depending on start date). #WeAreEA and we exist to inspire the world to play. EA values creativity, pioneering, passion, determination, learning, and teamwork. We mean things like acting with curiosity, speaking up with original ideas, and committing to each other as one team. We're looking for all the best kinds of people to make great experiences for our players. The best people want a job that inspires them, while giving them room to enjoy their lives. And we want to give them that. We celebrate diversity and inclusion by creating a place where you can come to work and be yourself. Come join us! We're hiring a Technical Product Manager to join EA's Positive Play team. The Safe and Fair Play team defines the strategy for helping players stay safe and have a fair game across EA's products. We bring together practical experience eliminating and mitigating harmful & disruptive behaviors with technical expertise in developing high-scale, performant runtime systems. As a Technical Product Manager, you will guide the product roadmap for core features supporting Safe and Fair Play, collaborating with our partners to lead discovery and planning for new capabilities while enhancing and evolving our existing portfolio of services. You will report to the Director of Safe and Fair Play, engage directly with many of our game teams, and translate our vision & goals into a realistic delivery plan. Responsibilities Evaluate player feedback and market trends, analyze research, and measure product performance to understand game teams' needs and priorities. Create wireframes and workflows, write specs, and coordinate across teams to map player journeys, write problem statements, and propose updates to current products or brand new products that support the Safe and Fair Play product vision. Develop guidelines, prioritization tools, and best practices to help game teams achieve their goals for safe and fair play. Lead player-focused product delivery for new services and capabilities in close collaboration with partners and game teams, ensuring transparency through regular communication about feature releases and work-in-progress. Qualifications 4+ years of Product Management experience Experience in the Trust & Safety space Experience developing and refining a strategic vision paired with a product roadmap Experience gathering input, communicating a strategy and creating shared plans with partners Experience visualizing and explaining complex experiences and workflows using tools like Miro, Figma or similar Experience working with technical teams to ensure the products they build meet the needs of the partners and customers that use them Experience with data-informed product design

Electronic Arts Inc. is leading the future of entertainment. We develop and deliver games, content and online services across platforms. We have a broad portfolio of brands that span the most popular genres. We exist to Inspire the World to Play. We create extraordinary new game experiences for our millions of players everywhere by bringing together experienced people that combine creativity, innovation, and passion. We immerse our employees into an inclusive culture and provide opportunities for learning and leading that allow our employees to do the most impactful and rewarding work of their careers. Join us in driving the next revolution in games. The Vice President of Corporate Communications will lead EA's corporate communications team to serve as a strategic enabler of the business, helping to drive overall brand valuation and positive reputation. To break through in today's ultra-cluttered content and media environment, there is a clear advantage to company storytelling being narrative-driven versus transactional and episodic. The VP of Corporate Communications will develop compelling and inspiring narratives that articulates our vision of leading the future of entertainment, instilling confidence and belief in EA's long-term strategy, our people and culture. You will lead EA storytelling to a wide range of audiences, including our players, employees, investors, media and, governance and regulatory bodies, focused on enhancing and protecting our brand and reputation . You will be a hybrid/onsite role in Redwood City, CA. Reporting to the SVP, Brand, Communications and Impact, this communications leader will provide strategic counsel to C-Suite and lead a talented corporate communications team. We are looking for an executive who is a strategist, as well as a hands-on leader, with experience in aligning an organization's goals, values, motivations, and commitment to achieve shared success. You will have at least ten (10+) years of experience and be a dynamic, influential, leader who builds partnership and relationships across the enterprise. You will be asked to develop teams. And you will have familiarity with the technology, media, gaming or entertainment sectors. In This Role You Will Lead a Corporate Communications team that can create high impact programs globally to deliver measurable business outcomes, brand value and positive reputation Create company narratives that showcase our purpose, values and growth levers, taking into consideration industry trends, product beats and cultural moments Lead the strategic development of an enterprise corporate communications strategy with "always on" media and storytelling engines Build programs supporting corporate business media programs, financial communications, executive communications and thought leadership, ESG and DE&I communications Provide communications counsel and activate diverse voices to amplify company stories to build brand value; create custom narratives through a combination of earned and owned media, speaking and social channels. Partner with Corporate business partners to tell EA's company story, rooted in our purpose and values Partner with Franchise and Studio Communications leaders to ensure aligned goals, communications strategies and narratives that mutually support EA corporate programs, as well as games/studio/franchise business goals Manage internal and agency teams to ensure understanding of priorities, ensuring consistency of narratives and media strategies globally Lead teams and communications strategies in support of business growth, while managing ongoing issues and reputation risks (regulatory, legal, etc.) Provide leadership and mentoring to team members, partnering with peers to build healthy teams. Requirements Experience developing and leading global teams of Corporate Communications professionals within the entertainment, online/tech, and/or games industry. Experience leading rapid response, issues and crises to mitigate against business and reputation risks Demonstrated capability of working with and influencing executive teams Business financial literacy and experience leading financial communications with investor relations and finance on financial communications strategy and messaging Experience developing brand & reputation/PR campaigns to influence, advance and shape public opinions Experience monitoring industry conversations public relations and political trends, threats, and opportunities and to develop powerful strategies to address them

Virtualization and Cloud Engineer Description EA is looking for a highly motivated & experienced Virtualization and cloud Engineer with a strong understanding of cloud computing and Virtual technologies. You should provide support of complex systems running VMware vSphere v7x and infrastructure/applications hosted on AWS/Azure. You will assist in the development and modernization of our software products. You must be proficient with microservices architecture and container platforms leveraging Kubernetes and Docker containers Must have 8+ years of progressive, technical experience. You must function with limited direction and guidance. Must be able to work in a team environment, demonstrate leadership skills, follow established business processes and procedures, prepare knowledge documentation SOP's, and perform changes and preventative maintenance to ensure the smooth day-to-day operation of EA's computing environment. Acting as an SME (Subject Matter Expert) for the support teams responsible for maintaining a scalable and resilient infrastructure to support the needs of teams across EA Acting as SME for the operation of resilient distributed systems that run across multiple data Center and cloud providers Directly influence our journey towards zero-touch, highly scalable, reliable infrastructure. Direct involvement in incidents or problems that cause service impact and act as escalation point for incidents that impact Virtualization and Cloud infrastructure platforms Automate, optimize and drive efficiency of effort, code, and process. Resolve complex technical issues and drive innovations that improve system availability, resilience, and performance. Create, maintain and share technical documentation used by engineers and other team members. Provide mentorship to other team members and partner with other SMEs across the organization Training and completing knowledge transfer sessions with appropriate other teams within IT Operations Skills/Experience The experience of a 24x7 production operations environment, preferably supporting a highly available environment for a large multinational organization. Experience deploying and managing resources in AWS or Azure or Google cloud platforms in a production setting. Expert knowledge of Virtualization Technologies and associated services (specifically VMware, VMware on Cloud, skyline, and VROPS) ESXi infra-Management (Virtual Machines, VMTools, Migrations, backups, templates etc.) ESXi hosts Security updates and Virtual Machine HW version updates Upgrade – ESXi, vCenter appliance Experience with orchestration tools that support the automated delivery of enterprise platforms Good knowledge of scripting languages such as Python, PowerShell and BASH etc. Experience working in a hybrid environment of cloud and on-premise enterprise applications Experience with Infrastructure automation tools like terraform, vault, nomad and sentinel Design, build & maintain large scale high performing, secure Kubernetes and other application platform infrastructure on AWS & Azure Experience with AWS monitoring and alerting tools. Experience with Docker and Kubernetes experience / AWS EKS in a production setting. Experience containerizing applications, deploying, and maintaining them Experience migrating on-prem infrastructure to cloud. Knowledge of AWS IaaS and PaaS services. Experience with enterprise-level applications and cloud-based services, in AWS, Azure, Google Strong understanding of system and networking concepts and troubleshooting techniques. Strong communication and coordination skills with different teams within IT Strong interpersonal and teaming skills - ability to set and enforce process and influence engineers who are not direct reports Ability to operate in an agile and dynamic environment Ability to multi-task, managing multiple tasks at one time; quickly and accurately shifting attention among multiple tasks under distracting conditions without loss of accuracy. Demonstrated ability to quickly resolve the incidents and upkeep the service availability. Ability to articulate end-to-end technical requirements across delivery functions. Excellent verbal and written communication, interpersonal, conflict resolution and customer service skills. Able to analyze complex cross-functional and cross-platform issues. Good capabilities around capacity planning and analysis. Knowledge of ITIL process Able to define process improvements. Understands systems dependencies and interrelation to the business. Professionalism in dealing with all levels of management and staff. Value Add Enterprise Linux systems Management using RedHat Satellite and Ansible Tower Strong admin and troubleshooting skills to manage Linux systems (LVM, users and Group management, NFS, web services like apache and tomcat, kernel upgrade etc.) Experience with Linux and/or Unix Systems administration tools and frameworks/tools (such as Ansible, Chef, Puppet, etc) VMware certified would be an advantage AWS Certified Professional preferred ITIL Certification would be an advantage Redhat Linux Certification

Resolve complex technical issues and drive innovations that improve system availability, resilience, and performance. Create, maintain and share technical documentation used by engineers and other team members. Provide mentorship to other team members and partner with other SMEs across the organization Training and completing knowledge transfer sessions with appropriate other teams within IT Operations Skills/Experience The experience of a 24x7 production operations environment, preferably supporting a highly available environment for a large multinational organization. Experience deploying and managing resources in AWS or Azure or Google cloud platforms in a production setting. Expert knowledge of Virtualization Technologies and associated services (specifically VMware, VMware on Cloud, skyline, and VROPS) ESXi infra-Management (Virtual Machines, VMTools, Migrations, backups, templates etc.) ESXi hosts Security updates and Virtual Machine HW version updates Upgrade – ESXi, vCenter appliance Experience with orchestration tools that support the automated delivery of enterprise platforms Good knowledge of scripting languages such as Python, PowerShell and BASH etc. Experience working in a hybrid environment of cloud and on-premise enterprise applications Experience with Infrastructure automation tools like terraform, vault, nomad and sentinel Design, build & maintain large scale high performing, secure Kubernetes and other application platform infrastructure on AWS & Azure Experience with AWS monitoring and alerting tools. Experience with Docker and Kubernetes experience / AWS EKS in a production setting. Experience containerizing applications, deploying, and maintaining them Experience migrating on-prem infrastructure to cloud. Knowledge of AWS IaaS and PaaS services. Experience with enterprise-level applications and cloud-based services, in AWS, Azure, Google Strong understanding of system and networking concepts and troubleshooting techniques. Strong communication and coordination skills with different teams within IT Strong interpersonal and teaming skills - ability to set and enforce process and influence engineers who are not direct reports Ability to operate in an agile and dynamic environment Ability to multi-task, managing multiple tasks at one time; quickly and accurately shifting attention among multiple tasks under distracting conditions without loss of accuracy. Demonstrated ability to quickly resolve the incidents and upkeep the service availability. Ability to articulate end-to-end technical requirements across delivery functions. Excellent verbal and written communication, interpersonal, conflict resolution and customer service skills. Able to analyze complex cross-functional and cross-platform issues. Good capabilities around capacity planning and analysis. Knowledge of ITIL process Able to define process improvements. Understands systems dependencies and interrelation to the business. Professionalism in dealing with all levels of management and staff. Value Add Enterprise Linux systems Management using RedHat Satellite and Ansible Tower Strong admin and troubleshooting skills to manage Linux systems (LVM, users and Group management, NFS, web services like apache and tomcat, kernel upgrade etc.) Experience with Linux and/or Unix Systems administration tools and frameworks/tools (such as Ansible, Chef, Puppet, etc) VMware certified would be an advantage AWS Certified Professional preferred ITIL Certification would be an advantage Redhat Linux Certification

jobTitle: VP Employee Technology and Customer Success
jobDescription: Electronic Arts Inc. is a global leader in interactive entertainment. We develop and deliver games, content and online services across platforms. We have a broad portfolio of brands that span the most popular genres. We exist to Inspire the World to Play. We create extraordinary new game experiences for our millions of players everywhere by bringing together talented people that combine creativity, innovation, and passion. We immerse our employees and teams into an inclusive culture and provide opportunities for learning and leading that allow our employees to do the most impactful and rewarding work of their careers. Join us in driving the next revolution in games! Team Overview EA's Information Technology organization (EAIT) is a global team that empowers EA's players, employees, business processes, and operations to be creative, collaborative, and productive. As a digital entertainment company, EA's IT needs are broad - and include technology for game development, workforce productivity & collaboration, marketing, commercial, customer support, enterprise security, and corporate business functions. Our mission is to bring innovative technology experiences to each of these areas, working across the company to "Enable Better Play." We are helping to reimagine how technology enables distributed game development on a global scale. We're working with our customer experience, marketing, and competitive gaming teams to power experiences for EA players and fans. We're deploying technology and services that are changing how we create, connect and collaborate at EA office locations and beyond. Position Summary EA has an exciting opportunity for a leader of people, processes, and technology to join our IT organization as Vice President of Employee Technology and Product Success. Reporting to the CIO, you will lead a growing global team of over 130 employees, supported by a contingent workforce. You will drive adoption, customer success, and continuous improvement strategies for IT products and services supporting the EA workforce - including game creation, employee experience applications, and related infrastructure. Working in an inclusive, collaborative, and global work environment, you’ll ensure that IT products and services support EA’s goals, its teams, and locations worldwide. That work requires building collaborative relationships with EA's studio, teams, and senior leadership and forging relationships with peer technology organizations, including IT product/program management, application, infrastructure engineering, quality, and operations. Responsibilities Lead and build a global team of 130+ professionals, aligning the team's work to EA strategy, related technology, and IT's strategic and operational goals. Set the strategy for global support of EA's workforce and their use of employee productivity, game development, and infrastructure technologies. Build partnerships with product and studio teams to ensure high quality IT technology and service experiences for our internal customers, achieving customer enablement goals. Create partnerships within the IT organization to achieve shared technology and innovation goals connected to EA’s business strategy and growth. Lead the transformation from a site and region-focused technology team into a global product and customer success organization relevant to all work modalities, including onsite, remote, and hybrid. Develop strategies for game development technology support and adoption within EA's studio teams. Balance and align local and business unit needs with EA shared technology goals. Scale, optimize and automate IT support processes for a growing and distributed workforce - including new hire provisioning, 3rd party onboarding, desktop support and endpoint management, local infrastructure maintenance and support, and others. Partner with IT infrastructure engineering and operations teams to support EA's local network, compute, and storage technologies, aligning them to cloud transformation goals and timelines where and when appropriate. Develop global rollout, and adoption plans for employee experience and game creation technologies in partnership with IT's product management, program management, engineering, and central operations teams. Provide great customer experiences by anticipating and acting on portfolio-wide customer issues and trends related to Employee Experience technology and Game Creation / Game Development technology. Inclusively grow global team members in skills and career development. Manage a ~$37M global budget with fiscal stewardship and operational efficiency. As a CIO Staff member, work in collaboration with fellow leaders to grow and advance EAIT’s vision, strategy, and objectives. Qualifications You will demonstrate a strong background in global and transformational team leadership, customer and product success initiatives, operations-related experience, and technology experience, including familiarity with enterprise application and infrastructure solutions. You will have also demonstrated inclusive people, technical and operational leadership, and an ability to create partnerships with internal teams and key business partners in service of an important objective or strategy. Ten or more years of experience building a customer engagement model and team. Ten or more years of experience in information technology services and support or related/equivalent field of work. A passion for customer needs and a customer focus: responsive to the needs of our studios and customers while building toward an overall excellent technology experience for EA. Collaborate and align across various opinions and interests; experience in meeting individual BU/team needs while promoting shared technology strategies and efficiency goals.. Successful and progressive career development in global and complex organizations. Experience embracing and leading transformation efforts and associated talent development. The ability as a leader to inspire and motivate others through conviction, vision, and articulate direction; is accomplished in the analysis and definition of goals, direction setting, and the interpretation of goals into specific initiatives and tasks. Someone who questions why things are done and applies /experiences to resolve issues. Collaboratively resolve issues, reduce roadblocks, and meet business, financial, and management goals. Education: A college degree in computer science, information systems, engineering, business administration, mathematics, or a related/equivalent major is required.

Vice President-Development Operations This VP role, reporting to the COO, Studios leads a team that creates and administers processes that create the best development practices and outcomes. This team will create portfolio views of our overall business and guide analysis to balance risk across projects and content teams. You will partner with innovation leaders across the company to ensure that EA games set the standard for quality and new ideas. Additionally, you will develop systems to artfully manage resources across EA Studios. You will have a mix of business, technical, and managerial experience from the PC, Console, Mobile and Live Services arenas. This position can be remote or hybrid from an EA office. Responsibilities You will create executive visibility and ensure agreement on portfolio status, opportunities and risk mitigations You will manage review process for early phase/incubation projects to improve high quality creative innovation. You will lead and cultivate the Development Operations community, continuing to push the boundaries of the craft. Promote transformative strategic programs across Studios, including development and socialization of best practices related to knowledge/information management, efficiency and predictability. You will improve resource management allocations related to product development and launch processes and services; including exploration of more fungible resourcing models, enhanced internal talent sharing and striking the right balance between full-time and flexible staffing models. Requirements 10 years of experience with broad strategic operational planning—delivering quality product within agreed upon time frames and budgets. 5 years of experience within games and entertainment, understanding game development cycles, complexities of production and business' nuances while partnering and influencing with quality verification, CTO, analytics and Finance. You have credibility building skills with many different departments of the business. You have experience leading in a global organization(s) with multi-location development

Promote transformative strategic programs across Studios, including development and socialization of best practices related to knowledge/information management, efficiency and predictability. You will improve resource management allocations related to product development and launch processes and services; including exploration of more fungible resourcing models, enhanced internal talent sharing and striking the right balance between full-time and flexible staffing models. Requirements 10 years of experience with broad strategic operational planning—delivering quality product within agreed upon time frames and budgets. 5 years of experience within games and entertainment, understanding game development cycles, complexities of production and business' nuances while partnering and influencing with quality verification, CTO, analytics and Finance. You have credibility building skills with many different departments of the business. You have experience leading in a global organization(s) with multi-location development

Vice President-Development Operations This VP role, reporting to the COO, Studios leads a team that creates and administers processes that create the best development practices and outcomes. This team will create portfolio views of our overall business and guide analysis to balance risk across projects and content teams. You will partner with innovation leaders across the company to ensure that EA games set the standard for quality and new ideas. Additionally, you will develop systems to artfully manage resources across EA Studios. You will have a mix of business, technical, and managerial experience from the PC, Console, Mobile and Live Services arenas. This position can be remote or hybrid from an EA office.
